loans.name: Caterine Patricia

texts.es:
Ella es Caterine vive hace 10  años en la ciudad es una mujer emprendedora y con ganas de salir delante, ella tiene una familia muy bonita tiene a su esposo y su hija de 9 años.
Siempre le ha gustado estudiar, sus padres Joaquin y Patricia le dieron la oportunidad de cursar sin ningún contratiempo la primaria y el bachillerato de los que tiene recuerdos muy gratos como, ser una muy buena alumna, haber participado en diversas actividades deportivas, en danzas, banda marcial ,etc. sus padres a pesar de ser separados hace mucho tiempo le inculcaron valores muy importantes como: apreciar todo lo que la vida le pueda ofrecer, así mismo ella siguió sus estudios y presento exámenes de admisión en la universidad Autónoma para seguir con la carrera profesional de Odontología donde tuvo éxito y pudo empezar sus estudios como ella lo había soñado; sin embargo como la vida suele tener altibajos su mama cabeza de familia de cuatro hijos  quien era la proveedora económica de su estudio no pudo seguir apoyándola y así ella dejo de estudiar  odontología.
Mas adelante ella misma con sus ingresos laborales pago y realizo  una serie de diplomados para  poder mejorar de alguna manera su perfil laboral y académico, Caterine nunca dejo de tener como meta terminar sus estudios o cursar una carrera profesional así que como muchos en esta vida trabaja junto con su esposo fuertemente para poder estudiar Contabilidad financiera. Ella sabe que poco a poco, peldaño por peldaño se llega a la sima y que con el apoyo de su familia y el empeño que ella le ponga, su sueño finalmente se hará realidad.
Una de las cosas mas importantes para Caterine es mostrarle a su hija y a muchos que la edad  y los hijos no son inconvenientes para llegar a la meta.
Ella sabe que con el pasar del tiempo y con la experiencia que dan los años pudo enfocarse con mayor seriedad y responsabilidad en lo que hoy es su prioridad después de su familia y es llegar a obtener la tarjeta profesional no en odontología como ella escogió en un principio sino como contadora y especializarse en finanzas, como su vida y vivencias le han mostrado que es lo que realmente ella sabe hacer. 
Ella sin duda alguna da gracias por que ha disfrutado la vida de manera que no se arrepiente de todo lo que ha hecho  que sin duda alguna la han formado en su carácter, responsabilidad, respeto y conciencia. Caterine solo espera poder contar con salud, una mejoría económica y laboral para llegar a su nueva meta pero no al final de su vida; ya que piensa que tiene muchos sueños por cumplir y muchas metas por alcanzar, sin duda alguna ella y su gran corazón la llevaran muy lejos.
texts.en:
Caterine has lived in the city for ten years; she’s an enterprising woman who very much wants to get ahead.  She has a lovely family: a husband and a nine-year-old daughter.

She’s always enjoyed studying.  Her parents, Joaquín and Patricia, gave her the opportunity to attend elementary and high school problem-free and she has very pleasant memories of those days like being a very good student, of participating in various sports activities, in dances, in the marching band, etc.  Despite her parents being separated, they always instilled in her very important values like the appreciation for everything life can provide for her.  She continued her studies and took the admission tests for the Autonomous University to continue a professional career in dentistry where she was successful and was able to start her studies like she wanted to.  However, as life is wont to do, there were highs and lows.  Her mother, who was head of household with four children and provided economically for her studies, was unable to continue doing so and she had to drop out of the dentistry program.

Later on with her own income earned at work she took a series of courses to be able to improve her work and academic profiles.  Caterine never stopped aiming at finishing her studies leading to a professional degree so like many others she works hard alongside her husband in order to be able to study financial accounting.  She knows that little by little, climbing up step by step, one reaches the summit and that with support from her family and the effort she herself puts into it her dream will finally become reality.

One of the most important things for Caterine is to show her daughter and many others that age and having children is no obstacle to reach one’s goals.

She knows that with the passage of time and with the experience years provides one can focus more seriously and responsibly on what one's priorities are today which besides her family are to attain her professional degree not in her original choice of dentistry perhaps but as an accountant specializing in finance which life and her life experiences have shown her to be what she’s really good at.

Without a doubt, she’s thankful for everything she’s enjoyed in life and she does not regret anything she’s done for it has all led to forming her character: responsibility, respect and conscience.

Caterine only hopes to be in good health and to improve her economy and her work so that she can reach a new goal.  But this isn’t the end; she believes she still has many dreams to reach and many goals to attain.  Undoubtedly she and her great heart will go far.

loans.use: to finish her financial accounting coursework.

loans.name: Fanny

texts.es:
Fanny habita en la ciudad de Barranquilla, lugar donde hace 5 años inició su propio negocio, basado en productos que vende mediante guías especializadas o catálogos que le ofrecen grandes instituciones comerciales. Su idea de negocio inició cuando al quedar viuda,  requirió obtener ingresos que le sirvieran para sostener a sus tres hijos; los principales productos de su oferta son los  perfumes, cremas, prendas de plata etc. 
Su actividad comercial inició  dirigida a sus vecinas más cercanas y a su familia, pero poco a poco la ha ido extendiendo a diversos sectores de la comunidad. En la actualidad planea incrementar sus ventas, para dar respuesta a la demanda del mercado, pero sus ingresos no son suficientes para extenderse e incrementar sus ingresos tanto como ella quisiera;  esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace  a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará perfumería, productos de higiene personal, entre otros artículos que ha definido al hacer su preventa. Su meta es aportarle cada vez mas a los ingresos familiares y su mayor desafío es tener suficiente recurso financiero para crecer rápidamente.
texts.en:
Fanny lives in the city of Barranquilla.  Five years ago, she set up her own business here selling products through specialized magazines or catalogs from large commercial institutions.  Her business idea came about when she was widowed and found herself needing to make income in order to support her three children.  She mainly sells perfumes, creams and silver jewelry.  

At first, Fanny would sell her products to her closest neighbors and family members but she gradually expanded into other areas of her community.  She currently plans to increase her sales and meet market demand.  However, her income isn't enough to expand and increase her sales as much as she would like.  For this reason, she is requesting a Kiva loan (her first loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo).  She will buy perfumes, personal care products and other products that she has pre-sold.  Her goal is to contribute more and more towards her family income.  Her biggest challenge is having enough financial resources available to grow her business quickly.

loans.use: to buy perfumes and personal care products

loans.name: Jenny Andrea

texts.es: Es una mujer de 28 años con 2 hijos uno de ellos con autismo vive en unión libre el no es el padre de sus hijos, ellos  pagan arriendo, colegio de los niños, comida, gastos diarios entre los dos , su suegra la mama de su esposo tiene 60 años ella le colabora para pagar en la institución ya que ellos no pueden  por los gastos que tienen; su  esposo trabaja por días y no tiene un sueldo fijo y ella  gana el  mínimo, que prácticamente es lo del arriendo donde viven. Su suegra le colabora con lo de la  carrera pero ella ya está un poco mal de salud y hay momentos que ella siente pena pues ella no es la abuela de los niños, sin embargo, ella le ayuda y quisiera el préstamo para que no le toque tan pesado a ella y de cierta manera que ustedes le ayudaran a ella ya que por ella y por ustedes podría sacar su carrera para un futuro mejor para los niños y más el de Nicolás pues él tiene autismo leve, y no ha podido llevarlo a un instituto o colegio para él, que sea especializado, los gastos de la casa son altos y tratamos de que no se les agranden los servicios y mantener el arriendo al día, en el mercado compran lo  básico y poco y sin poder  darles lujos de salidas o cosas especiales para los niños y ellos, la suegra también le colabora en el mercado la mayoría de veces
texts.en:
Jenny is 28 and has two children, one of whom is autistic. She lives in a free union; her partner is not the father of her children. Together they pay for rent, the children's education, food, and other daily expenses. Her mother-in-law is 60 and helps them pay expenses that they otherwise could not meet. Her partner is a day laborer and does not have a fixed income. Jenny earns a minimum wage, which barely covers the rent. 

Her mother-in-law has helped pay Jenny's education expenses, but she is not feeling well. At times, she feels sorry for them. Though she isn't the children's grandmother, she helps Jenny and hopes she secures a loan so that her burden isn't so great. In a way, she wants them to help her.

If Jenny can finish her professional program, she could offer her children a brighter future, especially for Nicolás, who is autistic. She has not been able to find a specialized institution or school for him. The household expenses are high, and they try to keep services in line and pay the daily rent. They shop just for basic items and aren't able to go out or buy special things for the children and themselves. Her mother-in-law helps them buy things in the market most of the time.

loans.use: to finish the nurse assistant program.

loans.name: Esperanza Divina 4 Group

texts.en:
Argentina is the coordinator of her group, Esperanza Divina (Divine Hope) 4. This group is located in Hato Mayor, a rural town where the economy is based around agriculture. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her two children. She is a divorced woman.

Argentina sells miscellaneous products like clothes, shoes, cosmetics, and others. She started her business with some savings and by taking credits from different suppliers. This is how she financed her business until she was invited to a meeting where her neighbors explained about Esperanza International and this program. She was very excited and took out her first loan to invest in her business. That was almost five years ago. Now, she is taking her ninth loan with Esperanza International.

Argentina is excited to be taking this loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans. She is planning to use it to increase her inventory. She is running a 'Fantasia' (a small miscellaneous product store). She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy miscellaneous products like clothes, shoes, cosmetics and others.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam is a 40-year-old married woman with four children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She is a very hardworking farmer who grows tea that she directly sells to the factory in the neighborhood. With the proceeds she has been able to venture into dairy farming and pay school fees for her children. Like most farmers she has challenges of unpredictable weather changes and high cost of operations while her dream is to expand her tea plantation and become the leading grower. Mariam intends to use the loan to buy land for farming.

loans.use: to buy land for farming.

loans.name: Nidal

texts.en:
Nidal is a 24-year-old married man and a father with one son.  

For the past year, Nidal has been driving a taxi, which has been a profitable project and the only source of income for the family. Nidal is requesting a 1,000 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the cost of purchasing a new engine for the taxi he drives. This will increase the taxi's capacity to work extra hours and enable Nidal to take additional internal and external requests, which will improve the family's income positively.

Nidal appears in Kiva profile.

loans.use: to purchase a new engine for his taxi

loans.name: Adel

texts.en:
Adel is a 28-year-old married man.  For the past three years, Adel has had a mini-market selling different types of food.  It has been a profitable project, but not enough to cover his costs.

Adel is requesting a 2,000 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the cost of purchasing needed stock that customers often request such as rice, sugar and milk. This will increase sales and increase Adel's income.

Adel appears in his mini-market.

loans.use: to buy more stocks for his minimarket

loans.name: Amiri

texts.en: Amiri is a twenty-eight-year-old married man with one child living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. Since 2007 he has been running a retail shop but also grows cocoa as his primary activity. Good father that he is, he desires to educate his child up to the university and set up sustainable, income-generating activities despite inadequate capital. Amiri intends to use the loan to buy general merchandise such as salt and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise such as salt and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Yvrose

texts.en:
Yvrose lives in Port Salut, Haiti, about a 5-hour drive from the capital Port-au-Prince. She already has a business selling mobile phones and phone credit. She has started to sell clean energy products with EarthSpark as clean energy entrepreneur.
With the help of a Kiva loan last year, she was set up with a “Business in a Bag”, a kit containing a personalized mix of small-scale clean energy products, marketing materials and training on energy literacy, SMS tracking of sales, and basic business skills.  She sold out of her products so quickly that she has paid off her loan and is now coming back to us for another loan. This time, she would like to continue her business and is asking for a new loan. With this money, she will continue to sell solar desk lamps and efficient stoves.

loans.use: to purchase stock for a clean energy business.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Doña carmen se dedica a la venta de pescado seco desde hace varios años en diferentes mercados de la zona vive con su esposo que es comerciante de plastico y con sus dos hijos que estudian, con la venta que realiza puede sacar adelante a sus hijos y poder pagar las gastos que tiene en su hogar, ella solicita credito para poder comprar mas mercaderia pescado fresco y oreado ya que tiene mucha demanda y asi poder seguir teniendo mejores ganancias y darle a su familia una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Doña Carmen has had a business selling dried fish at different markets in the area for several years. She lives with her husband, who sells plastics, and her two children, who are in school. Her sales enable her to help her children get ahead and pay household expenses.

She is requesting a loan in order to purchase more fresh and dried fish merchandise because there is a big demand for it. Thus she will be able to continue earning more profits and providing a better life for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fish.

loans.name: Resistencia 1, 2, 3 & 4 Group

texts.en:
Ylena is the coordinator of her group "Resistencia 1, 2, 3 & 4" ("Resistance"). The group is located in the rural area of San Pedro de Macoris, surrounded by sugar cane fields. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her three children. She is a single mother. Her most difficult challenge has been to raise her children and educate them.

Ylena is excited to be seeking her first loan with Esperanza International Dominican Republic. She started doing business almost two years ago, walking with a bag of clothing, cosmetics, and shoes. 

Ylena plans to use this loan to invest in her business and she will buy cosmetics and women's accessories. She will also increase her inventory by buying miscellaneous items. She will use her business profits to reinvest in her business. She thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and women's accessories to sell.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud is a 19-year-old single young man. His mother is a worker with a very low income that barely cover the family needs. Mahmoud is a university student who wants to complete his studies, so he is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the cost of purchasing a new laptop. This will help Mahmoud to do his homework and reports and help him in his studies. This will ensure a better future for Mahmoud and improve the family's living conditions. Mahmoud is photographed at the store where he purchased the laptop.

loans.use: to pay for a new laptop

loans.name: Jamal

texts.en:
Jamal is 32 years old, a married man and a father with one son. For the past three years, Jamal has been raising and selling sheep and sheep products, which has been a profitable project, but also needs more support to cover the family's needs.

Jamal is requesting a 2,000 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the cost of purchasing more sheep and expanding and improving the herd's condition. This will increase sales and improve the family's income.

Jamal appears in in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the cost of purchasing more sheep

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: Francisco tiene 29 años de edad, es casado,  él vive con su familia en una casita muy humilde que con mucho esfuerzo lograron construir. Desde muy pequeño se dedico a trabajar en la agricultura junto a su padre y hermanos donde fue aprendiendo a cultivar diferentes productos como papa, cebolla, maní, frejol etc.; Francisco vivía  en la casa de sus padres junto a su familia, sin embargo decidió independizarse y trasladarse a su casa propia, para ya no depender más de sus padres y cuidar de su propia familia. Francisco está solicitando este crédito para comprar semillas, abono químico y agroquímicos, así empezar su propia producción agrícola y mejorar su calidad de vida; el  trabaja en  pequeñas parcelas que tiene con toda su familia. También tiene la clara idea de que con este crédito mejorara las condiciones, solvencia económica y que en las próximas oportunidades realizara inversiones con créditos mayores que le permitirán emprender negocios con utilidades de mayor valor económico.
texts.en:
Francisco is 29 years old and married. He lives with his family in a very modest house that was built with great effort. From a very young age, he has been farming with his father and his siblings. This is how he learned to cultivate different products such as potatoes, onions, peanuts, beans, and other crops.

Francisco had lived at his parents’ house along with his own family, but he decided that he wanted to be independent, so he and his family moved into a house of their own. He is requesting a loan in order to buy seeds, chemical fertilizers, and agrochemicals. Francisco plans to start producing his own crops so that he can improve his quality of life. He works on small parcels of land that he shares with his entire family. Francisco has a clear idea that this loan will improve his conditions and his financial solvency. With upcoming opportunities, he plans to invest larger loans so that he can establish profitable businesses that have great economic value.

loans.use: to buy seeds (onions, carrots, and beans), chemical fertilizers, and agrochemicals.

loans.name: Inocencia

texts.en:
Inocencia is one of our associates from the Hato Mayor branch, a rural town whose economy depends on agriculture. She has been running her business for five years, cooking for her business which is a fried food stall,  where she sells chicken, beef, fried rounds make of dough, fried plantains and other fried food.

Inocencia will purchase meat, cooking oil, plantains, seasoning and other goods. She will use this loan to buy all the goods also to save capital to buy any utensils or equipment. Inocencia is still a single women and what she wants most is to have her family. She enjoys working and cooking.

Inocencia is very excited to be receiving her eighth loan from Esperanza Internacional. She is very thankful to have received this loan from Esperanza because she will improve her sales. She plans to save the profits for future reinvestment. She thanks you all for your support!

loans.use: To buy meat, cooking oil, plantains, potatoes, flour, etc.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel has a wife and two children. This hardworking man is a computer technician, and his business is a repair center. He found the need to do service in his community and used his knowledge to serve people and sell them the parts they need to have better equipment. He will use this loan to buy computers from brand outlets. 

Emmanuel is excited to be taking out his 7th loan with Kiva partner, Esperanza, after having successfully repaid his previous loan and grown his business. He will use the profits to invest in his business and save to start building his house.

Emmanuel became interested in and motivated others to join Esperanza because of the good things he heard that it was doing in his community and other nearby areas, especially the low interest. Compared to others around, Esperanza's rates are very low and with this opportunity he can make his business more profitable, and he is also thankful for your support.

loans.use: To buy computer parts and hardware

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for a variety of imported foodstuffs, to resell at her business

loans.name: Abdul Karim

texts.en:
This is 39-year-old Abdul, who is married and has three children, aged 12, 7 and 2. He has one additional dependent who lives with him, to help with domestic work and to attend school.

In 2000, Abdul established his clothing business. Working six days a week and ten hours each day, he earns about Le 2,000,000 every month. Abdul is now requesting a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000, which he will use to buy jeans, shirts, and t-shirts. in the future, he plans to grow his business further, build a house and educate his children. Abdul thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy additional clothing to resell, including jeans, shirts, and t-shirts

loans.name: John

texts.en:
This is 46-year-old John. He is married and has three children, aged four, five and ten. He has one additional dependent who lives with him to help with the house chores.

 In 2007, John established his patent drugs business. He began his business because he wanted to be self-reliant, after dropping out of school. His business is located in the city center and his main customers are of all ages. 

Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about SLL 2,565,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. John has already received and successfully repaid five loans and he now requires a new loan in order to pay for additional drugs. He hopes that this loan can improve and increase the stock. 

In the future, John plans to open another outlet, out of town. He hopes to transform his business from a patent drug store to a pharmacy. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for patent drugs to sell in his store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy DVDs, VCDs, televisions, and VCD players.

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
This is 39-year-old Salamatu.  She is married and has two children, aged 4 and 10. She has one additional dependent, who lives with her to help with the house chores.  

In 2009, Salamatu established her provisions, drinks, and cosmetics business. She began her business to help her husband, who is a teacher, in running the home. Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about Le 2,101,700 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000. Salamatu requires a loan in order to increase her inventory of provisions, drinks and cosmetics. In the future, Salamatu plans to expand the business to the center of town, to educate her children, and to have a house of her own.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for provisions, drinks, and cosmetics

loans.name: Kaffo

texts.en:
This is 63-year-old Kafo. He is married and has 6 children ages 37, 30, 24, 21, and 21. He has 2 additional dependents who live with him as his sales assistants.

In 1970, Kafo established his commercial business. He began his business just for self-empowerment. His business is located at the city centre and his main customers are men and women. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about Le 400,000 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. Kafo has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and now requires a new loan in order to buy used clothes and items such as a bedspread (Le 3,000,000). He hopes that this loan will increase his stock level, and thus his income. 

In the future, Kafo plans to complete the construction of his house and educate his children. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy used clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for provisions and toiletries.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Mohamed is 43 years old, married, and has three children. He has two additional dependents, his late brother's children, who live with him to help with their schooling.

In 2005, Mohamed established his bread business. He began his business because wants to be self reliant. Working six days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about 2,094,000 SLL a month from this business. 

Mohamed is requesting his third loan for 5,000,000 SLL, which he will use to buy flour. He hopes that this loan can improve and increase his production. In the future, Mohamed plans to open another bakery within the town.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour.

loans.name: Sia

texts.en:
Sia is 35 years old, married, and has four children. In 2004, Sia established her commercial business. She began her business to provide assistance to her husband in taking care of the home. Her business is located at city center and her customers are mainly women. Working six days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 4000,000 SLL a month. 

Sia is requesting her third loan for 5,000,000 SLL, which she will use to buy used clothing. She hopes that this loan will increase her income level. In the future, Sia plans to develop her plot of land, educate her children, and continue with her business.

loans.use: to purchase used clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more plastic shoes to sell.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
This is 36-year-old Aminata. She is married and has two children ages fourteen and twenty-two. She has one additional dependent, who lives with her to help with the house chores. 

In 2011, Aminata established her drinks, cooking oil, maggi (bouillon flavouring cubes), onions, and water business. She began her business to help her husband in taking care of the children. Her business is located in the outskirts of town and her main customers are adults. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,056,500 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. Aminata requires a loan in order to pay for additional pure water and provisions. She hopes that this loan can increase her stock. 

In the future, Aminata plans to grow the business to varieties of products, improve the provisions, trade, and begin to do wholesale. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for pure water and provisions.

loans.name: Judith

texts.es:
Judith de 47 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de dulces en uno de los barrios más populares y tradicionales de la ciudad. Ella también elabora productos derivados de la harina de trigo y  almuerzos con una frecuencia diaria, actividades diversas con las que genera otros ingresos,  que benefician a su hogar conformado por su esposo y sus 2 hijos en las edades de 11 y 28 años.  
Su meta es lograr el aumento de sus ingresos y más adelante tener un lugar mas amplio donde vivir, sacando  adelante, en compañía de su esposo, a su  hijo de 11 años de edad. Su mayor desafío es la competencia, pues los competidores de su mercado compran en mayor volumen obteniendo mejores precios, mientras ella rota sus compras permanentemente y las pequeñas cantidades no facilitan precios competitivos. Esta es justamente la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará productos de dulcería y materias primas como harina de trigo y  víveres para los productos alimenticios que prepara. Con ello aumentará su productividad, en un mercado potencial que la espera y generará más ingresos. Su experiencia de 10 años en su negocio, se constituye en su mayor fortaleza, pues anteriormente trabajó en una panadería, donde aprendió técnicas que hoy aplica y hacen posible que ella trabaje, mientras atiende las obligaciones de su esposo y su pequeño hijo.
texts.en:
Judith, who is 47 years old, sells sweets in one of the city's most popular and traditional barrios.  She also makes products derived from wheat flour and sells breakfasts every day. With these diverse activities she generates additional income to benefit her household, which includes her husband and their 2 children, ages 11 and 28 years.

Judith's goal is to achieve an increase in their incomes and, further along, to have a place with more ample space in which to live. She wishes to get ahead together with her husband and her 11-year-old son. Judith's major challenge is competition, since the competitors in her market are able to buy in larger volume, obtaining better prices. She must replace her merchandise continuously and her small quantities don't merit competitive prices. This is Judith's justification for approaching Kiva, to request her 1st financing through Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo. She wishes  to purchase sweets and primary goods such as wheat flour and other articles to use in preparing foods to sell.

With this loan, Judith can augment her productivity for the potential market she anticipates and generate more income. Her 10 years of experience in her business is her greatest strength. Previously, Judith worked in a bakery where she learned techniques which she applies today, making it possible for her to work while attending to the needs of her husband and her small son.

loans.use: buy sweets and also, primary goods such as wheat flour and ingredients for preparing foods to sell in her store.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
This is 36-year-old David.  He is married and has one child, age five. 

In 2011, David established his motor and generator spares business. He began his business because he wants to be self-reliant after dropping out of school. His business is located in the outskirts of town and his main customers are garage owners and riders. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about Le 972,925 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. David requires a loan in order to pay for additional engine oil, rings, bearings and sprockets. He hopes that this loan will help by increasing his stock. 

In the future, David plans to open an outlet at the center of town, improve the engine oil trade, and to be able to take care of his family. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for engine oil, rings, bearings and sprockets.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia is 49 years old, married, with four children. She lives in Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. 

To earn a living, she owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been in her business for over five years and earns PHP 45,000 every month. 

She joined Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) in 2009 and now she has requested a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Duo Kairos Group

texts.es:
DÚO KAIROS
LA SEÑORA JUANA ES MADRE DE 2  HIJOS QUE TIENE A SU CARGO, HA DEMOSTRADO SER UNA PERSONA RESPONSABLE,  ELLA ES UNA MUJER EMPRENDEDORA QUE LUCHA CADA DIA PARA  CONTRIBUIR CON SU FAMILIA.ELLA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE ZAPATOS YA QUE SOLO DE ESTA FORMA ELLA PODRA TENER UN MEJOR ESTILO DE VIDA YA QUE DENTRO DE SUS PLANES ESTA QUE LOS HIJOS QUE AUN TIENEN A CARGO PUEDAN GRADUARSE Y SER PROFESIONALES ES POR ESO QUE ELLA NUEVAMENTE TOCA LAS PUERTAS DE FAPE PARA QUE SE LE PUEDA PROPORCIONAR UN NUEVO CRÉDITO Y ASI PODER SEGUIR ADELANTE Y POCO A POCO PODER, LLEVAR A CABO LAS METAS Y PROPÓSITOS QUE ELLA TIENE PARA EL BIENESTAR DE SU FAMILIA Y NEGOCIO, ESTA SOLICITANDO ESTE CREDITO PARA LA COMPRA DE ZAPATOS PARA LA VENTA.
texts.en: Sra. Juana is part of the Kairos Duo. She is the mother of two children and known to be a responsible person. She works hard every day to support her family. She is dedicated to selling shoes so she can have a better standard of living. Among her many plans is to see her children graduate and get good jobs. For this reason she has again come to the doors of FAPE to ask for a new loan so that she can continue making progress and gradually achieve her goals for the wellbeing of her family and business. This loan is to buy shoes for her to sell.

loans.use: to buy shoes to sell

loans.name: San Rafael Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado San Rafael está en su ciclo 6, todas ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, que arroja que ninguna ya se encuentra por debajo de la línea de pobreza, gracias al esfuerzo que cada una ha puesto.
Graciela quien es parte de este grupo, cuenta que gracias a su negocio que es una despensa, está ayudando a su familia. Ella es una persona con gran espíritu de lucha y gracias a sus ganas de salir adelante es que está creciendo. Cuenta que antes tenía un pequeño negocio, pero que hoy pudo mejorar mucho.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de frutas, enlatados, arroz, fideos, carnes y demás productos para venderlos y así seguir dando a su clientela lo que necesita.
En la foto del grupo aparecen 14 mujeres ya que este grupo tiene esa cantidad de miembros, pero solo 12 de ellas retira un crédito.
texts.en:
The group named “San Rafael” is in its sixth loan cycle. All of the members participated in a poverty elimination survey. Thanks to each one of their efforts, the survey revealed that they are no longer below the poverty line.

Graciela is part of this group. Thanks to her business, a food pantry, Graciela says that she has been able to help her family. She is a person who possesses a fighting spirit and the drive to succeed, which has helped her to grow. Her business was smaller before, but now she says that it has experienced great improvement. Graciela is requesting a loan so that she can invest in fruit, canned goods, rice, noodles, meat, and other products to sell. As a result, she can continue providing what her customers need.

The photo shows that there are 14 women in the group, but only 12 are participating in this loan.

loans.use: to buy fruit, canned goods, rice, noodles, meat, and other products.

loans.name: Reginald

texts.en:
This is 44-year-old Reginald.  He is married and has no children. He has one additional dependent who lives with him to help a sister with her child's education.  

In 2008, Reginald established his food and drinks business. He began his business because he wanted to be self-reliant after graduating from college. His business is located in the city center and his main customers are all ages and sexes. 

Working 6 days a week and 14 hours a day, he earns about Le 2,332,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan of Le 5,000,000. Reginald has already received and successfully repaid four loans and now requires a new loan to buy soft drinks, rice and oil. He hopes that this loan will increase his stock and maximize his profit. 

In the future, Reginald plans to expand his business to the outskirts of town. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy food and drinks

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is 38 years old, married, with five children. She lives in Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. To earn a living, she owns and operates a fish-vending business. She has been in her business for over eight years and earns PHP 30,000 every month. 

She joined Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) in 2009 and now she has requested a loan of PHP 40,000 to purchase fishing materials, such as nets and hooks and to make repairs to the boat. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fishing materials, such as nets and hooks and to make repairs to the boat.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy supplies for her Internet café.

loans.name: Norma Elizabet

texts.es:
Norma tiene 38 años de edad, es casada, tiene 4 hijos y vive en la ciudad de Choloma, Cortes
Norma tiene un negocio de venta de tamales. Este negocio lo estableció  hace 20 años, y ha sido su fuente de ingreso.  Además de hacer tamales también se dedica a elaborar medicina natural para vender. Esto es un aporte extra  para los gastos de la familia. Manifiesta que con la ayuda de los financiamientos ella ha crecido favorablemente en su negocio y tiene sus propios clientes, trabaja también por encargo.
Ella ha solicitado varios créditos con Odef y actualmente esta solicitando otro préstamo de 21000 lempiras que serán destinados para comprar insumos para la elaboración de los tamales, como ser maíz, condimentos, carne, leña etc. Esta inversión le ayudara a incrementar la producción.
Su meta es, con las ganancias que obtenga tener el capital necesario para remodelar su casa y darle una mejor comodidad a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Norma, 38, married, has three children and lives in the city of Choloma, Cortés. Norma sells tamales, a business she started twenty years ago and that has been her source of income. Besides tamales, she also prepares natural medicines to sell, which represents an extra income for her family. Norma says that previous loans have helped her to expand her business and get her own customers. She also works on request.

Norma has requested several loans with ODEF and is now requesting one for 21,000 lempiras [HNL] to buy ingredients needed to prepare tamales, such as corn, spices, meat and firewood. This investment will help her to increase her production. Her goal is to make enough profits to make some home improvements and give her children a more comfortable life.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for tamales like corn, spices, meat and firewood, etc. to sell

loans.name: Daariimaa

texts.en:
Mrs. Daariimaa, 27 years old, lives in a rental apartment with her husband and child in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Daariimaa's husband has been rendering taxi service to local people for a long time and has accumulated a vast amount of experience. Her son goes to kindergarten. She herself has been running a handbag sales business for three years.

A very hardworking individual who strives for a better future, Daariimaa is requesting a loan of 3500000 MNT to purchase a large quantity of handbags from China. This will enable her to continue running her business without worrying about an inventory shortage.

loans.use: to purchase a large quantity of handbags.

loans.name: Roger

texts.en:
Roger is a hog-raiser in the village of Bantug Petines. He has been in this business for five years and usually earns about PHP 2,500 per piglet. Roger is 44 years old and is happily married to Dolores, a mother who helps him to raise their children. 

At this time, Roger is asking for a loan in the amount of PHP 15,000 to buy feed, vaccines, and an additional piglet to raise. He hopes to grow his business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines, and an additional piglet to raise.

loans.name: Dinah

texts.en:
Dinah is 50 years old and single. She lives in Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. 

To earn a living, she owns and operates a retail business in the local community. She has been in her business for over eight years and earns PHP 3,000 every month. 

She joined GDMPC in 2008 and now she has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase additional products to sell, like canned goods, noodles, soap, and shampoo. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell, like canned goods, noodles, soap, and shampoo.

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel is 40 years old, married, with four children. She lives in Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. 

To earn a living, she owns and operates a retail business in the local community. She has been in her business for over six years and earns PHP 8,000 every month. 

Rachel joined GDMPC in 2011 and now she has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase additional products to sell, like sugar, coffee, noodles, and canned goods. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell, like sugar, coffee, noodles, and canned goods.

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.en:
Gregorio is a farmer living at Iguig with his spouse and children. He is 51 years old. 

For over ten years, he has planted and harvested rice in his rice field. His income goes for meals, bills at home, and revolving capital in the business. He aims for better crop production -- that is why he is asking for additional capital of PHP 10,000 to buy fertilizer and insecticides used in farming. 

This will help maintain good growth of crops, that will lead to a productive harvest, someday.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticides used in farming.

loans.name: Elenora

texts.en:
Elenora is 49 years old and married with 2 children. She lives in Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a retail business in the local community to earn a living. She has been in her business for over 4 years and earns 10,000 PHP every month.

She has been in GDMPC since the year 2009 and now she has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 50 years old and married with 3 children. She lives in Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates an agriculture business which is banana production to earn a living. She has been in her business for over 10 years and earns 15,000 PHP every month.

She joined GDMPC in the year 2009 and now she has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase chemicals and seedlings. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals and seedlings

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 28 years old, married, and has a child. Her spouse is a farmer who plants and harvests rice to sell. They had been working very hard in maintaining the farming business, which allowed them to acquire PHP 10,000 each harvest season, twice a year. The money is used for their meals and revolving capital in the business. 

Susan is now asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy fertilizer and insecticides for use in farming. This will help maintain good crop growth and, someday, to harvest it profitably.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticides for use in farming.

loans.name: Wilsón Osiris

texts.es:
Wilson tiene 28 años de edad, es soltero, vive junto a su mamá, se dedica al servicio de DISCOMOVIL. Actualmente, está en periodo de prueba en una farmacia. 

Inició en el negocio de discomovil desde hace dos años, fue un hermano que vive en Estados Unidos, quien lo incentivo; pues, él tiene 10 años de administrar  una discomovil. 

Los equipos de audio inicialmente fue el hermano quien se lo  regaló, actualmente, compra sus equipos en la ciudad.
Realiza eventos en la zona oriental del país y considera que es reconocido por algunos hoteles importantes. 

El préstamo será invertido en la compra de amplificadores y estructuras con el objetivo de ampliar la discomovil.

Con esto logrará ampliar su capacidad instalada, actualmente renta  o un amigo le presta equipos y estructuras cuando lo requiere. Con este financiamiento comprará otro amplificador que mejorará su capacidad y le permitirá no utilizar equipos ajenos.

Anhela construir una estructura amplia y comprar equipos de audio, que le permitan montar eventos grandes sin tener que fusionarse con otras discomovil y que cuando tenga eventos pequeños dividir en dos la discomovil. Quiere tener una discomovil igual o mejor que la que tiene el hermano.
texts.en:
Wilson is 28 years old, single, and lives with his mother.  He offers his services as a mobile disc jockey.  At the moment, he is also working on a trial basis at a pharmacy.  

Wilson started his disc jockey business two years ago.  His brother lives in the United States and has managed his own disc jockey business for the past 10 years, so he encouraged Wilson to do the same.    

He started out with audio equipment that was given to him by his brother.  Wilson now buys his equipment in the city.  He books events in the western part of the county and has become well-known among some of the major hotels.  His loan will be invested in the purchase of amplifiers and structures so that he can expand his mobile disc jockey business.  

With this investment, Wilson will be able to expand his capacity.  He currently rents equipment or borrows it from a friend as needed.  With this loan, he will buy another amplifier to improve his capacity without having to rely on borrowed equipment.  He wants to build a larger structure and buy audio equipment so that he can host larger events without having to partner with other disc jockeys.  When he plays smaller events, then he can use just half of his equipment.  Wilson wants to have a mobile disc jockey business that is just as good or better than his brother’s.

loans.use: to buy amplifiers and structures for his mobile disc jockey business.

loans.name: Abdurasul

texts.ru:
Абдурасул проживает в сельской местности, женат и имеет  четверых детей.    Ему  48 лет. Супруга его имеет только среднее образование и поэтому она нигде не работает, занимается воспитанием детей.   Сам Абдурасул  после школы пошел учиться в техникум, после окончания техникума поступил в автошколу- успешно окончил ее. Параллельно с учебой он совмещал работу.   Работал он в автосервисе, ремонтировал автомашины.   В связи с закрытием сервиса Адбурасул потерял работу.  Ему тяжело было расставаться с сервисом, он был привязан к нему,  но был вынужден покинуть .   На накопленные деньги он приобрел автомобиль для транспортировки людей по городу. Ему не легко, так как у него не нормированный рабочий день. Бывает, что и работает в ночное время.    Абдурасул хочет, чтобы его дети учились в престижных учебных заведениях  и всегда работали по профессии и поэтому старается  делать все, чтобы добиться своей цели. 
По совету знакомых он обратился в МДО «Арванд» для получения  кредита. На полученный кредит он хочет улучшить условия своего авто и купить автозапчасти.  Абдурасул очень благодарен организации  Арванд, так как с помощью таких организаций люди, имеющие финансовые проблемы могут осуществить свои планы.
texts.en:
Abdurasul lives in the countryside with his wife and four children. He's 48 years old. His wife doesn't work but stays at home taking care of their children.
After graduating high school, Abdurasul attended vocational college and then driving school. While going to these schools, he worked as a mechanic in a body shop. However, the body shop closed and Abdurasul was forced to leave the work he was attached to and enjoyed a great deal. 
Using the money he saved up during college, Abdurasul bought a car and started working as a cab driver. It's not an easy job because Abdurasul doesn't have regular work hours and sometimes works at night. 
Everything Abdurasul does is focused on completing the dream of his children receiving a prestigious education and finding better work opportunities. 
On his friends advice, Abdurasul approached MDO "Arvand" with a request for a loan. This new capital will allow him to improve his vehicle and purchase some spare parts. 
Abdurasul is very thankful to organizations such as "Arvand" which enable people in difficult financial situations to achieve their goals.

loans.use: to buy spare auto parts

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es:
Santiago vive con su madre (Mónica)  sus hermanos (Isabella y Felipe) por lo general considera que tiene una familia humilde que se rebusca la vida trabajando juntos para llegar a un futuro bueno se ven mucho problemas económicos como siempre pero no se dan por vencidos es una persona respetuosa sincera humilde y responsable que sabe valorar las cosas y que no se da por vencido 

En el transcurso de su vida ha visto que es la vida real estudio en colegios tanto públicos como privados y Salió adelante con la primaria y bachillerato  trabajo en diferente sitios para apoyar a su familia mientras conseguía la posibilidad de estudiar. Finalmente dio con CampoAlto la cual le ofrecía tiempo estudio y trabajo le pareció genial y en estos momentos está en segundo semestre de cocina
texts.en:
Santiago lives with his mother (Mónica) and his siblings (Isabella and Felipe).  In general he thinks he has a humble family that goes through life working together toward a good future.  They have a lot of financial problems, as usual, but they don't give up.

He's a respectful, sincere, humble, and responsible person who knows how to value things and who doesn't give up.

Throughout his life he has seen what real life is.  He studied in public and private schools and got ahead with elementary school and high school.  He worked different places to support his family while he looked for the possibility to study.  Finally he found Campoalto, which offered him time to study and work.  This seemed fantastic and now he's in his second semester of culinary school.

loans.use: to finish his culinary studies

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
En el año 2010 cuando salió del colegio no sabía que seguir estudiando, aun no tenía una proyección de vida, alguna meta clara que seguir o por la cual luchar. Sus amigos le decían que estudiara una carrera relacionada con la biología, por otro lado sus papas querían que estudiara alguna ingeniería que esa era la carrera del futuro y lo que más plata le iba a dar y le daban a conocer una frase célebre para esa etapa de su vida: “Sacar la cara por la familia”. Dado que era la primera persona de su familia que iba a continuar con la educación superior, al cargar con tal responsabilidad tenía la mirada de toda su familia sobre él.
En el año 2011 ingreso a la Universidad  a estudiar Ingeniería Industrial, desde el comienzo de esta carrera él tenía muy claro que no era lo que en verdad quería estudiar, pero tenía una meta clara; sacar la cara por la familia. 
A finales del año 2012 tomo una decisión que cambio su vida en ese momento y para siempre ya le dio una vuelta de 180 grados poniendo todo de cabeza, esa decisión tubo muchas repercusiones ya que por obvias razones sus papas tomaron la decisión de no seguir apoyándolo en sus estudios, por esta razón comenzó a trabajar en un Pre-universitario para poder pagarse con sus propios recursos la carrera que quería en realidad, le tomo mucho tiempo darse cuenta que el Área de la Salud era lo que de verdad le gustaba, lo que le apasiona, esa sensación indescriptible de ayudar a las personas cuando así lo requieren, asistir a una persona cuando tal vez está en riesgo su vida, tener el cuidado de un paciente tanto física como psicológicamente en todas sus necesidades para así lograr una pronta y satisfactoria recuperación y muchas cosas más, eso es lo que de verdad le gusta o el motivo principal para estudiar algo referente en el área de la salud.
Su sueño o mejor mi ilusión en este momento es estudiar, llenarse de todo el conocimiento que necesita para ayudar a las personas, una de sus metas es llegar a estudiar “Medicina”. Pero como no cuenta con los recursos necesarios para estudiar esta carrera, es por eso que en este momento está estudiando enfermería porque no quería desistir de su carrera a pesar de los obstáculos que pone la vida y porque si algo le ha enseñado es que por algo se empieza no importa que tan pequeño o que tan grande sean las cosas, o que tan bueno sea el estudio, o donde se estudia, eso en realidad no es lo que  importa,  lo importante es saber aprovechar al máximo las cosas, sacarle los mayores frutos y lo más importante es salir adelante sin importar todos los obstáculos que le ponga la vida.
texts.en:
In 2010, Juan Carlos left high school without knowing whether he would continue studying. He still had no future plans and no clear goal to follow or fight for. His friends told him to study a degree related to biology, while his parents wanted him to study engineering because it was the career of the future which would give him the most money. He came to understand a famous phrase during this period of his life: "Stand up for your family." Since he was the first person in his family who would go on to higher education, he took on responsibility and had the eyes of everyone on his family on him. In 2011, he started a degree in Industrial Engineering at the University of La Salle. From the beginning, he knew very well that it was not what he really wanted to study, but he had a clear goal: to stand up for his family.

In late 2012, he made a decision that changed his life, for that moment and forever. He made a 180-degree turn and turned everything upside down. This decision had many repercussions, because for obvious reasons his parents decided not to support him with his studies any longer. Therefore, he started to work in a pre-university institution so that he could pay for a degree that he really wanted with his own resources. It took him a long time to realize that healthcare was the field that he really liked and that he was passionate about: that indescribable feeling of helping people when they need it, helping someone when their life may be at risk, taking care of a patient both physically and psychologically with all of their needs in order to obtain a quick and satisfactory recovery, and many other aspects. This is what he really enjoys and provides his main motivation to study something related to the healthcare field.

His dream, or his hope, at this moment is to study and to fill himself with all of the knowledge that he needs to help other people. One of his goals is to be able to study medicine. However, since he does not have the necessary resources to study that degree, at this moment he is studying nursing because he didn't want to give up on his career despite the obstacles in his life. If life has taught him anything, it is that everything starts somewhere. It doesn't matter how small or big things are, or how good the studies are, or where one studies. What is important is to know how to take advantage of the situation and to make the most out of it. The most important thing is to keep moving forward without worrying about the obstacles that life gives you.

loans.use: to finish his nursing assistant studies

loans.name: Enkhjargal

texts.en:
Enkhjargal is 28 years old, married, and has one child who attends school. She lives in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land. Enkhjargal has been working at a private business entity and was recently promoted to sales manager.  Her husband recently began to work at the same business entity where she works. 

The family moved to their house and needs to purchase some furniture for their home. Enkhjargal is requesting a loan for 3,000,000 MNT, which she will use to purchase a sofa, table, chairs, and drawer. As a result, her empty house will be filled with some high quality furniture.

loans.use: to purchase a sofa, table, chairs, and drawer.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 46 years old and married with 3 children. She lives in Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a direct selling retail business in the local community to earn a living. She has been in her business for over 6 years and earns 25,000 PHP every month.

She joined GDMPC in the year 2011 and now she has requested a loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell like Tupperware, coffee and lotion. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like Tupperware, coffee and lotion

loans.name: Reymundo

texts.en:
Hog-raising is the primary source of income for Reymundo. He has been in this business for five years and usually earns about 7,000 PHP every four to five months.

He is 48 years old now and is married. At his age, Reymundo still dreams of a good life for his children, so that is why he is fully devoted to his hog-raising business.

To this end, he is asking for a loan in the amount of 40,000 PHP to buy feed, vaccine and vitamins for the proper growth of his hogs. He hopes to grow his business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccine and vitamins for the proper growth of his hogs

loans.name: Gustavo

texts.es: El señor Gustavo tiene 26 años de edad, vive en la Población de Chimore, de la ciudad de Cochabamba. El sr Gustavo trabaja realizando el cargado de Banano y el servicio de moto taxi. El sr Gustavo vivía junto a sus padres en la Población de senda F hace dos años, sin embargo porque no tuvo ingresos suficientes para poder mantener a su familia el tuvo que venirse a la población de chimore , al empezar a vivir en esta población Gustavo se volvió a levantar económicamente junto a su esposa ya que tomo un nuevo rumbo en su camino.  El préstamo que solicita Gustavo es para la compra de una motocicleta para el servicio de moto taxi y de esa manera podrá tener un mejor ingreso para su nivel de vida y poder ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Gustavo is 26 years old. He lives in the town of Chimore, in Cochabamba. Gustavo works hauling bananas and providing a moto-taxi service. 

Two years ago, he was living with his parents in the town of Senda F; however, because he didn't have enough income to take care of his family, he had to move to the town of Chimore. Upon moving to that town, Gustavo and his wife began to lift themselves up economically again as his path took a new direction. 

The loan that Gustavo is requesting is for the purchase of a motorcycle for his moto-taxi service; that way, he will have better income for his own living conditions and be able to help his family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for a his moto-taxi service.

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en: Rogelio is 62 years old, married, and has seven children. He lives in Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. He owns and operates a retail business in the local community to earn a living. He has been in his business for more than three years and earns 8,000 PHP. He joined GDMPC in 2011, and now he has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell like noodles, sugar, coffee, and canned goods. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like noodles, sugar, coffee and canned goods

loans.name: Walter Gabriel

texts.es:
Desde muy pequeño se ha dado cuenta que para ser alguien en la vida se necesita de mucho esfuerzo y dedicación, creció viendo como su madre tenía largas jornadas de trabajo para poder brindarle todas las cosas que necesitaba, como un buen estudio, ropa, alimento y cosas que en ese tiempo tal vez subestimaba, ella no le pedía mucho a cambio de todas las cosas que le daba día a día, solo quería que cuando creciera fuera una persona profesional, una persona con emprendimiento, con un proyecto de vida claro, de la cual ella y toda la familia pudieran estar orgullosos, como era pequeño no creía que lo que ellos le pedían fuera gran cosa, pero a medida que pasaba el tiempo se iba dando cuenta de lo difícil que puede llegar a ser ese tipo de persona del cual se pudiera estar orgulloso, pero debía lograrlo para no decepcionar ni dejar atrás todo el esfuerzo que su madre y  familia hicieron siempre para que el lograra esto.
Siempre trataba de tener buenas notas en el colegio y ser un alumno destacado no solo por conocimiento, sino también por colaboración frente a los profesores, compañeros incluso con la institución. Para que de esta manera su madre y  familia pero en especial ella, recibieran muy orgullosos las calificaciones y las más sinceras felicitaciones de parte de los profesores
Gracias a esto se fue dando cuenta de algo que le gustaba mucho lo cual era ayudar a las personas siempre y cuando  hacerlo estuviera a su alcance, gracias a esas buenas calificaciones tenía una gran capacidad de análisis, de responsabilidad, de cooperación y de colaboración, así que poniendo en práctica todos sus conocimientos podía ser de gran ayuda para todo el que lo necesitara, incluyendo a su madre, por eso desde los 16 años siempre que habían vacaciones del colegio o tenía la oportunidad de trabajar trabajaba en lo que fuera, para ayudarle a ella con los gastos, era algo que ella valoraba mucho, aunque no era tan bueno para realizar algunas cosas, siempre hacia hasta  lo imposible por hacer las cosas bien y poder ayudarla.
A medida que pasaba el tiempo e  iba creciendo tenía que decidir que iba a hacer con su vida para lograr la única meta que tenía en el momento, hacer que todo el trabajo de su madre por el valiera la pena, pero hasta el momento no tenía ni idea de cómo lo iba a lograr, a pesar de todo no tenía muy claro que hacer con su vida, o tal vez solo tenía miedo de descubrir que era lo que en realidad quería para el, luego de una tiempo de análisis y reflexión fue uniendo las cosas que más me gustaban en la vida para llegar a una tomar una decisión final, al ayudar a las personas, la compasión del ser humano, la curiosidad por aprender cada día más y por llegar a ser una gran persona le dieron la respuesta del área en el que quería desempeñar en la vida, el área de la salud.
Cuando tomo esta decisión las cosas no fueron tan fáciles como creyó o como alguna vez lo imagino, ya que no contaba con los recursos económicos suficientes para poder estudiar  medicina, por esta razón y por no dejar de lado esos sueños y mis metas decidió estudiar enfermería y así poder comenzar una  carrera en el área de la salud y en un corto tiempo y con recursos propios poder pagarse la carrera que tanto le apasiona, por la cual no ha parado de soñar y nunca ha dejado de fijar el horizonte “Medicina”.
texts.en:
He’s realized since he was little that to become someone in life much effort and dedication is required.  He grew up seeing his mother work long workdays to provide everything he needed like good education, clothing, food and things that perhaps he undervalued back then.  She never asked for much in return for everything she did for him every day.  All she wanted was for him to become a professional, enterprising person once he grew up with a clear life plan that she and the entire family could be proud of.  Because he was little, he didn’t think that what they were asking of him was very much but as time passed he realized how difficult it is to become the type of person that one can be proud of.  But, he had to accomplish this in order not to disappoint and waste the efforts his mother and family always made so that he could attain this.

He always strove to get good grades at school and to be an outstanding student not only because of his knowledge but also because of his cooperation with teachers and classmates and even with the school itself so that his mother and family, but especially her, would proudly receive his grades and the sincere congratulations he’d get from his teachers.

Thanks to all this, he gradually realized that what he liked best was to help people to the extent he was able to do so.  Thanks to his good grades he had good analytic, responsibility, cooperation and collaboration skills.  Putting all his knowledge and skills into practice he could be of great help to those who need it, including his mother, and this is why from the age of 16 on whenever he had school vacation or had some other opportunity to work he’d do so in whatever was available to help her with expenses.  This was something she valued highly.  Even though he wasn’t all that good at some things, he always did even the impossible in order to do things well and be able to help her.

As time passed and he continued to grow he needed to decide what he was going to do with his life to reach the only goal he had at the moment: to make sure that all his mother’s labor had not been in vain.  However, to date he had no idea how he was going to accomplish this.  Despite everything, he still did not have a clear idea of what he was going to do with his life or perhaps feared discovering what he really wanted for himself.

After a period of reflection and analysis he started to figure out what he liked best in life: helping people, human compassion, and curiosity to learn more every day and to become a great person to reach a final decision.  These led him to the answer to his question of what he wanted to do with his life: health.

Once he made this decision things weren’t as easy as he thought they’d be or as he’d imagined because he lacked sufficient economic resources to study medicine.  Because of this and in order not to set his dreams and goals aside, he decided to study nursing to start a career in the health field so that in a short period of time and with his own resources he’d be able to pay for the career he’s so passionate about and he’s never stopped dreaming about and has always kept fixed on his horizon: Medicine.

loans.use: to finish his nursing course.

loans.name: Ramzullo

texts.ru:
Рамзулло проживает в сельской местности , не далеко от города. Ему  33 года. Женат и имеет троих детей. Все дети дошкольного возраста. Супруга Рамзулло домохозяйка и занимается воспитанием детей. Сам Рамзулло из-за трудностей в финансовой сфере не пошел учиться после окончания школы. Он является старшим сыном в семье и ему нужно было помогать родителям поставить на ноги своих младших братьев. С двадцати восьми лет он начал продавать на рынке растительное масло. Этим бизнесом он занимался два года.  Затем друзья и знакомые ему посоветовали заняться другим бизнесом. Вот уже три года он занимается торговлей хоз товарами и строительными материалами для отделки домов и квартир (лакокрасочные материалы, шпаклевка и т.д. ). На ровне со стажем в сфере бизнеса он кредитуется в МДО «Арванд» и имеет хорошую кредитную историю. 
На полученный кредит  Рамзулло хочет закупить  хоз товары  и заранее  благодарит "Арванд", за то, что финансово помогают и поддерживают людей в трудный период их жизни.
texts.en:
Ramzullo lives in the countryside, not too far away from the city. He's 33 years old, married and has three young children. Ramzullo's wife stays at home and looks after them. 
Due to difficult financial circumstances, Ramzullo did not get to attend college after graduating high school. He was the oldest sibling and had an obligation to help his brothers get on their feet.
After he turned 28, Ramzullo began selling vegetable oil on a local market. He worked at this job for two years before, at his friend's advice, he switched to selling household goods and building materials such as plaster, paints, etc. He's been running this business for the past three years and has a good credit history. 
Ramzullo is asking for a loan in order to acquire various household goods and thanks Arvand in advance for aiding people caught in difficult situations.

loans.use: to purchase household goods

loans.name: Cindy Paola

texts.es:
Su nombre es Cindy Paez, 
 Vive con su hermana y mama;  actualmente se encuentra estudiando en  un técnico profesional  en contabilidad financiera, toda su vida ha vivido con su mama y ella es la persona que se ha hecho cargo de ella desde que nació le ha dado todo lo que ha necesitado hasta el momento ella es una mujer  independiente y trabaja en una panadería y la verdad es que sus ingresos no son muy altos como para seguir cancelando un gasto tan alto como lo es la cuota de el estudio que ella esta ejerciendo, como una mujer ya mayor de edad lo que estoy tratando de lograr es conseguir un trabajo para así ayudarle a ella ya que es madre soltera de dos hijas  la cual le causan varios gastos; con esto ella la apoyaría pagando sus estudios y la colaboraría con algunos de sus gastos.
Hace dos años hizo parte de un programa que ofrecía técnicos por competencia en  el campo laboral, se  inscribió y pase gracias  a este programa logro aumentar sus conocimientos en todo lo que tiene que ver con una carrera como lo es contaduría pública y desde hace ya un año ingreso a la corporación a ampliar sus conocimientos en la cual se he sentido muy a gusto ya que me brinda una calidad de aprendizaje muy buena y se acomoda a ella como persona, y ahora que tiene la oportunidad de hacer algo para su bienestar no piensa en abandonar y así poder  darle una ayuda a su mama, cambiando de tema se inclino hacia los deportes le gusta hacer ejercicio, le gusta leer, y colaborar en la casa, también le gusta participar en  obras teatrales o estar involucrada con todo lo que tenga que ver con cultura y las artes en general, ya que le gustaría hacer parte de una academia y estudiar artes escénicas en un futuro y poder realizarse como una gran actriz y una contadora profesional reconocida como una mujer emprendedora y con una gran intensidad de colaborar a los mas necesitados de nuestro país y poder hacer  fundaciones no solo ella sino también con la colaboración de muchas personas que quieran apoyar al futuro del país.
texts.en:
Her name is Cindy Paez.  She lives with her sister and mother.  Currently she is studying toward a technical professional degree in financial accounting.  All of her life she has lived with her mother, and she is the person who has taken care of her since she was born and given her everything she has needed so far.  She is an independent woman who works at a bakery.  The truth is that her income is not high enough to continue paying an expense as large as Cindy's school fee.  Since her mother is older, Cindy is trying to get a job that would help her, since she is a single mother of two daughters who have various expenses.  With this, she would help pay for her studies and share some of the expenses.

Two years ago, she was part of a program that offered techniques for competence in the workforce.  She signed up and thanks to this program, she was able to increase her knowledge of everything that has to do with a career in public accounting.  A year ago, she worked at a corporation to expand her knowledge.  She liked it since it provided a high quality of learning and accommodated her as a person.  Now that she has the opportunity to do something for her well-being she does not want to abandon it so that she can help her mother.  

Changing topics, she likes sports and exercising.  She also likes to read, help at home, and participate in theater shows or anything that has to do with culture and arts in general.  She would like to be part of an academy and study scenic arts in the future so that she could be an actress and a professional accountant recognized as an enterprising woman with an intense need to help the most needy in Colombia.  She could start a foundation so that many people could work together to support the future of her country.

loans.use: to finish her academic program in Financial Accounting

loans.name: Digna Emerita

texts.es:
Doña Digna tiene 43 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 2 hijos con los cuales vive en el Municipio de la Másica, San Juan Pueblo.
 Desde hace 4 años se dedica a la venta de comida que ella misma prepara como ser, pastelitos rellenos de arroz y carne, baleadas, tajadas con carne molida, refrescos, golosinas. El local donde vende esta instalado a la par de una escuela, donde le va muy bien porque las ventas las hace a diario.
Esta solicitando con Odef, un préstamo de 8,000 lempiras para poder invertir en surtir el  negocio con productos que necesita para elaborar las comidas como ser, condimentos, carnes, harina de maíz y de trigo, refrescos, frijoles huevos,bananos, lácteos etc. Esta segura que con esto mejorar el servicio para vender variedad de productos para los niños a un precio considerable.
Su meta es hacer el capital para poder darle a sus hijos le educación y ayuda necesaria.
texts.en:
Doña Digna is a 43-year-old single mother.  She lives with her two children in the town of Másica, San Juan Pueblo.

For the past four years, Digna has been selling food that she prepares herself.  These items include turnovers filled with rice and meat, “baleadas” (the Honduran version of a burrito), fried plantains with ground beef, soft drinks, and snack foods.  Her vending stall is located near a school, so she is doing very well because of her daily sales.  

Digna is requesting a loan of 8,000 HNL from ODEF so that can reinvest in inventory for her business.  She needs products for preparing food such as condiments, meats, cornmeal, wheat flour, soft drinks, beans, eggs, bananas, dairy products, and other items.  Digna is confident that this will improve her service since she will have a variety of products to sell to the children at an affordable price.  

Her goal is to have capital for providing her children with an education and the help that they need.

loans.use: to buy condiments, meats, cornmeal, wheat flour, soft drinks, beans, eggs, bananas, dairy products, and other items.

loans.name: 23 De Julio Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “23 DE JULIO”  iniciará el décimo cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Cascada, está compuesta por once integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Eugenia es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: kiosco de dulces, venta de refrescos, venta de detergentes, tienda de barrio, macramé de mantas, venta de cotillones, venta de cosméticos, venta de ganado, venta de joyas, venta de abarrotes, farmacia.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Eugenia es integrante, ella indica que hace año y medio que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de su suegra que es parte de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de bisutería y perfumes; cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió de su madre, quien anteriormente vendía aretes de cholita, cuenta que en la actualidad ella vende aretes de cholita y de señoritas gracias a los créditos de Pro Mujer.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de aretes) que adquirirá de las empresas de la Ciudad de El Alto por mayor y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones del área de salud y los ahorros porque dan buenas recomendaciones.

En la fotografía no esta la señora Fanny ya que fue a realizar una consulta médica.
texts.en:
The group 23 de Julio will begin its fourteenth cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the communal bank branch Centro Focal de Cascada.  The group is made up of eleven members, and is led by a committee of directors; Eugenia is the Secretary.  The members' businesses are very diverse, and include: a candy stand, selling refreshments, selling detergents, a neighborhood store, macramé rugs, selling party supplies, selling cosmetics, selling livestock, selling jewelry, selling grocery items, and having a pharmacy.

The loan that they take out will benefit these small micro-businesses.  Eugenia is the featured member, and says that she has been a part of Pro Mujer for a year and a half.  She joined through an invitation from her mother-in-law, who is also a member of the institution.  Presently, she has a business selling jewelry and perfume.  She says that she learned this business from her mother, who previously sold indigenous-style earrings.  She says that she currently sells indigenous-style and teen fashion earrings, thanks to the loans from Pro Mujer.

The loan that she will take out is to grow her capital (by buying earrings), which she will purchase wholesale from the businesses in the city of El Alto.  Later, she will sell them at her place of business.  This form of work allows her to generate resources in order to maintain her home, since she is married. 
 
When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the health and savings training sessions, since they give her good recommendations.

Not present in the photo is group member Fanny, she had to go to a doctor's appointment.

loans.use: to buy earrings.

loans.name: Jenny Milena

texts.es:
Su historia comienza desde el día que salió de estudiar el bachillerato en el 2004, salio con todas las ganas de estudiar de crecer profesionalmente pero realmente en su casa no habían  los recursos suficientes para poder estudiar en una Universidad y menos si es una carrera como la ella  quería. Al salir del colegio por ser menor de edad no conseguía trabajo, pero una vecina le ayudo y logro trabajar en unas cabinas entre semana de y los fines de semana decidió entrar a estudiar enfermería auxiliar con su trabajo se pagaba la carrera pues claro que la plata no alcanzaba pero se hacía rendir de una u otra manera, al realizar sus practicas y graduarse de enfermera  trabajo con una familia cuidando un en cama. La vida le cambio a por completo cuando empieza a trabajar y empieza a darse gustos tal vez de cosas muy pequeñas pero al fin son gustos. Al finalizar el año llega la noticia que nadie espera pero que todos saben que va a llegar. Su padre fallece, el gran y único compañero de su madre, mientras todos salían a trabajar y así ayudarse entre todos para los gatos de la casa.
