No basto con la muerte de su papa, su mama entra  en una depresión que ya no quería hacer nada ni por salud de ella, decidió renunciar  a su trabajo para estar con ella en la casa acompañarla y poderla ayudar a salir de esa tan fuerte depresión seguía en su cargo de enfermera pero en turnos de noche nada cómodo pero feliz porque estaba trabajando y creciendo profesionalmente, en julio a su mama le da una trombosis cerebral enfermedad que la impide hacer ciertas actividades por ella misma. Desde aquella enfermedad queda con terapias con apoyo psicológico y afrontando su depresión, meses después le diagnostican Artrosis Degenerativa, enfermedad que aun no tiene cura para ser más exactos ya no es la misma la alegría que caracterizaba ya no se le nota, motivo por el cual evita no alejarse tanto de casa para estar pendiente de ella. Su abuela materna que ha vivido toda la vida con ellos les ayuda y estaba pendiente de su hija y de los nietos, pero a su larga edad  las enfermedades y los achaques empiezan a aparecer, le realizan una cirugía de urgencia de alto riesgo pues su sistema digestivo no le quiso funcionar mas. Resumiendo su historia ni su mama, ni su abuela son las misma ambas están enfermas y Jenny está a cargo de ellas claro que entre los hermanos se colaboran pero al vivir con ellas dos siente más responsabilidad velar por su bienestar. Decidió entrar a estudiar para poder tener mas conocimientos   y  montar su propio spa , para poder pagar su carrera trabaja en una ruta, de allí sale a estudiar recoge 2 niños que cuida en las tardes y asesora en las tareas, de nuevo vuelve a la ruta  regresa a  casa, en este tiempo su mama y una amiga le colabora cuidando a los niños mientras va y  vuelve, hacen tareas toman onces los niños se van y le queda la tarea  de alistar comida acostar a la mama y a la abuela, hacer los trabajos y disponerse a empezar un nuevo día. Los días sábados si ahí turnos para hacer como enfermera los hace pues es el día en que sus hermanas pueden estar con sus dos mamas en la casa y no dejar solas.
Su mayor motivación son ellas dos, es por ellas que se levanta todos los días dándole gracias  a Dios por brindarle salud para poder trabajar para salir a delante y acompañarlas.
texts.en:
Jenny's story begins the day she finished high school in 2004. She finished and was eager to go to school and grow professionally but really in her home there weren't enough resources to go to college, much less for a major like the one she wanted. When she left high school, since she was a minor she couldn't get a job, but a neighbor helped her and she was able to work in some telephone booths weekdays. She decided to go to school to become an assistant nurse on the weekends and paid for it with her work. Of course, there wasn't enough money, but she made it work one way or another. 

When she did her internship and graduated as a nurse, she worked with a family caring for a bedridden patient. Life changed completely when she started to work and she began to take small pleasures, but they were pleasures. When the year ended she received the news that no body is expecting but that everyone knew would come. Her father died, the wonderful sole companion of her mother while they all worked to help each other with the household expenses. As if the death of her father weren't enough, her mother entered into a depression and didn't want to do anything for her own health. Jenny decided to quit her job to be with her at home, to keep her company and help her overcome this severe depression. She continued in her role as a nurse, but at night. It wasn't easy but she was happy because she was working and growing professionally. In July, her mother had a stroke, an illness that impedes her doing certain activities on her own. Since her mother had that illness, she has had physical therapy and therapy for her depression. Afterwards, she was diagnosed with degenerative osteoarthritis, a disease that has no cure. In short, she doesn't have the same cheerfulness she was known for. For this reason, Jenny tries not to go far from home so she can keep an eye on her. Her maternal grandmother, who has lived with them her whole life, helped them and cared for her daughter and grandchildren, but at her advanced age illness and maladies begin to appear. She had an emergency high risk surgery because her digestive system did not work anymore. To get back to Jenny's story, neither her mother, her grandmother are the same. Both of them are sick and Jenny is in charge of them. All of the siblings cooperate, but living with them, she feels more responsible for their well being. She decided to go to school to learn more and open her own spa. In order to pay for her studies she works a shift, then she goes to school. She picks up two children that she cares for in the afternoon and she helps them with their homework. Then she goes back to the shift and returns home. At that time her mother and a friend help her care for the children while she comes and goes, they have tea, the children leave and she does her homework and makes dinner, puts her mother and grandmother to bed, does housework and gets ready for a new day. On Saturday, she works shifts as a nurse because that day her sisters can take care of the mothers and not leave them alone.

Her biggest motivation are the two of them. they are the reason she gets up every day, thanking God for keeping her healthy so she can continue to work to get ahead and be with them.

loans.use: to finish her degree in nursing.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.es: Carolina es una señora muy trabajadora. Necesita la ayuda para un préstamo para la compra de un automóvil para poder transportarse al trabajo todos los días y llevar a sus hijos a clases, por lo que necesita un préstamo por cuatrocientos mil colones (450.000). con esto podrá facilitar sus labores diarias de transporte  y así tener mas tiempo para compartir con su familia.
texts.en: Carolina is a hardworking woman. She needs help through a loan to buy a car to commute to work and to take her children to school. Carolina is requesting 450,000 colones [CRC]. With the car, she will take care of her daily transport activities more easily and will have more time to spend with her family.

loans.use: to buy a car.

loans.name: Nery Marcia

texts.es:
La Señora Nery vive en Guayaquil (orquídeas), ella tiene 38 años de edad. Ella nos cuenta que estudio corte y confección antes de casarse, y cuando se separo de su esposo ella puso un  taller de costura  y hace tres años vende cosméticos,  es otra manera de ganar su dinero propio y no depender de alguien.

Ella trabaja en la venta de cosméticos, en la costura en el transcurso del día, las dificultades que se le presentan en su negocio es la competencia y que los clientes no cancelan puntuales. Ella está separada de su esposo, tiene 3 hijos de 15, 12 y 8 años de edad.

Con el préstamo ella va a comprar cosméticos para la venta y telas para la elaboración de sus trajes. Ella desea para el futuro poner paredes en su casa para ponerse un bazar donde también puede exponer y vender ropa.
texts.en:
Sra. Nery is 38 years old and lives in Guayaquil (Orquídeas). She says that she studied sewing and dressmaking before she got married. When she separated from her husband, Nery opened a sewing workshop. She has also been selling cosmetics for the past three years as another way of generating income for herself without having to depend on anyone.

Nery works by sewing and selling cosmetics throughout the day. The difficulties she faces in her business is dealing with the competition and customers who do not pay their bills on time. Nery is separated from her husband and has three children (ages 15, 12, and 8). With this loan she will buy cosmetics to sell and fabrics for making outfits. In the future, she would like to add another room to her house so that she can open a bazaar. This would allow her to expand and have a place to sell clothing.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell and fabrics for making outfits.

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es: Gabriela, tiene la edad  de 22 años, está soltera, vive con sus hijos que son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes, fungicidas y pagar mano de obra en trabajos de asistencia para el café. Además de poder comprar unas plantas de almácigo para realizar resiembras y así aumentar la densidad de plantas por área, además de aprovechar la buena fertilidad del suelo y las condiciones de clima y otras que favorecen al cultivo de café. Con estas mejoras al cultivo espera obtener un poco de ganancias y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y también invertir un poco más en el área de cultivo y también cumplir algunas metas.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Gabriela is 22 years old, single and lives with her children, who are her highest priority. With this loan, she intends to purchase fertilizers, fungicides and pay for manual labor to help with the coffee. She will also be able to purchase seedbed plants which will allow her to have a higher density of plants in each area. Se will also be able to take advantage of the fertile soil and the climate which are ideal for growing coffee.
With these improvements to her crop, she hopes to increase her earnings and in so doing improve the living conditions of her family, invest a little more in her growing area and meet some of her goals. This is the first loan that she has received from FUDECOSUR. Prior to this, she had not had any other loans in national banks, but FUDECOSUR has given her a loan with greater ease and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: purchase fertilizers, fungicides and pay for manual labor.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 33 years old and is married to Jeric. To make a living, she owns and operates a farm, where she raises crops. Jeric is also a farmer. Evelyn earns a living from planting and harvesting corn and has been engaged in her business for five years. She earned approximately 20,000 PHP with her last crop. 

Evelyn is requesting a loan amounting to 20,000 PHP to purchase seeds, fertilizer and insecticide for her corn farming business. She dreams that her business will become more productive so she can give her family a improved standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer and insecticide for her corn farming business.

loans.name: Mirian

texts.es: Doña Mirian tiene 44 años, casada, madre de dos hijos, termino la primaria, oriunda del departamento de Beni, es una señora muy emprendedora. Hace 12 años que viene en la población de Chimore junto a su familia. Doña Mirian cuenta que ella al principio tuvo muchos obstáculos para montar su negocio en Chimore, para empezar se dedico a la venta de lubricantes alquilando una tienda y un cuarto donde vivían con su esposo que es mecánico, al principio el esposo realizaba trabajos pequeños. Después, con el tiempo ya con sus hijos alquilaron una casa donde  montaron su propio taller, donde el trabajo se volvió familiar con la ayuda de sus hijos que también aprendieron el oficio de sus padres. Ahora doña Mirian solicita el préstamo para traer mas repuestos y lubricantes que solicitan en su taller, y desarrollar su actividad para tener mejores ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Doña Mirian is 44 years old, married, and the mother of two children. She is originally from the Department of Beni and completed primary school. Mirian is a very enterprising woman. She and her family moved to the town of Chimore 12 years ago. At first, Doña Mirian had to deal with many obstacles when she started her business in Chimore. In order to sell lubricants, she had to rent a shop and find a room where she and her husband could live. Her husband is a mechanic and began performing small jobs at first. Afterwards, her children accompanied them and they rented a house where they could set up their own repair shop. She and her husband have taught the trade to their children, so they now help with the family business.

Doña Mirian is requesting a loan so that she can acquire more spare parts and lubricants for her repair shop. This will help her business develop so that she can generate more income and achieve a better quality of life for herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and lubricants.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.es: Rolando, tiene la edad  de 44 años, está casado,  vive con su esposa y su hijo los cuales su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes y otros productos que le ayuden a tener una buena plantación, así como una semilla de la mejor variedad que se adapte bien a las condiciones de clima y características del suelo, además pagar mano de obra de siembra y en la aplicación de los productos y asistencia de la plantación, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones de clima y suelo que cuenta para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia de varios años en el manejo de granos básicos. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad, y tener a corto plazo una producción adecuada. Con el ingreso de la cosecha que espera obtener y utilizarla en el bienestar y estudio de su familia y cumplir con algunas metas familiares y seguir invirtiendo más en los cultivos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Rolando is 44 years old, married and lives with his wife and son whom are his main priority. With this loan he expects to buy fertilizer and other products that will help him have a good planting season, including a better quality seed that adapts well to the climatic conditions and soil characteristics. He will also pay for day laborers to plant the seeds, use the products and help with the rest of the planting in order to ensure a job well done. 

He hopes to take advantage of the good climate and soil which he has access to for this crop and also would like to put in practice his experience planting basic grains for several years. He wil also be able to buy better and higher quality products so that his crops develop well and safely so that he can soon has an adequate harvest.

With the earnings from the harvest he hopes to obtain he will invest in the well-being and education of his family and fulfill a few family goals while continuing to invest in his crops. This is his first loan that he has received from FUDECOSUR. He has not had other loans in state banks but FUDECOSUR has brought forth this loan with ease and lower interest rates.

loans.use: to plant beans.

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es:
Reina, se dedica a a la venta de tortillas para obtener ingresos y mantener a su familia. Ella tiene 36 años de edad y disfruta  de cuatro hijos. Ella tiene 20 años de tener su negocio, lo inicio con su compañero de vida y lo realiza de lunes a viernes de 8:00 am a 3:00 pm.
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar maíz y pago de mano de obra. Esta inversión le ayudara a incrementar la clientela y sus ingresos.
Su objetivo es fortalecer el negocio para mejorar  sus entradas de dinero y cubrir todas las  necesidades básicas del hogar.
texts.en:
Reina sells tortillas in order to make a living and support her family. She is 36 years old and enjoys the company of her four children. Reina has had this business for 20 years; she started it together with her life partner and works Monday to Friday, from 08:00 am to 03:00 pm.

Reina is requesting a loan to buy corn and to pay someone to help her. With this investment, she will be able to attract more customers and increase her income. Her goals are to strengthen her business, improve her income and cover her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: to buy corn and to pay someone to help her.

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en:
This is 27-year-old Mariatu.  She is married and has one child, aged 5 years. She has one additional dependent, who lives with her for schooling.

In 2005, Mariatu established her commercial business. She began her business just for self-empowerment. Her business is located at the city center, and her main customers are both men and women. Working seven days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about Le 700,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000. Mariatu has already received and successfully repaid one loan. Now she requires a new loan in order to increase her inventory level, and hence attract many customers.  

In the future, Mariatu plans to seek more financial assistance, to educate her child and to own a shop. She appreciates the gesture she is receiving from Kiva. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy pan dishes, rubber dishes and Peak Milk Powder.

loans.name: Herenia

texts.es: Doña Herenia, casada, 59 años de edad,es una mujer muy trabajadora siempre le ha gustado el área de comercio, inicio como vendedora de ropa, perfumes y zapatos que compraba al por mayor y distribuía a sus diferentes clientes, su esposo siempre le apoya en la actividad, hace dos años tuvo que dejar de vender ropa y los diferentes artículos, ya que su esposo sufrió un derrame y le cuesta transportarse hasta el sitio donde compraba la mercadería. Por lo tanto decidió dedicarse a vender huevos, natilla y queso; porque cerca de su casa se encuentra una granja donde compra estos productos. Su esposo ha presentado mejoras y con su nueva clientela le va muy bien, al mes venden aproximadamente 2000 cartones de huevos, 200 bolsas de natilla y suficientes kilos de queso para poder pagar los gastos del hogar y necesidades personales. Dadas las circunstancias doña Herenia nunca se dio por vencida y desea continuar como comerciante, es por eso que solicita el apoyo de Fundación Mujer para comprar suficientes cartones de huevos y tener para distribuirlos en los siguientes meses, ella fue excelente clienta de la Fundación, esta segura de continuar con su correcta moral de pago.
texts.en:
Herenia is married and is fifty-nine years old.  She is a very hardworking woman who has always liked the trade business.  She started out as a tradeswoman selling clothing, perfume, and shoes that she bought wholesale and then distributed to different customers.  Her husband always helps her in these activities.

Two years ago, she had to leave her position selling clothing and other items because her husband suffered a stroke, and it became difficult to travel to the area where she bought her merchandise.  Therefore, she decided to make a living selling eggs, custards, and cheese, since there is a farm located very close to her house where she can buy these products.  

Her husband's condition has improved, and with her new customers, her business is going very well.  Each month, they sell approximately 2000 cartons of eggs, 200 bags of custard, and sufficient kilograms of cheese in order to be able to cover home expenses and personal needs.  

Under these circumstances, Herenia never gave up and she wishes to continue in her business.  For this reason, she is requesting the support of Fundación Mujer in order to buy sufficient cartons of eggs that she can distribute in the upcoming months.

She has been an excellent client of the foundation, and is sure that she can continue making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Felicisimo

texts.en:
Felicisimo is 67 years old and married with three children. He lives in Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. 

Felicisimo owns and operates a motorcycle transport business to earn a living. He has been in his business for over eight years and earns 20,000 PHP every month. 

He joined GDMPC in 2011, and now he has requested a loan of 25,000 PHP to purchase spare parts and tires. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and tires.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es:
Ruth, tiene 22 años, esta casada con José Luis de 26 años y tiene una hija de un año, ellos viven  en una casa alquilada, cerca de sus familiares . Ruth se dedica al sembrado de papa, arveja, habas, maíz y diferentes verduras como culantro, zanahoria y lechuga. Ella y su esposo llevan sembrando 3 años, las técnicas agrícolas, las aprendieron de sus padres, quienes crecieron en las tierras que ahora les pertenecen, pero que antes eran de sus padres. También cultivan chacras arrendadas, para hacer producir en mayor cantidad sus productos, a ella, le gusta cosechar papa, pues le gusta recogerlos de entre los surcos, para luego comercializarlos en el mercado de la ciudad de Tarma, donde ya tiene conocidos por la calidad de sus cosechas, pero lo difícil es trasladar su producción hasta el punto de venta,ya que los sacos son muy pesados y las ganancias que perciben la vuelven a invertir .Este es su sexto préstamo con Kiva y se siente muy agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.  
Ruth, invertirá los S/.2000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos, pues pronto cosechará.
texts.en:
Ruth is 22 years old. She is married to José Luis, who is 26 years old, and has a one-year-old daughter. They live in a rented house close to their relatives. 

Ruth earns her living growing potatoes, peas, fava beans, corn, and other vegetables like cilantro, carrots, and lettuce. She and her husband have been farming for three years. They learned their agricultural techniques from their parents, who grew up on the lands that now belong to them and belonged to their parents before them. They also cultivate rented fields in order to produce larger quantities. 

Ruth likes harvesting potatoes, because she likes gathering them from the furrows to later sell them in the market in the city of Tarma, where they are already known for the quality of their harvests. The hard part is transporting the harvest to the market, since the sacks are very heavy. The earnings that they receive are reinvested. 

This is Ruth's sixth loan with Kiva and she feels very grateful for the financial support that she receives. She is committed to making her payments punctually. She will invest the 2000 soles (PEN) in the purchase of composted material to fertilize her crops, as she will be harvesting them soon.

loans.use: to buy natural fertilizer.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 50 years old and is married with four children. She lives in Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental in the Philippines. She owns and operates a farm, which cultivates bananas, to earn a living. She has been in her business for over nine years and earns 50,000 PHP every month. 

She joined GDMPC in 2010 and now has requested a loan of 60,000 PHP to purchase chemicals and banana siblings. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals and banana siblings.

loans.name: Mary Judy

texts.en:
Mary Judy, 39 years old, is married to a tricycle driver and they are blessed with four children. She owns and operates a food vending business inside the school campus.  With this business she is selling "snacks" such as spaghetti, noodles, sandwiches, rice cakes, and beverages to the students in the school. 

Mary Judy is earning a net income of PHP 3,000 every day. She would like to borrow a loan amounting to PHP 15,000 to purchase food ingredients such as ketchup, salt, spices and other condiments for her food vending business.

loans.use: to purchase food ingredients such as ketchup, salt, spices and other condiments for her food vending business.

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en: Flordeliza is a 33-year-old mother, who has been gifted with three children.  Due to the hardship of living, she runs a small variety store in her village to help her husband to earn income. She aims to improve the business and make it profitable in order to generate sufficient income to satisfy their basic needs and support the education of their children. To improve the business, she is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy more snack foods, canned goods, noodles, eggs, laundry soaps, beverages and seasoning to sell. She is hoping that her loan will be a great help to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy more snack foods, canned goods, noodles, eggs, laundry soaps, beverages and seasoning to sell.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en:
Sandra is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fishing nets and a new engine for her fishing boat.

Sandra has been in this business for ten years. Sandra earns extra income from her grocery store.

Sandra has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and a new engine for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Norie

texts.en:
Norie is 32 years old and married with one kid. Norie works very hard to provide for them.

Norie runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell.

Norie has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, sardines, diapers and other groceries. 

In the future Norie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Jason

texts.en:
This is Jason, 34, resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Mylyn, a sales consultant, and they have two children. He, together with his wife, manages their household while also operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Jason operates a poultry supply store where he sells different supplies mostly for cocks. He sells the feed by kilo and his regular customers are his neighbours and the local community. He earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help him continue the operation of his business, Jason is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy more feed and other supplies needed to expand his product inventory. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business. 

Jason hopes to grow his business and dreams to be able to give his family a good future by the grace of God. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his life and business every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for poultry and feed supplies for his business.

loans.name: Gilberte

texts.fr:
Gilberte, agée de 43 ans, dont la boutique de vente de produits de beauté féminine se localise dans le quartier Kossodo de la ville de Ouagadougou (capitale du Burkina), collabore en tant que boutiquière partenaire à Nafa Naana, entreprise sociale en cours de création par Entrepreneurs du Monde. Cette collaboration date de juillet 2012 et des produits tels que les foyers améliorés, à gaz, les lampes solaires et des paniers thermos ont été associés à ses articles de vente ordinaires. En plus de ces nouveaux articles, elle assure la revente de recharges de bouteilles à gaz ce qui lui permet d’améliorer l’économie des femmes tout en améliorant elle ses conditions de vie.
De nos jours, Gilberte est confrontée à une difficulté financière car nombreux sont les besoins de ses clients en lampes solaires. Le présent prêt lui permettra donc d’acheter 69 lampes solaires qu’elle revendra à ses clients afin de satisfaire leur demande et d’améliorer davantage son activité et les conditions de vie sa famille composée de 3 enfants (tous scolarisés) et de son mari. Notons que Gilberte est à son troisième prêt KIVA dont le premier a été entièrement remboursé et le deuxième est en cours de remboursement sans difficulté. Elle rêve de devenir une grande entrepreneuse, faire de l’import et de travailler avec ses fonds propre à l’avenir.
texts.en:
Gilberte is 43 years old and owns a cosmetics shop in the Kossodo neighborhood in Ouagadougou (capital of Burkina Faso). She has formed a partnership with Nafa Naana, a social enterprise that is being created by Entrepreneurs du Monde (Entrepreneurs of the World). The partnership started in July 2012 and involves the resale of products such as gas stoves, solar-powered lamps and warming baskets. In addition to those new items, she is also charged with selling replacement gaz tanks which allows her to help fellow women as well as improve her standard of living.
Recently, Gilberte has a financial challenge because so many of her customers are in need of solar-powerd lamps. The loan will help her to purchase 69 solar-powerd lamps for resale to her customers. This will satisfy their demand, improve her sales and improve the standard of living of her family of three children (all in school) and her husband. Notably, this will be Gilberte's third loan with KIVA; the first was successfully repaid and the second is in process of being repaid without issue. She dreams of becoming a great entrepreneur, working in imports and managing the business without loans in the future.

loans.use: to purchase 69 solar-powered lamps with Nafa Naana for resale to her customers.

loans.name: Epiphania

texts.en:
Epiphania is a 29-year-old woman from the Bugesera District in the Eastern Province of Rwanda. She works as a shopkeeper. Epiphania started selling lights in May 2012 and to date has sold 180 lights, providing clean energy to 900 people.

Epiphania is requesting a 50 USD loan to purchase 10 rechargeable LED lights to resell to people in her village without electricity. Every week or so, her customers will return to her to have their lights recharged for just 20 cents. Epiphania will reinvest the profit from her loan into her shop to earn more money for herself, her husband Jean, and their four children.

loans.use: to buy 10 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity

loans.name: Habib

texts.en: Habib is 37 years old.  He is married and has six children; three of his children are enrolled in school.  He has been in business for five years but he was dealing in selling charcoal as well but with this loan he is asking for, will be used to buy sugar, shoes and sodas for sale.  The profits from the business will be used to build a house. He is very thankful with the previous loan which helped him to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, shoes and sodas for sale.

loans.name: Urunani Group

texts.fr:
Félicité fait partie du groupe  Urunani et   habite à Gitega. Elle  a 43 ans et est mariée à Joseph, un chauffeur. Ensemble ils ont  6 enfants dont 5 étudient.
Elle prend soin de 3 enfants orphelins.

Elle fait le commerce de  farine  depuis 3 ans. 

Elle  est à son  septième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité de farine à revendre, pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Felicite is a member of the Urunani group and lives in Gitega. She is 43 years old and is married to a Joseph, who is a driver. Together they have six children, of whom five go to school. She takes care of three other orphaned children. 

Felicite has been selling flour for three years. She is on her 7th loan with Turame. With this loan, she is going to increase her capital and buy a large quantity of flour, [which she will] resell to earn more.

loans.use: to buy flour

loans.name: Seibatu

texts.en:
This is 27-year-old Seibatu.  She is married and has two children, aged 7 and 4 years. In 2008, Seibatu established her commercial business. She began her business just to support her children. Her business is located at the heart of town, and her main customers are mostly women. Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 380,000 every month from this business.

She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000. Seibatu has already received and successfully repaid one loan. Now she requires a new loan, in order to buy wax cotton and dry cotton, to resell at her business. She hopes that this loan will increase her income level.

In the future, Seibatu plans to build a house, educate her two kids, and to acquire a shop. She appreciates the gesture she is receiving from Kiva. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy wax cotton and dry cotton, to resell at her business

loans.name: Eugene

texts.en: This is Eugene, aged 34 years. He is married and has one child, aged six. Eugene runs a pharmacy and has been selling medicines for three years. With the loan, he wants to buy more medicines to sell in his pharmacy. The profits from the business will be used to provide food for the family.

loans.use: To buy more medicines for sale.

loans.name: Olga Yanira

texts.es:
Olga, tiene una sala de belleza, ella tiene 36 años de edad, vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida junto con sus dos hijos de 8 y 15 años. Este negocio posee ya 14 años de, lo realiza de lunes a sábado de 8:00 am a 6:00 pm, este oficio lo aprendió por iniciativa propia y así obtener ingresos para darle un mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
El préstamo que requiere les permitirá comprar productos relacionados a la belleza como: cremas, labial, rubor, maquillaje, entre otros productos para que los clientes se sientas satisfechos, este le ayudara a incrementar su inversión y la clientela aumentara. 
Su objetivo es fortalecer el negocio para aumentar sus ingresos y con ello ofrece siempre a su familia una mejor vida.
texts.en:
Olga has a beauty salon. She is 36 years old and lives in her own house with her life partner and their two children, who are 8 and 15 years old. She has had this business for 14 years. She works from Monday to Saturday from 8:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. She learned this trade on her own; it is how she earns income to give her family a better quality of life.

The loan that she needs will allow her to purchase beauty-related products like creams, lipsticks, blush, foundation, and other products to satisfy her customers. This will help her to increase her investment, and her clientele will expand.

Her objective is to strengthen her business to increase income and, with that, to always give her family a better life.

loans.use: to purchase beauty-related products like creams, lipstick, blush, foundation, and more.

loans.name: Tuisacpon Group

texts.es:
La señora Herminia es madre soltera, tiene 29 años de edad, curso el segundo año de educacion secundaria, tiene 2 hijos que aún no estudian; ella se dedica a la artesanía, especifícamente a tejer guipiles, inició este negocio con su madre y hasta la fecha lleva 10 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo va a utilizar para comprar hilos para tejer guipiles, en el futuro quiere que su negocio crezca y contar con su propio capital; las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a la artesanía, agricultura y al comercio.
texts.en:
Herminia is 29 years old, she attended school up to the second year of secondary education and she is a single mother of 2 children who are not of schooling age. She is a craftswoman and she engages in weaving huipiles (traditional blouses); she has started this activity with her mother and she can count on a 10-years’ experience.

She has organized a group and she is requesting a loan that she will use to buy thread to weave huipiles. She wishes for her activity to grow in the future, in order to be able to count on her own working capital. The other members of the group engage in handicrafts, agriculture and retail.

loans.use: To buy thread.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
This is 37-year-old Fatmata.  She is married and has four children, aged 18, 14, 12 and 9 years. She has two additional dependents, who live with her for schooling.  In 2002, Fatmata established her commercial business. She began her business just to provide support to her husband. Her business is located at the outskirt of town, and her main customers are both men and women. Working seven days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about Le 350,000 every month from this business.

She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000. Fatmata has already received and successfully repaid one loan. Now she requires a new loan in order to buy more plastic and leather shoes. She hopes that this loan will enable her to solve her domestic problems. In the future, Fatmata plans to build a house, to educate her kids, and to own a shop. She is saying thanks to Kiva. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy plastic and leather shoes to resell

loans.name: Johalmo

texts.es:
Johalmo tiene 41 años de edad, esta divorciado y tiene dos hijos. Desde hace tres años administra su propia tienda. Antes trabajo como empleado en una tienda mas grande durante varios años; fue así como aprendió el negocio. Luego poco a poco fue comprando las cosas para instalar la tienda y como le demandaban bastante mercadería, él fue comprando más productos.  

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar dos quintales de frijol, un quintal de arroz, entre otros productos más para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes. Lo que más desea es satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes; para obtener ingresos para la subsistencia de su familia y ya no tener que necesitar prestamos para comprar la mercadería para la tienda.
texts.en:
Johalmo is 41 years old, he is divorced and has two children, and he has been running his own shop for three years. Having learned the job in the shop where he had previously been working for many years, he started establishing his shop buying the items he needed to set it up little by little, then gradually buying more products with the increase in his customers’ requests.

The loan he is now requesting to Fundación Campo will be used to buy two quintals of beans, one quintal of rice and other products to satisfy his customers’ requests. Meeting his customers’ needs is what he wants the most, in order to gain an income to support his family and to ask no more loans to buy products for his shop.

loans.use: To buy beans and rice.

loans.name: Luisita

texts.en:
Luisita is 52 years old and married with five children. She lives in Clarin Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates vegetables for sale in her local community and earns 10,000 PHP every month. 
Luisita joined GDMPC in 2011. She is applying for a 20,500 PHP to buy additional vegetables to sell and purchase chemicals for the garden. She plans to use all new profits to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables to sell and purchase chemicals for the garden

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en: Having repaid her previous loan, Melinda, a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy spare parts for her motorcycle. NWTF is re-listing Melinda's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her motorcycle.

loans.name: Riza

texts.en: The dried fish vending business that Riza previously funded through Kiva partner NWTF continues to provide income that is improving her and her family's quality of life. Now Riza is borrowing Php 10000 to further fund her food production business.

loans.use: To buy additional dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a proud farmer and patiently grows corn, which she sells to traders in her village. She goes down to the rice field everyday, both rainy or sunny. From selling the raised crop, she usually gains about PHP 20,000 each harvest season (twice in a year). Erlinda has been in her farming business for almost 15 years now. She has three children who need assistance from her, especially for school expenses.

Erlinda would like to improve her crop production, but she has inadequate funds. That is why she is asking for a loan of PHP 40,000. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers (urea), insecticides and pesticides used in the farming business. Someday, with stable income and more crop production, Erlinda will be able to give a fortunate life to her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers (urea), insecticides and pesticides used in the farming business

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Heng is a widowed mother of four children, who resides in Bovel district of Battambang province. Her two-hectare area of cassava planting has returned her about 28,000 KHR per day. She has been in the cassava-growing business for 12 years.

This is Heng's second loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully paid back her past loan, which has enabled her to upgrade her living to a proper standard. Now, she is seeking a new loan in order to pay the farmland leasing fee, and to buy cassava seedlings for replanting. She hopes to gain a high yield with more income, so that she can maintain her living at a good pace.

loans.use: To pay the farmland leasing fee, and to buy cassava seedlings to plant

loans.name: Da

texts.en:
Da, 31, is married and blessed with two children who are still in school. She struggles for a living through corn cultivation on a two-hectare area, whereas her husband works for others for a fee for extra income. She has been with this business for ten years. 

Da is in the second cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has managed her past loan wisely to better support her business with good progress. Now, she is seeking a new loan in order to pay for the plowing fee and seed. She hopes to grow her corn healthily and fruitfully so that she can make more profit.

loans.use: to pay for the plowing fee and seed.

loans.name: Lorena Patricia

texts.es:
Lorena,  solicita un nuevo préstamo por la necesidad de invertir más en su negocio y así salir adelante con la actividad que realiza. Dicho préstamo le permitirá comprar pan francés y pan dulce para ofrecer a los clientes.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a mejorar sus ventas e incrementar su inventario. Las condiciones de vida han mejorado y sus circunstancias económicas siguen igual.
texts.en:
Lorena is requesting another loan because she needs to invest more in her business in order to keep going with the work that she does. This loan will allow her to buy french bread and pastries to offer to her customers.

The previous loan helped her to improve her sales and increase her inventory. Her living conditions have improved and her economic circumstances remain the same.

loans.use: to purchase french bread and pastries to offer to her customers.

loans.name: Divino Niño Jesus Group

texts.es:
Divino Niño Jesús está en su ciclo número 7º del programa de comité de mujeres, donde cada una pone de si para salir adelante. Ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, que permite medir sus ingresos, donde 9 de ellas mostraron tener un ingreso muy bajo.
Una de ellas es Maria, quien se dedica a la venta de sabanas y manteles, todos de muy buena calidad. Es una muy buena vendedora, y que gracias a ello le está yendo muy bien. Ayuda a su familia por medio de su trabajo y gracias a ello no les falta nada.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de sabanas y manteles, para que de esa forma siga con sus ventas, consiga los ingresos que necesita y mejore su economía.
texts.en:
“Divino Niño Jesús” is in its 7th cycle of the women’s committee, where each one puts forth an effort to get ahead.  They are working on the elimination of poverty survey which allows them to measure their incomes.  Nine of them have shown a very low income.

Maria is one of the ladies and she sells sheets and table cloths, all of good quality.  She is a good saleswoman and thanks to this, things are going very well for her.  She helps her family through her work and thanks to her they are not in need of anything.

She is asking for this loan so that she can buy sheets and table cloths so that she can continue making sales and bring in the income she needs to improve her financial situation.

loans.use: to buy sheets.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María, de 62 años de edad, esta casada con Juan con quien tiene 7 hijos, pero solo vive con uno de ellos, al que cuida en la casa que heredó de sus padres hace 36 años. 
Desde hace 23 años se dedica a las tareas agrícolas y a la venta de animales menores como cuyes, cerdos, pollos; esto le permitió capitalizar y comprar ganado vacuno las que producen la leche que diariamente vende a las distintas ferias comerciales de los pueblos aledaños de su localidad y también los fines de semana en las ferias ganaderas. En algunas ocasiones su hijo le apoya en este negocio ,en sus tiempos libres, esta actividad le ha permitido educar a sus hijos y sostener los gastos que se requiere en su hogar, a pesar de las dificultades cuando las ventas son bajas. Su  capacidad para las ventas le ha ayudado bastante para convencer a sus clientes concretar sus ventas, ahora quiere para el futuro  aumentar su capital de trabajo.
María, invertirá los S/.800 soles en la compra de comida balanceada para nutrir a sus animales.
texts.en:
María, 62, is married to Juan. They have seven children but they only live with one of them who she cares for in the house she inherited from her parents 36 years ago. 

For the past 23 years she has worked in agriculture and sold small animals like guinea pigs, pigs and chickens. This allowed her to capitalize and buy cattle that produce the milk that she sells daily at different trade fairs in the neighboring villages and during the weekends in the cattle fairs. 
 
Sometimes her son helps her with this business. This work has allowed her to educate her children and maintain expenses needed for the home even when sales have been low. 

Her sales ability has helped a lot with convincing clients to buy. For the future she wants to increase her work capital. 

Maria will invest the 800 PEN [$325] to buy feed for her animals.

loans.use: to buy feed for her animals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more items like tires, motor parts, oil, and more to sell

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
This is Nelson. His previous loan was a big help in his business. He was able to buy more pigs and feed, thus generating more income. He has been in this business for eight years. He works hard to provide income for his family.

He would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan. He will use it to buy additional pigs and feed needed for his business. His profits from business will definitely help him to sustain his daily needs and the educational expenses of his children. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Nelson hopes that his business will continue to grow. He meets up with his co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of his life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more pigs and feed needed in his business.

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.en: Wilfredo is a fisherman from CPG, Bohol. He is a married man and a father of an eleven year old child.  Wilfredo is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and fuel for the boat.  He believes that this loan could help him in improving his fishing business.  In the future, Wilfredo dreams of expanding his business to become successful.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and fuel for the boat

loans.name: Nominiana

texts.en:
Nominiana, 53, is married and has five children. To make a living, she and her spouse grow corn on a hectare of land. Aside from maintaining a good income from the farming business, she is also engaged in a retailing business. She needs to be resourceful in generating income to sustain her family's needs, because the prices of basic commodities are increasing these days. Their children, who are currently going to school, also need a daily allowance.

Nominiana and her spouse plant and harvest corn to offer and sell to traders in their village. She now hopes to provide sustenance for the crops and enable them to grow healthier, allowing for larger harvests. Therefore, she is asking to borrow 20,000 PHP in additional capital. She will use it to pay for corn seeds, fertilizers, and land preparation. With a good income, she will be able to save funds that sustain her family and help them escape from poverty.

loans.use: to pay for corn seeds, fertilizers, and land preparation

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Due to financial difficulty, Cynthia engages in buying and selling of bananas and sweet potatoes in the community, while her husband plants bananas and root crops for his wife to sell. They aim to make their business profitable, in order to generate sufficient income to satisfy their needs and continue sending their two children to school.

Cynthia is asking to borrow additional capital of PHP10,000. She will use it to buy more stock of bananas and sweet potatoes, to resell in the market. Through hard work, she believes that she will be strengthening the business and making it a profitable source of income.

loans.use: to buy more stock of bananas and sweet potatoes to resell

loans.name: Eva May

texts.en:
Eva May is 26 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Eva May is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Eva May has been raising pigs for five years, and also earns additional income from a general store and e-loading (mobile prepaid load).

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Rosana

texts.es:
Rosana, de 41 años de edad, está casada con Venancio y ambos tienen 3 hijos, pero solo viven con uno de ellos, en su casa propia. Rosana se dedica a cultivar papa, habas, arveja, maíz, y verduras como la lechuga, lleva en esta actividad 26 años, junto a su esposo, quien muchas veces prefiere que ella, se quede en casa preparando los alimentos, pero a ella le gusta estar en el campo. Los terrenos propios y arrendados que siembran le dejan ingresos económicos considerables que utiliza para cubrir los gastos domésticos, la educación de sus hijos y sobre todo ahorrar dinero. En el futuro, piensa sembrar mayor cantidad, también piensa reabrir la tienda de venta de comestibles que tenía.Este es su quinto préstamo con KIVA, en todo este tiempo demostró ser una persona responsable por esto se compromete a ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.  
Rosana, invertirá los S/.1000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
41-year-old Rosana is married to Venancio.  The couple have three children but only live with one of them.  They live in their own home.

Rosana's business is growing potatoes, beans, peas, corn and greens such as lettuce.  She has been in this business for 26 years and works together with her husband.  Her husband often prefers her to stay home preparing food but she enjoys being out in the fields.  The couple own their own land and also rent some land which they plant to make a decent income.  This enables them to cover their household expenses.  They also use the money to educate their children and, most importantly, they save some of it.  In the future, Rosana plans to sow a larger quantity of crops.  She also plans to re-open a grocery store that she used to run.

This is Rosana's fifth loan from Kiva.  She has shown herself to be a responsible person and pledges to maker her loan repayments on time.

Rosana will invest the 1,000 soles she has requested in buying organic fertilizers to feed her crops.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Amy Maria

texts.es: Amy de 32 años de edad tiene un taller de confecciones ubicado en su residencia, allí elabora todo tipo de prendas femeninas. Este negocio lo inició una vez terminó su carrera profesional de Diseño de modas y como desde muy joven trabajó en el oficio de confecciones, de la mano de su madre, perfeccionó su experiencia y finalmente  le agregó valor después de viajar, en el año 2006, a España en misiones de conocimiento tecnológico, donde fortaleció  sus conocimientos en la industria textil. En la actualidad ha recibido 1 financiamiento de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,   y hoy está aplicando a un credikiva, mediante el cual  comprará una máquina industrial, para mejorar sus tiempos productivos e incrementar la calidad de las prendas; así mismo comprará telas, hilos, botones y otros insumos, con las que logrará fabricar nuevos y modernos diseños, para despertar la atención, el interés, el deseo y la acción de compra de sus clientes. Su meta mas adelante es ampliar su negocio  y tener un local para independizar el taller, de su vida familiar y aumentar el sosiego en su hogar. Su mayor desafío es la competencia de ropa de contrabando que existe en el mercado, pero ante esta amenaza  su estrategia es enfrentar esta situación, mediante la atención de sus clientes uno a uno, y trabajando a la medida de sus necesidades y requerimientos. Mientras esto ocurre maneja un margen de utilidad no menor del 35% y una rotación de materias primas de 5 días, indicadores financieros de los cuales parte su proyección futura para lograr el éxito de su inversión.
texts.en:
Amy is 32 years old and has a clothing workshop in her home, where she makes all types of women's clothing. She started this business after completing her professional education in fashion design. She has been making clothing from the time she was very young; she gained experience working alongside her mother. Finally, she added value after traveling to Spain in 2006 on a mission for technological knowledge, reinforcing her knowledge of the textile industry.

At present, she has received 1 loan from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, and she is now applying for a CrediKiva loan. With the loan she will buy an industrial sewing machine to improve her productive time and increase the quality of her clothing; likewise she will buy fabric, thread, buttons and other supplies with which she will be able to make new and modern designs to awaken the attention, interest, desire and purchasing action of her clients.

Her long-term goal is to expand her business and have a space for her workshop that is separate from her family life and will make her home a calmer place. Her greatest challenge is the competition from contraband clothing that exists in the market, but her strategy in the face of this threat is to confront the situation, gaining the attention of her clients one by one and working according to their needs and requirements. While this occurs she is managing a marginal utility of no less than 35% and a five-day rotation of raw materials, financial indicators that support her future projections for achieving success from her investment.

loans.use: to buy an industrial sewing machine, fabric, thread, buttons and other supplies

loans.name: Harithy's Group

texts.en:
Harithy, age 61 and a citizen from Thmor Koul district, Battambang province, is married and has five children. Her main source of income is vegetable growing. After 30 years' engagement in this business, she is able to earn up to 22,200 KHR per day.

This is not the first loan for Harithy with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past loan has enabled her to sustain her living in a proper condition, and she managed to repay the past loan already. Now, she forms a group of three, to apply for a new loan. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to pay the fee for plowing her land, and to buy seed, fertilizer, and insecticide for her farmland. She hopes that she can make more income from her current business and improve her living standard.

loans.use: to pay the fee for plowing her land, and to buy seed, fertilizer, and insecticide for growing vegetables

loans.name: Anne Marie

texts.fr: Anne est une femme de 40 ans, célibataire et mère d'un enfant. Elle possède et gère un boutique de vente d’oeufs dans un quartier de la ville depuis 1 ans. Dynamique et chaleureuse à l'accueil, elle sollicite ce crédit qui va lui permettre de renforcer son stock de marchandises afin d'augmenter ses ventes et ses profits. les bénéfices générés vont être réinvestis dans l'activité pour l'accroître d'une part et d'autre part injectés dans la construction d'une maison
texts.en:
Anne is a 40-year-old woman, unmarried and the mother of one child. She owns and maintains an egg shop in a neighborhood of the village, which she has done for the past year.

Anne has a warm and dynamic personality, and she is seeking this loan which will allow her to replenish her stock of merchandise to increase her profits. The profits generated from this will be both reinvested in her business and also put towards construction of a house.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise

loans.name: Un's Group

texts.en:
A 62-year-old married father of six children, one of whom is still in school, Un is a vendor who sells beef to pay for the daily necessities of his family. He has owned this business for about 10 years. 

Un is a seven cycle client with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). He has wisely utilized his past loans to maintain his family’s business, and to support his family. 

Now, he joins a group of three to apply for a new loan. He will use his loan portion, as the group leader, to buy more beef to sell. He hopes this purchase will supply sufficient meat to sell, so he can get more clients and additional income.

loans.use: To buy more beef to sell in his butcher shop.

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.en:
This is Guadalupe. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy more grocery items and she was able to generate more income. She also sells different fruits and vegetables and she focuses on this more than her variety store. She has been in this business for thirty years now. She was able to establish a good name in her community. She and her husband, who is a farmer, work hard to continuously provide income for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another PHP 50,000 loan to buy more fruits and vegetables. Her profits from her business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her child’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Guadalupe dreams that her business will be more successful. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more vegetables and fruits needed in her business.

loans.name: Sandra Maria

texts.es: Doña Sandra, una mujer trabajadora quien se encarga de todos los gastos del hogar debido a que su esposo esta sin empleo, pero recibe el apoyo de su hija que no estudia por dedicarse a trabajar, la señora continua con su negocio de hace muchos años la venta de pan y ropa usada. Ella solicita su octavo crédito con Afodenic para invertir en su negocio comprando variedad de ropa nueva zapatos y ropa de paca, ya que no tiene productos en su inventario para ofrecerle a la clientela, pero gracias a este préstamo volverá a invertir y espera ir creciendo.
texts.en: Sandra is a hard working woman who is in charge of all the household expenses because her husband does not have a job. She does receive support from a daughter who is not in school but works instead. She continues with her business that she has had for several years selling bread and used clothing. She is requesting her eighth loan with Afodenic to invest in her business by buying a a variety of new clothing, shoes and used clothing as she does not have products in her inventory to offer to her customers. Thanks to this loan, she will invest again and hopes to continue growing.

loans.use: to buy clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Thea's Group

texts.en:
Thea is 41 and a villager from the Sangke district of Battambang province. By working for others she struggles to make a decent income to support her family. Her husband is a vendor who buys and sells recycled items.

Thea has formed a group of two to apply for a new joint loan, as she would like to buy more recycled items for her husband to sell. This will be Thea’s seventh loan cycle with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. The past loans have enabled her to improve her family’s life, and she has completely repaid them. She is now requesting 600,000 KHR while her joint member is applying for 500,000 KHR. She hopes this loan will help her husband’s business stabilize and grow.

loans.use: To buy more recycled items for resale

loans.name: Rollan

texts.en:
This is Rollan, 54, resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Shirly, a housewife and a mother to his child. He, together with his wife, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for his family’s everyday expenses. 

Rollan operates a bookstore. His love for books brought him to make it a business. He has been in this business for four years now. His store is located adjacent to his house. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of PHP 400 (Philippine pesos) in sales every day.

To help him continue the operations of his business, he is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy more books to expand his product inventory. 

Rollan dreams to maintain his business and hopes to have more businesses for other sources of income. Every week, he meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his life and business and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more books needed in his business.

loans.name: Rosa Isabel

texts.es:
Rosa, requiere de un nuevo crédito por la necesidad de invertir más en el negocio de venta de ropa para así tener variedad de mercadería para los clientes. Este le permitirá comprar ropa para damas y niños.
Con el préstamo anterior incremento su inventario y aumentaron los ingresos ya que las ventas mejoraron. Las condiciones familiares han mejorado y las circunstancias económicas se mantienen.
texts.en:
Rosa needs a new loan in order to further invest in her clothing business.  This will help her to have a variety of merchandise available for her customers.  She will be able to buy both women's and children's clothing.

Rosa used her previous loan to add to her inventory and she improved her income because her sales increased.  Her family's conditions have improved whilst maintaining financial stability.

loans.use: to buy ladies' and children's clothing

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia, 60 years old, is married to a farmer, and they are blessed with four children. She has managed a piggery in their village for almost five years. She also sells chickens and ducks for additional income. When she sells five piglets, she makes a net income of 10,000 PHP.

Leticia is applying for a 30,000 PHP loan to buy feed for her hogs. She's hoping that she gets this loan so she can help her hogs thrive.

loans.use: To purchase feed for her hogs.

loans.name: Batsaikhan

texts.en:
Mr. Batsaikhan, 43 years old, lives with his wife in Kherlen, an eastern town of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land. Batsaikhan has been working as a serviceman at a private business entity since 2005 and has a reputation as the most skilled worker. In 2012, his wife began working as a nurse, and in one year she became professional. 

The kitchen of the house they live in has vulnerable walls and windows through which winds and storms seep and chill down the family to their core. So, Batsaikhan is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to purchase building and insulation materials, such as bricks, foam, fiberglass and planks. Using those materials, he will repair and insulate the house’s kitchen, thus reducing the use of coal, carbon emission, and also contributing to the efforts against air pollution. 

Batsaikhan is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase building and insulation materials such as foam, fiberglass and planks.

loans.name: Batmunkh

texts.en:
Mr. Batmunkh, 36 years old, lives with his family in Kherlen, an eastern town of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on plot of land. He has been rendering taxi services to local people since 2011 and accumulated a vast amount of experience. 
The house they live in has been deteriorating over the years and needs some serious repair. So he is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT (Mongolian Tugriks) to purchase building materials such as bricks, cement, wood planks and gypsum. As a result, the house will be renovated and won't lose heat through its walls and roof. More importantly, the renovated house will enable the family to burn less coal, emit less smoke and thus contribute to the efforts against air pollution. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase building materials

loans.name: Amparo Cecilia

texts.es:
Amparo compró materiales como suelas cuero, cuerina, hilos pegantes e hizo nuevos diseños de sandalias que vendió a su clientela. Desde que hizo esta inversión con recursos de Kiva aumentó su producción y sus ventas, trabajó mas tranquilamente sin prestar dinero a costos altos y por eso envía el siguiente mensaje a sus financiadores: “Estoy feliz de ser beneficiaria de este programa tan maravilloso, deseo para ustedes y sus familias lo mejor: “
 En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva, mediante el cual comprará una nueva máquina de coser, materiales para zapatería como suelas, sintéticos, cuero, hilos y accesorios, con los que planea sorprender a su clientela sacando al mercado nuevos y hermosos diseños a la medida de sus clientes y espera generar nuevos ingresos que oxigenen su negocio..
texts.en:
Amparo bought materials such as leather soles, faux leather, thread, and glue, and made new sandal designs that she sold to her customers.  Since she made this investment with resources from Kiva she increased her production and sales and worked comfortably without losing money to high costs.  This is why she has this message for her lenders: "I'm happy to be a beneficiary of this wonderful program.  I wish you and your families all the best."

Currently she's applying for a new Kiva loan to buy a new sewing machine and shoemaking supplies such as soles, synthetic materials, leather, thread, and accessories.

She plans to surprise her customers by bringing out beautiful new designs in accordance with her customers' needs.  She hopes to generate new income to give her business a breath of fresh air.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and shoemaking supplies

loans.name: Navy's Group

texts.en:
Navy, originally from the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, is 41 years old and blessed with one child. Her primary source of income is her one-and-a-half hectare farm where she grows cassava. Her husband works for others to make money. She has been farming for seven years and makes up to 17,900 KHR a day.

Navy, a first-time borrower, is part of a three-member group that is applying for a new 8,000,000 KHR loan with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. Of this, 2,000,000 KHR will be her loan portion. She will use it to lease a plot of farmland, pay for plowing fees and buy insecticides. She hopes to earn more money so that she can maintain a good living standard.

loans.use: to lease a plot of farmland, pay for plowing fees and buy insecticides.

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es: Marco Antonio, está casado, vive con su esposa y 3 hijos que son su mayor prioridad. El con el crédito pretende comprar un ternero nuevo para su finca. Marco posee terreno apto para la explotación de estos animales por lo cual quiere comprar más animales para explotar su terreno, el se ha dedicado desde hace ya varios años y le ha ido bien por lo cual quiere seguir con su proyecto. El espera aumentar el número de animales a su poder y así poder aumentar la producción de leche para el consumo de su hogar, a su vez minimizar sus gastos y generar más ingresos.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Marco Antonio is married. He lives with his wife and three children who are his highest priority. He hopes to use the loan to buy a new calf for his farm. Marco's land is ideal for raising animals, and for this reason he would like to buy more animals. He has worked in this area for many years and it has been going well for him, which is why he would like to continue on with the project. He hopes to increase the number of animals on his farm so that he can increase his milk production for his household consumption, and at the same time reduce his expenses and generate more income. 

This Marco's first loan from FUDECOSUR. He has not relied on loans from state banks before but FUDECOSUR allowed him to take our a loan much more easily with a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy calves for his farm.

loans.name: Mirna Cecilia

texts.es: Doña Mirna de 40 años de edad se dedica al cultivo de maiz y sorgo desde hace 15 años vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, ella vende sus productos cada 10 meses a los cormerciantes de la zona, ella solicita credito para comprar mas insumos agricolas: abono, fertilizantes, semillas y otras herramientas que necesita para su cultivo, ya que con las ventas que realiza ha podido tener muchas ganancias y a podido solventar los gastos en su hogar.
texts.en:
Mirna is forty years old, and for the last fifteen years she has grown corn and sorghum.  She lives in her own home with her two children.  She sells her products every ten months to merchants in the area.

She is seeking a loan in order to buy more framing supplies, such as compost, fertilizer, seeds and tools that she needs for her crops.  She has made good profits by selling her crops, and she has been able to cover her household expenses.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Sopha

texts.en:
Sopha, living in Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, is 31 years old and blessed with four children. To feed the entire family, she does cassava cropping on two hectares of farmland and runs a small grocery stall at home while her husband raises pigs for extra income. This is the business that she has had experience in for six years. 
She is a five time borrower with Vision Fund (Kiva’s partner).  She has fully repaid her past loans with success and it has enabled her to lift her lifestyle progressively. Now, she is seeking a new loan to pay a plowing fee and a weeding fee for her crops. Additionally, she will use a portion of it to build a pigpen for her pig-raising business. Sopha hopes to earn more income from both businesses so she can build a bigger house for her family.

loans.use: To pay a plowing fee and a weeding fee for her crops

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more cologne, shampoo, conditioner, lotion, cosmetics and used clothes to sell

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
This is Carmen. She previously accessed a PHP 17,000 loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another PHP 19,000 loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Carmen hopes that her business will continue to grow. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es: Angélica, de 39 años de edad , esta casada con William con quien tiene dos hijos a los que cuida en su casa propia.Estudió la carrera de trabajo social en una universidad reconocida, desea poder sacar su título para poder ejercer su carrera, pero como es una mujer con mucha iniciativa comenzó a incursionar en algunos trabajos eventuales . Su principal ingreso económico se sustenta en la crianza de animales, como cerdos, cuyes y ovejas, a los que cría y alimenta para después venderlos a un mayor precio. Ya la conocen y tiene clientes fijos, de los cuales obtiene ganancias estables. Asimismo, por las tardes comenzó a vender comida a 4 personas, quienes la pagan por la alimentación completa del día. Obtiene buenas ganancias, pues utiliza la carne de sus mismos animales.Angélica, invertirá los S/.500 soles en la compra de comida balanceada para nutrir a sus animales.
texts.en:
Angélica, 39, is married to William, with whom she has two children.  She takes care of them in her own house.  She studied social work in a well-known university.

She wants to be able to get her degree so she can practice her profession, but because she's a woman with a lot of initiative she began to take some temporary jobs.  Her main income comes from raising animals such as pigs, guinea pigs, and sheep.  She raises and fattens them for sale at a greater price.  She has regular customers who know her and provide her with stable earnings.

In addition, she began selling food in the afternoon to four people who pay her for all their food every day.  She makes a good profit because she uses the meat from her own animals.

She'll invest the 500 soles [PEN] in balanced feed to nourish her animals.

loans.use: to buy balanced animal feed

loans.name: Nahomi

texts.es: Nahomi, está en unión libre, vive con su hombre y  tiene 2 hijos que son su mayor prioridad. Ella con el crédito pretende comprar un ternero nuevo para el terreno que le prestan. Ella quiere sacarle al máximo de provecho a ese terreno que le prestan y así poder mantener sus animales en pastos buenos y poder engordarlos rápido para generarles ganancias. Ella se ha dedicado desde hace varios años a este actividad por lo cual sabe y cree que comprando ese ternero le podrá sacar buenas ganancias. Ella espera aumentar sus ingresos y darles a su familia especialmente a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.  Es el primer  préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Nahomi lives with her common-law husband and their two children, who are her top priority.  She intends to use this loan to buy a calf and raise it on the land that they rent.

She wants to take full advantage of this land and thus be able to provide good pasture for her animals so that she can fatten them rapidly in order to make income.  She has done this work for several years.  Based on her knowledge, she believes that this calf will enable her to make a good profit.  She hopes to increase her income and give her family, especially her children, a better quality of life.

This is her first loan from FUDECOSUR.  She has not previously taken loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has brought her this loan with greater ease and much lower interest rates.

loans.use: to buy a calf.

loans.name: Sreyven's Group

texts.en:
Sreyven is 32 and a citizen from Dambae district of Kampong Cham province. She has one child to care for. To earn a living, she grows cassava on a two hectare area and does rice cropping on a half hectare area. Her eight years of experience in her current business has returned about 20,000 KHR (Cambodian riel) per day. From this income, she is able to save up to 5,000 KHR per day after deducting necessary expenses. 
This is not the first loan for Sreyven with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has paid back her past loan on time and wisely to support her business. In a group of four, she is the group leader. She and her joint members are seeking for 2,000,000 KHR each. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to pay for weeding fees and a transplanting fee. She hopes that she can grow her cassava fruitfully and gain a triple yield.

loans.use: To pay for weeding fees and transplanting fees

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a 51-year-old married woman having only one child. She is thankful because her previous loan has helped her much in improving her sales and profit. 

Susan has run her retail store for three years. The gained income from her business goes toward her daily consumption, monthly electric bill, and serves as her savings.

Susan would like to take out a loan of PHP 20,000, allowing her to buy necessary grocery items such as soft drinks, assorted biscuits, canned goods and various kinds of ingredients for her retail store. She knows that, through her requested loan amount, she could further improve her way of living along with her financial stability.

Susan hopes that her requested loan amount will be granted for continuous growth of her retail business.
