loans.use: to buy grocery items such as soft drinks, assorted biscuits, canned goods and various kinds of ingredients for her retail store.

loans.name: Sreang

texts.en:
A 43-year-old mother residing in a village located in the Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham province, Sreang is a farmer who makes a living through rice farming. She has nine children in total, five of whom still count on her as three of them are still in school while another two are too young for schooling. 
To earn extra income, her husband also works at a construction site as a paid worker. This is the first loan for Sreang with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Now, she wants to start up a new business for extra income, pig-raising. Therefore, she is taking out this new loan to buy pigs and build a pigpen. She highly hopes that she can raise her pigs in a healthy condition whereby she can earn more income to better her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy more pigs and build a pigpen

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en: Nenita, who is married and works hard to support her family, has had a fish vending business in the Philippines.for nine years. Nenita has requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell, and in the future would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Jose Humberto

texts.es:
José, solicita un nuevo préstamo porque necesita invertir más dinero en la producción de granos básicos. Este le permitirá comprar insumos agrícolas tales como: abono, plaguicidas, herbicidas, insecticidas, entre otros. 
Con el crédito anterior aumentaron los ingresos y estos los invirtió en los gastos del hogar.  Las condiciones económicas mejoraron gracias al crédito que kiva le otorgo.
texts.en:
José is applying for a new loan because he needs to invest more money in the production of basic foods. This will allow him to buy agricultural supplies such as compost, pesticides, herbicides, and insecticides, among other items.

With his previous loan, his income increased, and he invested it in household expenses. His economic condition improved thanks to the loan that Kiva granted him.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies such as compost, pesticides, herbicides, and insecticides, among other items

loans.name: Phat's Group

texts.en:
A young local farmer from Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Phat is 19 years old and blessed with one child. To deal with her family’s hardships, Phat cultivates cassava on one hectare of land. In business for three years, she is able to earn up to 13,800 KHR per day.

With her successful previous loan from Kiva partner VisionFund, since repaid, Phat feels confident that she can retain her living standard and grow her business at a good pace. Now, as part of a group of two, she is requesting her second loan. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to pay for weeding and to buy insecticide for her farmland. Phat hopes to grow her cash-crop on time and gain a high yield in order to earn more income for her child's sake.

loans.use: To pay for weed clearance and to buy insecticide for her farmland.

loans.name: Fatto

texts.ru:
Фатто живет в сельской местности, в далёком от города кишлаке. Он имеет большой десятилетний  опыт в сфере животноводство.  Еще его отец занимался разведением скота и Фатто  с детство помогал отцу.  Теперь это его доход и заработок на жизнь. Он вырос  пошёл по стопам отца. Начал свое дело с пяти голов барана.  Поначалу ему было нелегко, особенно в зимнее время.  Но годами опыт доказывал своё и Фатто стал находить пути решения препятствий и способы для лучшего продвижения своего дела.  Теперь на сегодня он имеет более 50 голов барана и недавно купил корову.  Его жена и пятеро детей также вовлечены в это дело.   В связи с сезонностью он не может продать своих баранов сейчас, так как цены на них упали.   Фатто нуждается в дополнительных средствах для дальнейшего корма скота и приобретения нового скота. 
 С этой целью он обратился в МДО «Арванд» за кредитом. На полученный кредит планирует купить корм для скота. Выражает благодарность Арванд за содействие и огромную роль в его жизни.
texts.en: Fatto lives in a rural area, far from the city Kishlake.  He has 10 years of experience working with livestock.  His father bred livestock and Fatto helped him throughout his childhood.  Now the business is his income, it is how he earns a living. Now grown, he followed in his father's footsteps starting his own business with 5 head of ram.  Starting out was difficult, especially during the winter.  But his years of experience proved useful and he began finding ways to overcome obstacles and improve.  Today, he owns more than 50 rams, and recently he bought a cow.  His wife and 5 children take part as well.  Due to the current season, he cannot sell his rams since prices for them have fallen.  Fatto needs additional funds for feed and to buy new livestock.  With this goal, he turned to Arvand for a loan which he plans to use for these purposes.  He is grateful to Arvand for the support and big role it plays in his life.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed

loans.name: Bienvenida

texts.en: Bienvenida is 56 years old, married, with two children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a business selling firewood in the local community to earn a living. She has been in her business for over six years and earns 5,000 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in the year 2010, and now she has requested a loan of 7,500 PHP to pay for coconut wood. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to pay for coconut wood

loans.name: Deyvis Junior

texts.es:
Deyvis es un joven de 19 años de edad, el cual vive en la ciudad de Imperial, ciudad con un clima muy variado y se desarrolla la agricultura. Deyvis es un joven con muchas ganas de salir adelante, sobre todo porque quiere ser orgullo de sus padres y poder apoyarlos y brindarles una vida mejor. Desde tempranas horas de la mañana Deyvis trabaja como ayudante en un puesto de venta de pesado en el mercado de su ciudad, especialmente en las mañanas ya que también tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de venta de cuyes, desde hace un tiempo, aproximadamente atiende hasta 20 clientes diariamente; el cree que está saliendo adelante en su trabajo porque es responsable y sobre todo tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante.

Deyvis está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva ya que gracias la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá construir una jaula para criar a los cuyes, ya que actualmente tiene alrededor de 30 de estos animalitos, de los cuales 19 son hembras y están preñadas y el espacio que tiene actualmente es muy pequeño; con esta mejora podrá podra criar de mejor manera a los cuyes y mejorar sus ingresos, así seguirá luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener una gran granja de cuyes y ser un gran microempresario”.
texts.en:
Deyvis is a young man of 19 years of age. He lives in the town of Imperial, a town with very varied weather and agricultural activity. Deyvis is a young man with a great deal of drive to get ahead, especially because he wants his parents to be proud of him. He also wishes to be able to support them and improve their living conditions. From the early hours of the morning Deyvis works as a helper at a fish stand in the market of his town. He works mainly in the mornings, since he also owns a small business selling guinea pigs. He has owned the business for a while and he serves up to 20 customers a day, approximately. He believes that he's been getting ahead in his work because he's responsible and above all he has a great deal of drive to get ahead.

Deyvis is very thankful to Kiva lenders, since thanks to their help he'll be able to build a crate for raising the guinea pigs. He currently has about 30 of these little animals and 19 of them are females who are pregnant, and the space he has now is very small. With this improvement he'll be able to raise the guinea pigs in better conditions and improve his profits. That way he'll keep on striving in order to make his biggest dream come true: "To own a big guinea pig farm and be a great microentrepreneur".

loans.use: to build a crate.

loans.name: Altangul

texts.en: Altangul, 26 years old, lives with her husband, son, mother and younger brother in Darkhan, the second largest city of Mongolia. Her mother has retired from work and gets a state pension. Her younger brother studies at college. Her husband has been working as a fuel distributor at a filling station. She herself has been running a business selling clothes for a long time and accumulated a vast amount of experience in this type of business. Now she has an infant baby and can't pay full attention to her business so her younger brother is running her business during his free time. She is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to purchase trousers in large quantity from China. As a result, she can continue to run her business without worrying about an inventory shortage. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase trousers in large quantity

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
This is Margie. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy more grocery items, and she was able to generate more income. She has been in this business for ten years now. She and her husband, who is a policeman, work hard to provide income for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another loan, of 15,000 PHP.  She will use it to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Margie dreams that her business will continue to grow. She meets up with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad is 33 years old and married.  She lives  in Balug and has a grocery store in her home, which she has run for three years. She chose this type of business because she can earn an acceptable income and help out with household expenses.

Felicidad is requesting a loan for 5,000 PHP, which she will use to expand her business by buying more products, so that she can offer a wider variety to her customers and boost her earnings. Her dream is to remodel her grocery store.

loans.use: to purchase noodles, coffee, spices, and snack foods for her business.

loans.name: Joaquín

texts.es: Don Joaquin de 50 años de edad se dedica a la agricultura cultiva maiz y sorgo, vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos en casa propia, se caracteriza por ser un hombre trabajador, honesto y sobre todo responsable, con las ventas que realiza de sus cultivos le permiten llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar, ha decidido invertir en la compra de los insumos agrícolas necesarios por eso solicita credito para poder comprar semillas, abonos, fertilizantes  y asi poder seguir realizando su trabajo que es lo que le permite cubrir todos los gastos de su hogar ya que la siembra es su principal fuente de ingreso.
texts.en:
Joaquín is 50 years old. He makes his living in agriculture, crowing corn and sorghum. He lives with his wife and his two children in his own house. He is characterized by being a hardworking, honest, and above all, responsible man. Selling his crops allows him to feed his family every day. 

Joaquín has decided to invest in the purchase of necessary agricultural supplies, so he is requesting a loan to buy seeds, soil amendments, and fertilizers so that he can continue doing his work; this work is what allows him to cover all his household costs, since farming is his principle source of income.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies like soil amendments, fertilizer, etc.

loans.name: Sorphorn's Group

texts.en:
Sorphorn is 27 years old, married, and residing in a village of Kampong Cham province’s Thabung Khmum district. She has been blessed with three kids, two sons and one daughter. To provide for her family's basic daily needs, she grows rice, as the main source of income. To supplement the family’s income, she is also a vendor who purchases others’ cassava yield, which she resells later, when the price is high. She is able to earn up to 23,000 KHR per day from the current business, which she has been with for nine years.

Sorphorn is new to VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She joins a group that totals four female members, to apply for a new loan. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to plow her farmland and to buy cassava from others to resell. She hopes to earn more income and make more profit, for her family’s sake.

loans.use: To plow her farmland, and to buy cassava from other farmers to resell

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Malen's Group

texts.en:
Malen, 29, is a farmer from Dambae district of Kampong Cham province. She is the mother of two schoolchildren. Six hectares of cassava cultivation are the primary source of her income. To better feed the family, her husband also works for others, for a fee, after helping her on the family business. Having been with the current business for several years, she is able to earn up to 34,700 KHR per day.

Malen is a fourth-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past loan has returned a positive impact on her lifestyle, because her financial condition has been moved forward to a better shape. Now, she is in a group of two, for a new loan. She is seeking to borrow 1,400,000 KHR and her co-borrower is applying for 500,000 KHR. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to pay labor costs and to buy herbicide for her cassava. She hopes to make more income and upgrade her living status greater than before.

loans.use: To pay labor costs and to buy herbicide for her cassava

loans.name: Sina's Group

texts.en: Residing in a house covered by a thatched roof in Kampong Cham province, Sina is 32 years old and one of the breadwinners in the family consisting of five members including her three children who are still in school. She, with support from her husband, makes a living through rice farming; it is the business that she has been in for 14 years and she is able to earn almost 14,000 KHR per day. Sina is a first time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is now in a group of three female members and she is the leader. Sina will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer and to pay the plowing fee for her crops. She hopes to earn more income from her current business so that she can make progress for a good living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to pay the plowing fee for her crops

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Savuth

texts.en:
Savuth, age 41, has been blessed with three children, two sons and one daughter. She covers the daily cost of living by selling meatballs, whereas her husband is the in-charge person at a construction site. This is the only business that she has been with for 21 years.

With VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), Savuth is a first-time borrower. She is seeking a new loan, which she will use to support her husband's occupation, by purchasing a cement-mixing machine. She hopes that her husband will earn more income from his current job and better the family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: To purchase a cement-mixing machine

loans.name: Richelle

texts.en:
Due to a lack of job opportunities, Richelle engages in buying and selling of Avon, Natasha, Board Walk and MSE products to help her husband in generating income. She is 31 years old and has two infant-aged children. She and her husband aim to earn and save more income, to satisfy their necessities, renovate their house and educate both of their children.

To make an improvement in her business, Richelle is asking to borrow additional capital of PHP 5,000. She will use the loan to buy more stock to resell, of  Avon, Natasha, Board Walk and MSE products. Despite the hardships of living, Richelle and her husband have the strong determination to uplift their standard of living in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stock to resell, of Avon, Natasha, Board Walk and MSE products

loans.name: Tis

texts.en:
Tis, age 43, is a widow and has four children. Tis and her children are living in the Kror Kor district of Pursat Province. She solely depends on a single business, rice farming on a two-hectare area. She has been farming for 30 years and is able to generate up to 19,600 KHR per day.

Tis has taken two loans before this one. She succeeded in using her past loan to support her business on time. Now, she wants to focus on her house's condition. Therefore, she is applying for a new loan, which she will use to buy wooden boards with which to renovate her house, especially the wall. She hopes this purchase will enable her to fix her wall timely, so that she can own a decent house for her kids.

loans.use: To buy wooden boards with which to renovate her house

loans.name: Pov's Group

texts.en: Pov is 45 years old and married. She has three schoolchildren residing in Kror Kor district of Pursat Province. She is a local school teacher as her regular source of income. To earn additional income, she grows rice and raises pigs. She has been involved in the current business for 26 years and is able to earn up to 46,000 KHR per day. Pov is a five time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has already repaid her past loan which has enabled her to sustain her living and keep her children in school. Now, she wants to expand her pig-raising business in a good manner. She is in a group of four to apply for a new loan. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy more pigs to raise. She expects to raise her pigs in a healthy condition so that she can make more profit for her kids' sake.

loans.use: To buy more pigs to raise

loans.name: Nonvignon Group

texts.fr: Le groupe NONVIGNON est formé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La  représentante de ce groupe, nommée Akossiwa Mauriena, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la quatrième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Akossiwa Mauriena est âgée de 29 ans et est mariée à un photographe nommé Gildas. Le couple a un enfant, qui est scolarisé et à leur charge. Akossiwa Mauriena vit ensemble avec son enfant et son mari. Le couple subvient ensemble aux divers besoins du ménage. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Akossiwa Mauriena vend des tissus par le système de distribution depuis près de huit ans. Akossiwa Mauriena s’approvisionne à Lomé au Togo. Dans le souci de renforcer davantage son activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Akossiwa Mauriena désire augmenter le stock de ses produits. Pour ce faire, Akossiwa Mauriena sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe NONVIGNON, un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The NONVIGNON group consists of three members who live in the same neighborhood.  The group's representative, named Akossiwa Mauriena, is the woman raising her hand in the photo.  It is the fourth time that this group is requesting financial assistance from ALIDé, in order to increase the level of its activity.

Akossiwa Mauriena is 29 years old and married to a photographer named Gildas.  They have one child, who goes to school and is their financial dependent.  Akossiwa Mauriena lives with her child and husband.  The couple jointly takes care of the household needs.  In order to meet her various expenses, Akossiwa Mauriena has been selling fabrics, through the distribution system, for almost eight years.  She stocks up in Lomé, Togo.

Eager to further strengthen her activity and to better meet the expectations of her customers, Akossiwa Mauriena would like to increase her stock of merchandise.  In order to do so, she and the other members of the NONVIGNON group, are requesting a fourth loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy fabrics.

loans.name: Cristian Eduardo

texts.es:
Cristian es un joven de 23 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Camaná, ciudad con un clima cálido, una agricultura variada, entre las cuales se caracteriza el cultivo del arroz y frejoles, asimismo se desarrolla la pesca y sus playas son muy hermosas. Cristian es un joven muy alegre pero muy responsable ya que día a día trabaja como chofer de taxi y transita por las calles de su ciudad en busca de clientes; Cristian puede atender hasta 20 clientes diariamente y el cree que está saliendo adelante con su trabajo porque es muy amable con los clientes y responsable cuando conduce.

Cristian está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá realizar mejoras en la vivienda donde habita, ya que podrá mejorar las paredes, mejorar las tuberías y reparar el techo de su vivienda, de esta manera tendrá una mejor vivienda y su familia podrá mejorar su calidad de vida, asi el seguirá luchando cada día por hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener una profesión y ser una gran empresario”.
texts.en:
Cristian is a young man of 23. He lives in the city of Camaná, a city with a warm climate and a varied agriculture, which distinguishes itself by the cultivation of rice and beans. Similarly, fishing is developing, and it beaches are very beautiful. Cristian is a very happy young man, but he is also very responsible, since he works every day as a taxi driver and goes through the streets of his city in search of customers. Cristian can serve about 20 customers a day, and he believes that he is getting ahead in his work because he is very friendly to his customers and is responsible when he drives.

Cristian is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to the help that they offer him, he will be able to make improvements in the house where he lives, since he will be able to improve the walls and the plumbing and repair the roof of his house. In this way he will have a better home and his family will be able to improve their quality of life. Thus he will continue striving every day to make his great dream a reality: "to have a career and to be a great businessman."

loans.use: to improve his home (repair the walls, plumbing, and roof)

loans.name: Pedro Cesar

texts.es:
Pedro tiene 34 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Chincha, la cual se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y una gastronomía variada. Pedro vive al lado de su esposa y junto a ella tiene un pequeño hijo de 4 años de edad, a quien quiere muchísimo y por la cual trabaja muy duro para poder darle una vida digna y poder brindarle todo su amor y cariño.

Día a día Pedro trabaja en su pequeño negocio de elaboración y venta de helados y dulces, le gusta mucho su trabajo sobre todo porque Pedro comenta que es muy dulce con los clientes y por ello siempre regresan a comprar sus productos, en ocasiones también trabaja como albañil y con ello tiene un dinero extra para los gastos del hogar; el cree que está saliendo adelante porque es responsable y tiene un motivo muy grande para luchar el cual es su hijo.

Pedro está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá realizar mejoras en su vivienda, ya que podrá mejorar el techo y las paredes las cuales se encuentran con algunas grietas, así el podrá tener una vivienda más segura y seguir luchando para poder salir adelante y hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su casa terminada y poder darle una profesión a su hijo”.
texts.en:
Pedro, 34, lives in the city of Chincha, which is known for its warm climate and varied cuisine.  Pedro lives with his wife, and together they have a small 4-year old child who they love very much.  They work very hard to give their child a decent life and provide him with all of their love and affection.

Pedro works in his small business, making and selling ice cream and sweets.  He likes his work a lot, most of all because his customers always return to buy his products because he is so nice to his customers.  At times, he also works in construction to earn some extra money for the household expenses.  He believes that he is getting ahead because he is responsible, and because he has the greatest motivation to strive to succeed:  his son.

Pedro is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, because thanks to the help that they are providing, he will be able to make some improvements to his house. He will be able to make some repairs to his roof and walls, which have some cracks.  This way, he will have a more secure home, and will be able to continue to strive to get ahead and make his greatest dream a reality: to finish his house and see his child become a professional.

loans.use: to make improvements to his house

loans.name: Sara

texts.es: Doña Sara de 52 años de edad vive con sus hijos en casa propia, ella se dedica a la venta de tamales ya  tiene varios años con el negocio, vende en los alrededores de la zona donde vive y es muy conocida, se ha hecho de mucha clientela. Doña Sara es una mujer resposnsable, dedicada a su labor, con las ganancias que obtiene ha podido sacar adelante a sus dos hijos, desea invertir en su negocio por la demanda que tiene pero necesita de capital para poder hacerlo por eso solicita un credito que le ayuda a comprar todos los materiales para la elaboracion de sus tamales como: hojas de huerta, maiz, pollo, verduras, etc. Tiene buenas referencias de pago asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y asi podra darla a su familia una mejor calidad de vida sin limitacion alguna.
texts.en:
Sara, 52, lives with her children in her own house.  She makes a living selling tamales and has had the business for several years.  She sells on the outskirts of the area where she lives.  She's very well known and has acquired a lot of customers.

Sara's a responsible woman who's dedicated to her job.  With her profits she has been able to get her two children ahead.

She wants to invest in her business because of demand she has, but she needs capital to be able to do it.  That's why she's requesting a loan to help her buy all the materials to make her tamales: plantain leaves, corn, chicken, vegetables, etc.

She has a good payment record and is certain she'll be able to repay the debt and give her family a better quality of life without any limitations.

loans.use: to buy materials to make tamales

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 50 years old and married. She lives in the Philippines and earns a living by raising pigs. She has been in this business for 23 years, and she earns additional income from buying and selling rice. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream:  to save money to expand her business.

Rebecca is borrowing 5,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) through ASKI. She will use the loan to buy additional vitamins for her pigs.

loans.use: to buy additional vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Pov's Group

texts.en:
Pov, age 46, is a local resident from the Sampov Meas district of Pursat Province. She has eight children in total, three of whom are still in school. To support this big family, she makes and sells porridge, and grows rice on three hectares of land. She is able to earn up to 21,400 KHR per day from the current businesses. She has been with these businesses for 20 years.

This is Pov's second loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has succeeded in paying back her past loan wisely, and she managed to use it to improve her business. Now, she leads a group of four, to apply for a new loan.  The total amount of her group loan is 3,500,000 KHR. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy ingredients for making porridge. She hopes to earn more income for her family.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for making porridge to sell

loans.name: David Jonatan

texts.es: David de 35 años de edad vive con su esposa y sus 3 hijos en casa propia,es agricultor cultiva y comercializa granos básicos como maíz, frijol y maicillo y con las ganancias que obtiene puede llevar el pan de cada dia a su hogar, es un hombre trabajador, honesto, humilde y muy responsable con sus obligaciones de esposo y padre de familia. El desea comprar insumos agrícolas para  las próximas cosechas por eso solicita un crédito para poder comprar semillas, abonos, fertilizantes y pesticidas así él podrá seguir llevando el sustento diario a su hogar.
texts.en: David, who is 35 years old, lives with his wife and their three children in their own house. He is a farmer. He grows and sells basic foods such as corn, beans, and sorghum, and with the earnings that he obtains he can provide the daily sustenance to his household. He is a hard-working man, honest, humble, and very responsible with his obligations as husband and father of a family. He wants to buy agricultural supplies for the next crops, and this is why he is applying for a loan to be able to buy seeds, compost, fertilizers, and pesticides. Thus he will be able to continue providing the daily sustenance to his home.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Luisa Isabel

texts.es:
Luisa tiene 40 años, pero tiene la alegría y el carisma de una joven de 20, ella vive en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad cálida y con atractivos turísticos Hermosos. Luisa ha atravesado por muchas adversidades pero a pesar de ello ha seguido adelante a pesar de todo. Debido a sus pocos recursos económicos solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar una carrera universitaria, especialmente ser profesora.

Tal es asi que desde muy joven aprendió a ganar el pan con el sudor de la frente y luego de mucho esfuerzo y ahorro logro iniciar su negocio de venta de golosinas y bebidas gaseosas; ella trabaja alrededor de 9horas al día y también en ocasiones trabaja limpiando locales n una urbanización de su ciudad con lo cual obtiene un dinero extra; ella cree que está saliendo adelante porque es responsable y sobre todo tiene muchas ganas de mejorar.

Luisa está muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar más golosinas como chocolates, chizitos, galletas, gaseosas, entre otros, de esta manera podrá tener más variedad de productos y podrá mejorar sus ingresos, lo que le permitirá seguir luchando en busca de hacer realidad su más grande sueño:”Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Luisa is 40 years old but has the happiness and charisma of a 20 year old.  She lives in the city of Ica, which is warm and has beautiful tourist attractions.  Luisa has overcome a lot of adversity but in spite of that, she has continued forward.  Due to her lack of financial resources, she was only able to attend school through the fifth year of secondary school, but she would have liked to study at the university to become a teacher.

From an early age, she learned to earn her bread with her own sweat.  After a lot of effort and savings, she succeeded in starting her own business selling snacks and soft drinks.  She works around 9 hours a day and also sometimes works cleaning homes in a residential area of her city to earn extra money.  She believes that she is getting ahead because she is responsible and eager to improve.

Luisa is very grateful to the Kiva lenders since thanks to their help, she will be able to purchase more snacks such as chocolates, corn snacks, cookies, sodas, and other items.  This will allow her to have a larger variety of products which will improve her income.  This will help her continue working towards making her biggest dream come true: having her own home.

loans.use: to purchase sweets (chocolates, soda, corn snacks, and more).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as shirts, bathing suits, pants, and others.

loans.name: Amparo

texts.es:
Amparo a sus 55 años de edad, se dedica desde hace 20 años a la confección. Laboró por mucho tiempo como empleada en diferentes talleres de su localidad y desde hace siete años tomó la determinación de independizarse con el fin de crear su propio negocio y mejorar sus ingresos. 
Hoy la confección se ha convertido en su principal actividad económica y gracias a esta su familia goza de mejores condiciones de vida.
Amparo es una mujer llena de sueños, por lo cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito para la compra de telas e hilos con el propósito de crear una línea de ropa para bebe, la cual espera comercializar y distribuir en los almacenes de su municipio. 
Espera que esta inversión le permita aumentar sus ingresos y crecer dentro del mercado local y generar nuevas fuentes de empleo.
texts.en:
Amparo, at the age of 55, has worked in sewing for more than 20 years. She worked for a long time as an employee in different workshops in her area, and 7 years ago she decided to become independent, with the goal of creating her own business and improving her income. 

Now sewing has become her principal business, and thanks to this her family enjoys better living conditions.

Amparo is a woman full of dreams, and that is why she is applying for a loan to buy fabrics and thread for the purpose of creating a line of clothing for babies, which she hopes to sell and distribute to the stores of her municipality.

She hopes that this investment will allow her to increase her income, grow within the local market, and generate new sources of employment.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and thread

loans.name: Wuillian Alexi

texts.es:
Wuillian, solicita un nuevo préstamo para mejorar el moto taxi y así poder ofrecer un   mejor servicio  para sus clientes. Este le permitirá comprar toldos, llantas y para el mantenimiento del moto taxi.
Con el crédito anterior le permitió mejorar su negocio exprés, incrementaron sus clientes  y sus ingresos. Las circunstancias familiares se optimizaron, la vivienda logro remodelarla y adquirir electrodomésticos para el hogar.
texts.en:
Wuillian is requesting a new loan to improve his moto taxi and be able to offer better service to his customers.  The loan will allow him to purchase tarpaulin and tires to do maintenance on his moto taxi.

His last loan allowed him to improve his express business and increase his customers and income.  His family circumstances have optimized, he succeeded in remodeling his home and purchasing appliances for his household.

loans.use: to purchase tarpaulin and tires to maintain his moto taxi.

loans.name: Mianlebenin Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MIANLEBENIN est formé de trois personnes qui habitent dans la même zone. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Laure Nicole, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Laure Nicole est âgée de 40 ans et n'a pas fréquenté l’école. Laure Nicole est mariée à un certain Damien. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Laure Nicole vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et subvient avec son mari aux divers besoins du ménage. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Laure Nicole vend des beignets (faits à base de farine de blé et d'huile végétale) depuis près de cinq ans. Laure Nicole s’approvisionne dans une région du Bénin. Dans le souci de renforcer davantage son activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Laure Nicole désire augmenter le stock de ses produits. Pour ce faire, Laure Nicole sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MIANLEBENIN, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The MIANLEBENIN group consists of three members who live in the same area. The group's representative, named Laure Nicole, is the woman raising her hand in the photo. It is the first time that this group is requesting financial assistance from ALIDé, in order to increase the level of its activity.

Laure Nicole is 40 years old and did not attend school.  She is married to a man named Damien. They have three children, all in school and their financial dependents. Laure Nicole lives with her husband and her children and takes care of the various household needs with her husband. In order to meet her various expenses, Laure Nicole has been selling fritters (made with wheat flour and vegetable oil) for almost five years. She stocks up in Bénin. 

Eager to further strengthen her activity and to better meet the expectations of her customers, Laure Nicole would like to increase her stock of merchandise. In order to do so, she and the other members of the MIANLEBENIN group, are requesting their first loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour and vegetable oil.

loans.name: La Trinite Group

texts.fr: Le groupe LA TRINITE est formé de cinq personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Justine, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Justine est âgée de 45 ans et n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Justine est mariée à un mécanicien nommé Justin. Le couple a trois enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Justine vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la maison. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Justine vend des chaussures de façon ambulante, depuis près de huit ans. Justine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le souci de renforcer davantage son activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Justine désire augmenter le stock de ses produits. Pour ce faire, Justine sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe LA TRINITE, un deuxième crédit de ALIDé.
texts.en:
LA TRINITE is a group consisting of five members who live in the same neighborhood. Justine, the group's representative, is the woman raising her hand in the photo. 

Justine is 45 years old and did not attend school. She is married to a mechanic named Justin. Justine and Justin have three children, all in school and their dependents. Justine lives with her husband and her children and takes care of the various household expenses with her husband. In order to cover her various expenses, she has been selling shoes, door to door, for almost eight years. She stocks up at a market in Bénin.

Eager to further strengthen her activity and to better meet the demands of her customers, Justine would like to increase her stock of merchandise. In order to do so, she and the other members of LA TRINITE are requesting their second loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Lorena Brigett

texts.es:
La Señorea Lorena vive en Guayaquil, ella tiene 48 años de edad. El comercio para ella era muy atractivo y`fue cuando vio que esta actividad como su fuente de ingresos le era rentable y tambien una forma honrada de ganarse dinero. 

Ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, de ropa, y también renta cuartos en su casa.  Ella realiza esta labor sola y en diversos horarios. También que no a tenido ninguna dificultad o problema en su negocio.
Ella si está casada y su esposo es empleado privado, tiene 3 hijos menores de edad, estudian en escuela fiscales.

Ella utilizara el préstamo para invertir en cosméticos, ropa, para la venta y para mejorar su vivienda.  Quiere para el futuro poder hacer otra loza en su casa, para tener más cuartos de arriendos, quiere comprarse un auto, y poder viajar por todo el Ecuador.
texts.en:
Lorena lives in Guayaquil, and is 48 years old.  She was always attracted to business, and she saw that this particular business would be profitable and could be a source of income and an honorable way to make a living.

Lorena has a business selling cosmetics and clothing, and she also rents out rooms in her house.  She does this work on her own, and has a varied work schedule.  She has not had any particular difficulties or problems with the business.

Lorena is marred and her husband is an employee in the private sector.  They have 3 minor children who are in public schools.

Lorena will use this loan to invest in cosmetics and clothing to sell, and also to do some improvements on her house.  In the future, she wants to add a concrete slab to her house where she could build more rooms to rent.  She also wants to buy an automobile, and be able to travel throughout Ecuador.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, clothing and beauty products

loans.name: Celia

texts.es: Celia, de 49 años de edad , esta casada con Pedro y tiene 3 hijos a los que cuida en la casa que heredó de sus padres .Tiene una amplia experiencia de 23 años en las ventas, en la actualidad se ha convertido en su principal fuente de ingresos y ha implementado un  pequeño restaurante en el mismo local de sus ventas y recibe la ayuda de su esposo y 2 de sus hijos, en su tienda tiene todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad desde golosinas y abarrotes, en sus inicios  vendía en una caseta ahora   vende  en su hogar, su esposo y sus hijos  también  aportan significativamente en la atención de este negocio ya que es familiar y una gran oportunidad  en sus ventas es que, esta ubicada en el paradero  de una línea de transportes cuyos chóferes son sus potenciales clientes, también vende carne en su misma tienda .Celia, invertirá  en la compra de productos de primera necesidad como: arroz, azúcar y bebidas.
texts.en:
Celia, 49, is married to Pedro and has three children.  She takes care of them in the house she inherited from her parents.

She has a lot of experience in sales, 23 years.  Currently this has become her main source of income and she has set up a small restaurant in the same place where she sells.  She has the help of her husband and two of her children.

In her store she has all types of basic staples, from sweets to groceries.  In the beginning she used to sell in a stand; now she sells in her house.  Her husband and children also contribute significantly to the business because it's family-owned and a great opportunity.  It's located near the bus stop of a transportation company whose drivers are her potential customers.  She also sells meat in the same store.

Celia will invest the loan in buying staple products such as rice, sugar, and beverages.

loans.use: to buy food products such as rice, sugar, and beverages

loans.name: Otgonbaatar

texts.en:
Mr. Otgonbaatar, 34 years old, lives with his wife and three daughters in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land. His elder daughter studies at secondary school. His two younger daughters stay at home with their mother. His wife ran a clothes-manufacturing workshop between 2000 and 2011. When his wife got pregnant in 2011, she began making clothes ordered by clients, instead.

Otgonbaatar, himself, worked as a carpenter at a rental basement from 2000 to 2002. In 2002, he began working as an assistant at a construction site. In 2007, using his savings, he opened his own workshop where he makes various kinds of furniture. During the past six consecutive years, he has accumulated a vast amount of experience in furniture designing and manufacturing.

In order to increase work output as well as efficiency, he is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT, which he will use to purchase high-quality equipment and machines. For example, he plans to buy dust collecting equipment, joining machinery, and clamping machinery. As a result, he will be able to generate more income for his daughter's future education. The borrower is a very hardworking individual, who cares deeply for his family.

loans.use: to buy equipment he needs, including dust collecting equipment, joining machinery, and clamping machinery

loans.name: Rachidetou

texts.fr: Rachidetou est une femme de 30 ans, célibataire et mère d'un enfant. Elle possède et gère un comptoir dans un quartier de la ville où elle vend des chaussures depuis 4 ans. elle sollicite ce crédit pour lui permettre de renforcer son stock de marchandises en achetant de nouvelle babouches, chaussures etc. les bénéfices seront réinjecté dans son activité pour accroître son capital et subviendront aux besoin de sa famille.
texts.en:
Rachidetou is a 30-year-old woman.  She is single and the mother of one child.  She owns and runs a booth in one of the city's neighborhoods and she has been selling shoes for four years.

She is requesting this loan to boost her stock of merchandise through the purchase of slippers, shoes etc.  Her profits will be reinvested into her business in order to increase her capital, and will also be used to meet her family's needs

loans.use: to buy slippers and shoes.

loans.name: Juan Elber

texts.es:
Juan o Juancito como le dicen de cariño es un hombre de 60 años de edad, pero tiene la vitalidad y las ganas de luchar de un joven de 20 años, el vive en la calidad y acogedora ciudad de Ica, en la cual también se desarrolla la agricultura y posee muchos lugares turísticos para visitar. Juan  tiene mucho carismas y esa alegría la comparte con todos los que le rodean, a pesar de las adversidades, el siempre le pone muchas ganas.

Cada día Juan trabaja como albañil, el trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al día, en ocasiones puede tardar un poco mas debido a el tamaño de la construcción; Juan cree que está saliendo adelante porque es responsable y sobre todo porque quiere mejorar cada día.

Juan está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le están brindando el podrá comprar herramientas como brocas, martillos, cortadora de madera, entre otros, los cuales son necesarios para poder desempeñar su trabajo ya que actualmente tiene que alquilarlas, así el podrá mejorar sus ingresos y luchar por hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Ser un maestro de obra y poder mejorar su calidad de vida”.
texts.en:
Juan, or Juancito as he's known affectionately, is a 60-year-old man with the vitality and desire to strive of a 20-year-old young man.  He lives in the warm and welcoming city of Ica, where there's a lot of agriculture and many tourist attractions to visit.  Juan has a lot of charisma, and he shares that happiness with everyone around him.  He always does his best in spite of adversity.

Juan works around 10 hours every day as a bricklayer.  Sometimes he can work a bit more depending on the size of the structure.  Juan believes he's getting ahead because he's responsible and especially because he wants to improve every day.

Juan's very grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to their help he'll be able to buy tools such as bits, hammers, a saw, and others that are necessary to be able to do his job, because currently he has to rent them.

This way he'll be able to improve his income and strive to make his biggest dream a reality: "To be a master builder and be able to improve his quality of life."

loans.use: to buy hammers, bits, saws, and other materials

loans.name: Sarom's Group

texts.en:
Sarom, 53, is a mother with five children. She grows cassava on a one-hectare area of land located in Kampong Cham province, where she resides. From the current business, she is able to earn up to 23,600 KHR per day.

Sarom is not a new client for VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Her past loan empowered her to support her business timely, and she already managed to repay her past loan with success. She is now in a group of three female members. She is seeking to borrow 1,000,000 KHR, while her co-borrowers are seeking 1,400,000 KHR each. Sarom, the group leader, is going to spend her loan portion to pay the fee for plowing her one-hectare area, to buy a good cassava seedling, and to buy two sacks of potash (fertilizer). She hopes that she can earn a good profit and upgrade her living status.

loans.use: to pay the fee for plowing her one-hectare area, to buy a good cassava seedling, and to buy two sacks of potash (fertilizer)

loans.name: Véronique Jolie

texts.fr: Véronique est une femme de 35 ans, célibataire et mère de 2 enfants. elle possède et gère une boutique où elle vend des poisson fumé depuis 2 ans dans un quartier de la ville. ce crédit va lui permettre de renforcer son stock de matières premières en achetant les poisson frais. les bénéfices générés vont être réinvestis pour accroître ses revenus et son activité et subviendront aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Véronique is a 35-year-old woman who is single and the mother of two children.  She owns and runs a shop where she has been selling smoked fish for two years.  Her shop is located in one of the city's neighborhoods.

This loan will allow her to boost her stock of merchandise through the purchase of fresh fish.  Véronique will reinvest part of her profits to increase her income and business and use the rest of the money to meet her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria, de 29 años de edad , esta casada con Isaac, con quien tiene 4 hijos a los que cuida en la casa rústica que compró hace un año. En los terrenos que alquila desde hace 8 años, siembra alverja, espinaca y papa. Comenta que lo realiza con el apoyo de su esposo quien constantemente la apoya en los trabajos que requieren de mucho esfuerzo físico, “aunque yo trabajo de la misma manera”, afirma con una sonrisa. Ya que Gloria no se amilana si se trata de picar la tierra o cargar sacos de alimentos, siempre trabajó desde pequeña, es por esa razón que también es una buena comerciante y negocia a buenos precios sus cosechas en el mercado de la ciudad. Ahora desea mejorar sus producción para esta temporada de lluvias, pues quiere obtener buenas ganancias.Este es el primer crédito con KIVA y se compromete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.
Gloria, invertirá los S/.1000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Gloria, who is 29 years old, is married to Isaac. They have four children whom she cares for in the rustic house that she bought one year ago. In the fields that they have rented for eight years, she grows peas, spinach, and potatoes. She says that she farms with the support of her husband, who constantly helps her with the work that requires physical strength, "although I work the same way," she adds with a smile. 

Since Gloria is undaunted by turning the soil or hauling sacks of feed, she has always been working since she was little. That's why she is also a good businesswoman and negotiates good profits. 

This is Gloria's first loan with Kiva and she promises to be punctual with her payments. Gloria will invest the 1,000 soles (PEN) in the purchase of composted organic material to fertilize her crops.

loans.use: to buy composted organic material.

loans.name: Cheng's Group

texts.en:
Cheng is a farmer, residing in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She is married and has four children, two of whom still count on her because they are students in a local state school. Her main sources of income are one hectare of rice growing, and selling groceries. Besides helping on the farmland, her husband is a house builder. She has been with the current business for 10 years and is able to earn up to 33,300 KHR per day.

This is Cheng's fourth loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past loan, which she has repaid completely, supported her living steadily. Since she is now in need of working capital for her business, she leads a group of three female members to apply for a new loan. She and one of her co-borrowers are seeking to borrow 1,400,000 KHR each, while the remaining group member is applying for 1,000,000 KHR. Cheng, the group leader, will use her loan portion to buy potash and pesticide for her farmland. She hopes that she can gain a higher yield than before, so that she can maintain a good living standard for her family.

loans.use: To buy potash and pesticide for her farmland

loans.name: Mariatou

texts.fr: Mariatou est une femme de 44 ans, mariée et mère de 03 enfants dont le premier a 23 ans et le dernier 18 ans. Elle possède et gère un mini restaurant où elle vend des beignets, haricot et bouillie depuis 10 ans dans un quartier de la ville. Elle sollicite ce crédit pour renforcer son stock de matières premières en achetant sac de farine, bidon d'huile, sac de sucre afin d'augmenter ses ventes et ses profits. les bénéfices ainsi générés vont être réinvestis dans son activité pour accroître son capital d'une part, et subviendront aux besoins de sa famille d'autre part.
texts.en:
Mariatou is a 44-year-old woman.  She is married and the mother of three children between the ages of 23 and 18.  She owns and runs a mini-restaurant where she has been selling fritters, beans and paste for ten years, in one of the city's neighborhoods.

She is requesting this loan to boost her stock of supplies.  She will be buying some bags of flour and sugar as well as some cans of oil in order to increase her sales and profits.

Mariatou will reinvest part of her profits into her business in order to increase her capital and she will use the rest of the money to meet her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy food supplies (flour, sugar, oil).

loans.name: Voeurn's Group

texts.en:
Voeurn, a local villager from Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, is a farmer. She strives for a living by cultivating rice and working for others for a fee. She has five children, three of whom are still in school. The current business has returned a decent income, 34,800 KHR per day.

Voeurn, a fourth-time borrower, forms a group of three; the two other members are a sixth- and a first-time client with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Voeurn has upgraded her living standard gradually, owing to the positive impact of her past loan. She has already paid back her past loan. For her new loan, she requests the amount of 1,000,000 KHR. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer, potash, and to pay for farm labor. She hopes to grow her rice healthily and reap a better yield than before, so she can earn more income for her kids’ sake.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, potash, and to pay for farm labor

loans.name: Baltazar De Jesus

texts.es:
Baltazar, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo el cual le ayudara para invertir más en el negocio. Este préstamo le permitirá comprar una vaca y alimento para ganado.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a incrementar sus ingresos  y aumentar su inventario. Las condicione familiares han generado cambios, su esposa falleció hace un mes y sus condiciones económicas se vieron apretadas por los gastos que se ha llevado acabo.
texts.en:
Baltazar needs to take a new loan that will help him to further invest in his business. This loan will allow him to buy a cow and cattle feed. 

The previous loan helped him to increase his income and his stock. There have been changes in his family circumstances. His wife passed away a month ago and his financial situation has become difficult because of the spending he has carried out.

loans.use: To buy a cow and cattle feed.

loans.name: Fifatin Group

texts.fr: Le groupe FIFATIN est formé de trois personnes qui vivent dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Charlotte, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Charlotte est âgée de 37 ans et n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Charlotte est mariée à un certain Saliou. Le couple a un enfant, scolarisé et à leur charge. Charlotte vit ensemble avec son enfant et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Charlotte vend des amuse-gueule (fait à base de farine de blé) et des cartes de recharges téléphoniques depuis près de six ans. Charlotte s’approvisionne dans un marché et une région du Bénin. Dans le souci de renforcer davantage son activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Charlotte désire augmenter le stock de ses produits. Pour ce faire, Charlotte sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe FIFATIN, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux premiers crédits reçus ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
FIFATIN is a group consisting of three members who live in the same neighborhood. Charlotte, the group's representative, is the woman raising her hand in the photo.

Charlotte is 37 years old and did not attend school. She is married to a man named Saliou. Charlotte and Saliou have one child, who goes to school and is their dependent.  Charlotte lives with her husband and her child and takes care of the various household expenses with her husband. 

In order to cover her various expenses, Charlotte has been selling snacks (prepared with wheat flour) as well as rechargeable phone cards, for almost six years. She stocks up at a market and in one of the regions of Bénin.

Eager to further strengthen her activity and to better meet the demands of her customers, Charlotte would like to increase her stock of goods. In order to do so, she and the other members of FIFATIN are requesting their third loan from ALIDé.  Their two previous loans have been duly repaid.

loans.use: to buy rechargeable phone cards and wheat flour.

loans.name: Tuti

texts.ru:
Тути женщина в возрасте 47 лет, проживает в сельской местности . Замужем и имеет одного ребенка.  Тути имеет большой опыт в сфере выращивания и переработки риса. Готовую продукцию она сдает на местный рынок. Свою деятельность она начала с 27 лет. По началу помогала своим наставникам, затем начала самостоятельно выращивать рис. По выращиванию и обработки риса ей помогает ее ребенок. Ей очень тяжело так как она единственная кормилица в семье. Супруг ее является инвалидом, он нигде не работает.   По мере возможности ей помогают родственники. Благодаря своему трудолюбию и оптимистичности Тути смогла  осилить все трудности, которые были на ее не легком  пути. 
От своих знакомых  она услышала что есть такая организация как «Арванд». Тути решила подать заявку на кредит.  На полученный кредит она  хочет купить  оборудование для обработки риса. Она выражает благодарность Арванд за содействие и огромную роль в ее жизни.
texts.en:
Tuti is a 47-year-old woman who lives in the countryside.  She is married and has one child.  She is very experienced in the field of rice-farming and rice-processing and she sells her production at a local market.  

Tuti started in this business 27 years ago.  In the beginning she was mentored, but then she started to grow rice on her own.  Her son currently helps her manage the business.  Her life is very difficult because she is the only breadwinner in the family.  Her husband is disabled and does not work.  Her relatives help whenever they can.  Thanks to her hardwork and optimism, Tuti has however managed to conquer all the challenges along her difficult path.

After learning from some friends about the existence of MDO Arvand, Tuti decided to apply for a loan.  She wants to use her loan to buy some rice-processing equipment.  She expresses her gratitude to MDO Arvand for their assistance and for the huge impact they are having on her life.

loans.use: to purchase some rice-processing equipment.

loans.name: Astrid Amalia

texts.es:
Astrid a sus 46 años de edad es madre de dos hijos. Desde hace 15 años se dedica al oficio de la confección directa en su pequeño taller ubicado en su vivienda. Aprendió esta actividad gracias a su madre quien era costurera. 
Con grandes sueños por delante esta mujer construye un mejor presente para su familia debido a que gracias a su trabajo en su casa hay pan para comer y sus hijos gozan del privilegio de poder estudiar. Su más grande deseo es poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y para ello se encuentra solicitando un crédito para la compra de una máquina fileteadora y telas  con el propósito de aumentar sus ingresos y acceder a una vivienda digna.
texts.en:
Astrid is 46 years old and has two children. She has been working in the dressmaking industry for 15 years and uses the small studio in her house. She learned this profession from her mother, who was a dressmaker. 

She has big dreams for the future and works to provide a better present for her family. Thanks to her job, there is bread in her house and her children have the privilege to study. Her wish is to improve the quality of life of her family, which is why she's requesting a loan to buy a sewing machine and fabric. This will allow her to increase her income and to have access to a decent home.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and fabric.

loans.name: Krisanto

texts.en: Krisanto is 33 years old and dreams of becoming successful someday. He is happily married to Lyra and the couple have been blessed with one child. Krisanto is a responsible father. To support his family, Krisanto engaged in an Internet business. He has been in this business for three years and usually earns a minimum of PHP 300 a day. At this time, he asking a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy ink, bond paper and a printer. He hopes to grow and expand his business.

loans.use: to buy ink, bond paper and a printer

loans.name: Seak's Group

texts.en: Seak is a 35-year-old father of two school children. He is a cassava grower on one hectare area in Kampong Cham province’s Dambae district where he also resides. To earn more income, he also plants rubber trees. He has been in business for 10 years and is able to earn up to 27,700 KHR per day. Including this loan, he is a third-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). He has repaid his past loan and has utilized it wisely to support his business. Now, he is in a group of two applying for a new loan. As the group leader, he will use his loan portion to pay for labor and weeding clearance, and to buy bowls for collecting latex from his rubber tree. He hopes to make more income from his business so that he can keep his children in school until the tertiary level.

loans.use: To pay for labor and weeding clearance, and to buy bowls for collecting latex

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en: Ailyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a pig fattening business in the Philippines, which she has had for 15 years. Ailyn requested a 5,000 PHP loan through ASKI to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs. Ailyn would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose has been running his livestock business for almost 15 years. Aside from raising hogs seven hogs, he also owns 1.5 hectares planted in rice and corn. 

Jose aspires to become a successful entrepreneur someday. With this goal in life, he is asking for a loan of PHP 25,000 that would allow him to buy feed and vitamins to ensure his hogs have proper nutrition so he could get the best price for his hogs. Jose believes that the loan amount he requested will enable to him to obtain his goal in life.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for his hogs

loans.name: Chroeb's Group

texts.en: Chroeb, 38, is a married mother of three children, two in school. She is a local farmer from Kampong Cham province. She raises rice on half a hectare as the primary source of her family's income. She has been farming for 18 years and she is able to earn up to 40,700 KHR per day. This is the first loan for Chroep with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She formed a group of three to apply for a new loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy good rice seed for growing and to pay the plowing fee. She hopes to double her income and expand her business to a larger scale.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and duck feed

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es:
Rafael, de 47 años de edad, esta casado con Graciela quien es comerciante y madre de sus 02 hijos. Vive en compañía de su esposo y una de sus hijas,en su casa propia.La actividad que realiza Rafael es la crianza de peces de la región y siembra de palma aceitera, por esta razón tiene un terreno propio de 20 hectáreas de extensión, contando con 07 hectáreas de cultivo de palma aceitera que  están en producción, siendo un cultivo alternativo a la hoja de coca.Iniciándose hace más 04 años en ésta actividad,logró posesionarse en esa zona contando con el apoyo  técnico de la empresa privada, a la que vende toda su producción, llegando a contratar hasta 02 trabajadores para la actividad de cosecha con un pago diario a cada uno, además de contar con el apoyo de su pareja.
Le gusta su actividad pues cuenta con un oficio al cual dedicarse, así como también le gusta el trabajo de campo y los ingresos económicos que le genera con la venta de su producción ya que le sirve para solventar sus gastos en su hogar. Al contrario, no le gusta  las plagas de afectan las plantaciones, por eso tiene que estar pendiente y alerta de cualquier brote. Además tiene planes de seguir creciendo para comprarse un vehiculo de carga pesada para el transporte de su producto.Este es el préstamo número 06 con Kiva, Por ello cuenta con su colaboración para que asi pueda concretar sus planes.Con el monto solicitado de S/.3500 nuevos soles, comprará comida balanceada para sus peces y abono orgánica para los cultivos de palma aceitera.
texts.en:
Rafael, 47 years old, is married to Graciela, who has a business and is mother to Rafael's two children. Rafael, Graciela and one of their daughters live together in their own house.  Rafael makes a living raising fish in the region and sowing oil palm.  For this, Rafael has his own land, measuring 20 hectares.  Seven hectares are used for growing the oil palm, an alternative to growing coca leaves.  Rafael started this work over four years ago, after he took over the land with the support of a private enterprise to whom he sells what he produces.  Rafael manages to employ two workers for harvesting, paying each of them on a daily basis.  His wife also supports him in his work.

Rafael likes the work because it gives him a trade to make a living.  He also likes working in the field and he uses the income from selling his products to cover household costs.  However, he does not like the plagues that affect the crops and he has to be vigilant and alert in case of any outbreaks.  Rafael has plans to continue expanding the business, by buying a vehicle to transport his product.  This is Rafael's sixth loan with Kiva.  He is counting on Kiva so that he can make his plans a reality.  With the loan of 3500 Nuevo Soles, Rafael will buy feed for the fish and organic fertiliser for the oil palm plantation.

loans.use: to buy feed and organic fertiliser.

loans.name: La Gran Esperanza Group

texts.es: El banco de emprendimiento LA GRAN ESPERANZA está compuesto por ocho integrantes, seis mujeres y dos varones ,  la presidenta del banco es la Sra. Elena en la foto  segunda desde la izquierda parada con blusa blanca, tiene 56 años,  hijos ya independientes, ella se dedica al servicio de puntos de  llamadas que se encuentran en una  Avenida céntrica de la ciudad de Santa Cruz, este préstamo es el su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Elena va a usar este préstamo para la compra de tarjetas telefónicas por mayor su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de capital razón por la cual la cliente se vio interesada y acudió a nuestra institución, la Sra. Elena enfrenta retos en su negocio que son La competencia que tiene por la zona es demasiada, recién está empezando con este negocio ya que ella vendió cosméticos  pero lastimosamente el negocio no le surgió ganancias por lo que tuvo que buscar otra alternativa y va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir comprando mercadería, como tarjetas de recarga para poder ofrecer a los clientes, se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado a ella y a sus compañeras de grupo ya que son personas que trabajan mucho para salir adelante.
texts.en: The "La Gran Esperanza" communal bank is made up of eight members - six women and two men.  The bank's president is Elena.  In the photo Elena is the second from the left, standing, and wearing a white blouse.  She is 56 years old and has children who are now independent adults.  Elena makes a living with a business offering telephone services on a central avenue in the city of Santa Cruz.  This is her first cycle with the communal bank and Elena will use the loan to buy phonecards in bulk.  She is applying for a loan due to a lack of capital. When Elena about the communal bank, she came to visit it.  Elena faces challenges in her business, such as too much competition in the area.  She has only recently started this business.  Before she sold cosmetics but this unfortunately did not provide her with an income, so she had to look for something else.  Elena will use her profits to buy merchandise such as top-up cards to sell to her customers  Elena is happy and grateful to the communal bank for the support provided to her and her colleagues.  All these people work hard so they can move forward in life.

loans.use: to buy phonecards in bulk.

loans.name: Denis

texts.es: Denis, de 30 años de edad, esta casada con Juan y tiene una hija pequeña a la que cuida en la casa que alquiló hace 5 años.Desde muy pequeña se dedicó a la agricultura, tuvo que trasladarse de un lugar a otro, pues su esposo comenzó a trabajar en una reconocida fábrica de cementos por la zona. Ya lleva 5 años sembrando habas y alverja en terrenos alquilados, pues no posee todavía uno propio. Espera dentro de un par de años comprarse uno propio de extensas áreas de terreno. Comenta que sus cultivos los comercializan a la ciudad, pero si el precio de compra es inferior prefiere venderlos en la capital del país, donde siempre obtiene buenas ganancias ya que es costa y ese tipo de alimentos tiene mayor precio.Este es el primer crédito con KIVA, está muy contenta con el  apoyo financiero que recibira para continuar con sus planes y se compromete a ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.Denis, invertirá los S/.1000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en: Denis is 30 years old, is married to Juan and has a young daughter, whom she looks after in the house she has rented for five years.  Since she was a young girl, Denis has been working in agriculture.  She had to move from one place to another as her husband found work in a well-known cement factory in the area.  Denis has now been growing broad beans and peas on rented land for five years.  She still does not have her own land but in a couple of years she hopes to buy her own land.  Denis says that she sells her crops in the city but the price is lower so she prefers to sell them Lima. She always makes a higher profit there as it is on the coast and these types of foods sell for a better price in the coastal region.  This is Denis' first Kiva loan.  She is very happy with this financial support that she will receive to continue with her plans and she promises to make her repayments on time.  Denis will invest the 1000 Nuevo Soles in buying organic fertiliser to strengthen her crops.

loans.use: to buy organic fertiliser.

loans.name: Jose Alexander

texts.es:
José, solicita un nuevo crédito porque necesita más capital de trabajo para cultivar. Este le permitirá comprar abono, herbicidas, insecticidas, plaguicidas para el cultivo de maíz y frijol.
El préstamo anterior le ayudo a comprar insumos agrícolas y con las ganancias ha logrado aportar para la familia. Las condiciones económicas han mejorado ya que le ha permitido brindar ayuda al hogar.
texts.en:
José is requesting a new loan because he needs more work capital for his crop activity.  This will allow him to buy fertilizer, herbicides and insecticides for his corn and bean crops.

The previous loan helped him buy farm supplies; and the profits helped support the family.  His economic situation has improved, enabling him to provide for his household.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, herbicides and insecticides for his corn and bean crops.

loans.name: Beatriz Elena

texts.es:
Beatriz, es un ilustre ejemplo de lo que es la valentía. Una mujer a la que la vida la ha golpeado en varias ocasiones, dejándole grandes secuelas que solo el tiempo se encargará de borrarlas. A pesar de las situaciones adversas, sus sueños nunca desvanecieron y la ilusión de ver crecer a sus tres hijos se convirtió en su más grande reto. Después del fallecimiento de su cónyuge, Beatriz asumió las responsabilidades del hogar, por lo cual comenzó a trabajar como empleada doméstica en una residencia, al ver que sus ingresos no eran suficientes para cubrir con los gastos de su familia, optó por realizar labores alternas como comercializar ropa en su tiempo libre. De esta manera inició como microempresaria. 
Hoy lleva más de cinco años realizando la actividad y sueña con montar su propia tienda de ropa. En la actualidad se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la comprad de mercancía con el fin de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Beatriz is an illustrious example of courage.  She is a woman who has been struck hard by life experiences that have left her many scars that only time will heal.  Despite her adverse situations, her dreams have never faltered and the desire to see her three children grow up has turned into her biggest challenge.  After her husband died, Beatriz became the head of household and began working as a domestic employee in a residence.  When she realized her income was not enough to cover family expenses she began working in other areas such as selling clothing in her free time.  This is how she became an entrepreneur.

Now, she has been in business for five years and dreams of setting up her own clothing shop.  She is currently requesting a loan to buy merchandise in an effort to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Theourn's Group

texts.en:
Theourn is 57 years old and blessed with two children. The rest of her family is residing in Kampong Cham province and mainly depends on growing rice on one hectare as the main source of income. She has been engaged in this business for 33 years, and it has given her returns of about 37,000 KHR per day. This is the first loan for Theourn with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. 

She is the leader of a group of four female members. The total amount of their group loan is 2,300,000 KHR, out of which 200,000 KHR is the loan portion she has requested. Theourn will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to make more income so she can maintain a good standard living for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Miriama

texts.en: Miriama is 32 years old and married with 2 children. She has a small garden where she grows bananas, taro, yams and taamu which she sells in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 5 years. Miriama needs a loan to buy bush knives, chemicals, fertilizer, weed sprayer and a wheelbarrow. She has been a member of South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) since 2010. Mirirama will use the profits from her sales to support her family and pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy bush knives, chemicals, fertilizer, weed sprayer and a wheelbarrow.

loans.name: Carlosalberto

texts.es:
Carlos es casado y tiene dos hijos menores de edad, los cuales son su principal motivo para ir en búsqueda de un mejor futuro. Su gran pasión es la gastronomía, por lo cual desde su juventud aprendió la actividad de forma empírica, ya que por su condición económica no pudo acceder a la educación superior. 
Desde hace dos años abrió un restaurante gracias al apoyo de su familia. Labora diariamente de seis de la mañana a nueve de la noche con su esposa y un familiar. Hoy se encuentra solicitando un crédito que destinará en la adecuación de la red de gas y compra de insumos (productos de la canasta familiar) y publicidad, con el fin de aumentar las ventas y generar mayores ingresos que le permitirán tener mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Carlos is married and has two minor children, who are his main motivation for seeking a better future.  His great passion is cooking which he started learning about empirically in his youth since he was unable to receive a higher education.

Two years ago he opened a restaurant with the support of his family.  He works every day from 6:00 a.m. until 9:00 p.m. with his wife and another relative.  Today he is requesting a loan to install a gas line and to buy supplies (household goods) and publicity.  He aims to increase sales to generate more income to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: To install gas and buy supplies (household goods) and publicity.

loans.name: Cilia Durley

texts.es:
Cilia se dedica a la comercialización de ropa como actividad económica, desde hace más de dos años, labor que alterna con las actividades de su hogar. Agradece a Dios la oportunidad que la ha dado para generar su propio sustento y tener un trabajo digno que realizar. 
Su mayor sueño es mejorar su condición económica y tener la oportunidad de brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. 
En la actualidad se encuentra solicitando un crédito para la compra de mercancía con el objeto de cumplirles a sus clientes con los encargos solicitados.
texts.en:
Cilia sells clothing for a living.  She started her business over two years ago and alternates this work with her household activities.  She is thankful for the opportunity the Lord has given her to generate her own income and have a dignified job.

Her greatest goal is to improve her economic situation and be able to give her family a better quality of life. 

She is currently requesting a loan to buy merchandise to fill orders she has already received from her customers.

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Yen's Group

texts.en: Yen is a rice grower residing in Kampong Cham province. She is a 29-year-old mother of three children, two of whom are in school. She has been involved in her current business for 10 years and is able to earn up to 35,000 KHR per day. In a group of four female members, she is the group leader and it is her first time to request a loan from Kiva’s partner VisionFund. Yen will use her portion of the loan to buy rice seeds and fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to grow her rice fruitfully and gain back a high yield in order to sustain her living standards.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and fertilizer for farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Sikajje

texts.en: Sikajje was able to meet her customers demands recently by sewing many school sweaters and uniforms on time because she had the raw materials she had bought using the loan money she had received. She is so thankful to the Kiva lenders who are making her dream come true. With the newly acquired loan she will buy more material to sew uniforms for a neighbouring kindergarten and primary school. The income gained will help her restock her business as well as meet her family's basic needs. She is a hard working and resilient woman.

loans.use: to buy materials for making school uniforms.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
