loans.use: to buy beads and other materials for her embroidery business.

loans.name: Débora Ester

texts.es:
Débora a sus 61 años,  labora desde hace más de nueve años en su tienda, la cual ha construido con años de sacrificio y esfuerzo.
Cuenta que comenzó vendiendo dulces desde su hogar y con el paso de los años ha logrado construir su negocio. Hoy se siente satisfecha por los logros que ha alcanzado y espera seguir sembrando para cosechar en el futuro. Hoy se encuentra solicitando un crédito para la de compra de productos de la canasta familiar, con el propósito de mejorar sus ventas y garantizar una mejor calidad en el servicio.
Espera poder mejorar su condición económica y la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Débora is 61 and for over nine years she has been running a grocery store she established after years of sacrifice and hard work.  She says she started selling sweets at home and, with time, turned the activity into a business.  Today, she is satisfied with the achievements she has made and hopes to continue being able to reap the rewards of her work.

She is requesting a loan to buy household products in an effort to increase her sales and guarantee better customer service.  She aims to improve her economic situation and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: To buy household products.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for her sewing business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicides, insecticides and pesticides for his corn and bean crops

loans.name: Domingo

texts.es:
Domingo de 33 años de edad, padre de tres hijos menores de edad y ha residido la mayor parte de su vida en el campo. Su gran sueño fue ser un microempresario de éxito por lo cual comenzó a luchar a fin de convertirlo en realidad. Gracias a un golpe de suerte como lo llama él, cerca de su vivienda desocuparon un local, el cual tomó y comenzó a comercializar legumbre y productos de la canasta familiar a los campesinos de la vereda.
Hoy siente que su actividad es su mayor bendición porque gracias a ésta, la calidad de vida de su familia ha mejorado considerablemente y a logrado garantizarle educación a sus hijos. En la actualidad se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de surtido, con el fin de contar con los productos que más solicitan y mejorar sus ingresos para garantizarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Domingo is 33 years old. He is the father of three minor children and he has lived most of his life in the countryside. His big dream is to be a successful micr-businessman and so he started to fight to make that a reality. Thanks some good luck, as he calls it, close to where he lives a locale became vacant. He took it and began to sell vegetables and basic staples to the farmers who would pass by. 

Today he feels that his activity is his biggest blessing, because thanks to it his family's quality of life has improved considerably and he has been able to guarantee an education for his children. Right now he is asking for a loan that he will invest in buying stock so he can have the products that are most in demand and improve his income to guarantee his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy staple products

loans.name: Doris Del Socorro

texts.es:
Doña Doris de 60 años de edad. Se dedicado a la fabricación y comercialización de arepas, actividad que le ha permitido generar el sustento para ella y sus seis hijos, después de sufrir el abandono de su esposo.
Diariamente se levanta muy temprano e inicia su faena en la fabricación de arepas, las cuales distribuye en su localidad, de esta manera esta mujer genera ingresos para solventar los gastos en su casa. 
Hoy se encuentra solicitando un crédito para adecuaciones locativas y la compra de mesa inoxidable y un escabiladero; con el fin de aumentar su capacidad de producción y mejorar sus ingresos. Espera que su negocio le permita ahorrar para la compra de su vivienda y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Doris is 60 years old.  Her business is making and selling arepas and it has enabled her to support both herself and her six children since her husband left her.

Doris gets up very early every morning and starts her work making arepas which she sells in her area. In this way, she makes the income she needs to cover her household expenses.

Doris is requesting this loan to make some changes to her work space.  She will also buy a stainless steel table and a sheet pan rack so that she can increase her production capacity and improve her income.  She hopes that her business will allow her to save up enough money to buy her home and to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to make some changes to her work space and to buy a stainless steel table and a sheet pan rack

loans.name: Flor Ángela

texts.es:
Flor Ángela de 43 años de edad, es una mujer que le ha tocado vivir la dureza y el desamor de muchos, pero con fuerza y ganas de sacar a sus hijos adelante ha logrado brindarle mejores oportunidades de vida a su familia. Hace 2 años se separó de su esposo, por lo cual asumió todas las responsabilidades de su hogar debido la a que su ex-cónyuge no siguió aportando para las necesidades de sus hijos.
Laboró por varios años en un centro de estética en donde aprendió del oficio y posteriormente lo perfeccionó en una academia. Actualmente montó su propio salón de belleza gracias a los ahorros de años de trabajo. Gracias a la actividad ha mejorado sus ingresos y ha garantizado la educación de sus hijos. Con el fin de seguir creciendo en el mercado local, se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de artículos de belleza (secador, máquina patillera, esterilizador y tinturas)
texts.en:
Flor Ángela is 43 years old. She is a woman who has had to go through hard times and heartbreaks, but with strength and an eagerness to get her children ahead she has been able to offer better opportunities in life to her family. Two years ago she separated from her husband and so she assumed all of the household responsibilities because her ex-husband didn't continue contributing to his children's needs. 

She worked for several years at a beauty salon where she learned the trade and later she perfected it at an academy. Now she has opened her own beauty salon thanks to her savings from years of work. In able to keep growing in the local market, she is asking for a loan that she will invest in buying beauty products (a dryer, an electric trimmer, a sterilizer and dyes).

loans.use: to buy beauty products (a dryer, an electric trimmer, a sterilizer and dyes).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make some changes to his work space and to buy raw materials wholesale

loans.name: Delia

texts.en: Delia is 41 years old, married and has three children, one of whom is in school. She is in the business of pig fattening in the Philippines. She has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional feed to sell. Delia has been in the business of pig fattening for 7 years now, and has borrowed 18 times in the past from NWTF to sustain this business. In the future, Delia would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional feed to sell.

loans.name: Rubby Cecilia

texts.es:
Rubby es una joven e 19 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Imperial, ciudad con una agricultura variada, y lugares turísticos hermosos los cuales son muy visitados por turistas en todo el año. Es una joven con un carisma contagiante y sobre todo una hija amorosa.  Rubby ha pasado por varias situaciones adversas, pero a pesar de ello sigue adelante porque tiene muchas ganas de poder surgir y ser un orgullo para su familia.

Día a día Rubby trabaja como empleada domestica, ella labora alrededor de 9 horas al día y con el fruto de su trabajo solventa sus estudios de costura y confección de prendas, ya que a ella le gusta mucho lo que respecta la moda y con ello espera tener un negocio propio; ella cree que esta saliendo adelante porque es responsable y sobre todo por sus ganas de progresar.

Rubby está muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva ya que gracias al apoyo que le han brindado podrá comprar una máquina de coser, con lo cual le ayudara mucho en sus clases ya que le permitirá tener las herramientas necesarias y podrá ir iniciando su negocio de confección de prendas, asi ella seguirá luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su negocio de Textiles y ser una diseñadora de modas”.
texts.en:
Rubby is a 19 year old young woman who lives in the city of  Imperial, a city with varied agriculture and beautiful tourist attractions that are much visited by tourists all year long. She is a young woman with contagious charisma and above all a loving daughter. Rubby has gone through several adverse situations, but despite that she keeps going ahead because she really wants to be able to prevail and make her family proud.  

Day to day Rubby works as a domestic employee. She works around 9 hours a day and with the fruits of her labors she pays for her studies in sewing and making clothing. She really likes everything about fashion and with it she hopes to have her own business. She believes that she is getting ahead because she is responsible and above all because of her eagerness to get ahead.

Rubby is very grateful to the Kiva lenders and thanks to the support they have offered, she will be able to buy a sewing machine, which will help her a lot in her classes as it will allow her to have the tools she needs. She will be able to start her business making clothes and she will keep fighting to be able to make her biggest dream come true: to have a textile business and be a fashion designer.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Nery

texts.es:
Nery, de 44 años de edad, esta casada con Eleazar, su esposo, ambos tienen 7 hijos, con quienes vive en una casa alquilada desde hace 6 años.Todas las mañanas desde muy temprano se dedica a la venta de comida en un pequeño cuarto que acondiciono en su hogar, ya por las noches vende hamburguesas; este oficio le resulta muy rentable y puede apoyar en los gastos del hogar. Pero no solo a esa actividad se dedica Nery, desde muy pequeña aprendió a trabajar la tierra, ya cuando creció y consolido su familia, comenzó a adquirir terrenos de cultivo en los que siembra habas, arveja y espinaca; con el tiempo y la experiencia que tiene, logró adecuarse bien al mercado y alquiló más terrenos de cultivo, con ello puede sembrar en grandes cantidades, por ende obtiene mejores ganancias , tambien se dedica a la crianza de ovejas. Este es el octavo crédito con KIVA, está muy contenta deL apoyo financiero que recibe para continuar con sus planes razón por la cual promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. 
Nery, invertirá los S/.2000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Nery is 44 years old. She is married to Eleazar, her husband, and they have 7 children. She has lived with them in a rented house for six years. Early every morning she sells food from a small room that she outfitted in her house, since nights she sells hamburgers. This work is very profitable and she can help with the household expenses. But this isn't the only activity that Nery does. Since she was very young she has worked the soil. When she grew up and started a family she began to rent cropland where she grows beans, peas, and spinach. Over time and with the experience she has, she was able to position herself in the market and she rented more cropland and was able to plant in big quantities. Because of this she was able to earn more. She also raises sheep. This is her eighth Kiva loan and she is very happy with the financial support that she is receiving to continue with her plans. She promises to make her payments on time.  
 
Nery will invest the S/.2000 soles in buying organic fertilizer to feed her crops.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
This is Editha. Her previous loan helped her in many ways - especially in her business. She was able to buy all the products and materials needed. She has been in this business for ten years now and it keeps on growing. She and her husband who is a farmer are working hard to provide an income for their everyday needs. She also has jeepney for additional income.

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy gardening materials like wire and baskets and supplies such as seeds and fertilizer needed in her business. Her profit will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Editha dreams for a continuous success of her business. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative (CCT) community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, seeds and tools for her plant growing business.

loans.name: Filipina

texts.en: Filipina is 60 years old and married with seven children. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 25,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy stocks of snack foods, eggs, noodles and canned goods to sell. Filipina has been in this business for 8 years and in the future Filipina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of snack foods, eggs, noodles and canned goods to sell.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María , tiene 36 años de edad, ella vive con su esposo Crisanto, juntos tienen 3 pequeños hijos,ellos viven en la casa que alquilaron desde hace 10 años. 
Desde muy pequeña María aprendió que solo se puede salir  adelante a base  de mucho esfuerzo y dedicación, ya que nada es imposible en la vida; es así que al formar su familia no quiso dejar de laborar ,iba y venia de viaje porque era comerciante; pero al darse cuenta sus niños la necesitaban decidio abrir un negocio en su propia casa , y no tuvo mejor idea que empezar el negocio de venta de comida ya que su sala era amplia, casi perfecta para el  proyecto; ahí también vende actualmente ciertos productos comestibles como una pequeña tienda,lleva en este negocio mas de 3 años casi sin descanso, para esto su esposo la ayuda bastante sobretodo cuando ella debe hacer algo importante y debe dejar el negocio .Este es el octavo crédito con KIVA, está muy contenta por el apoyo financiero que recibe para continuar con sus planes y se compromete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.
María, invertirá los S/.1000 soles en la compra de productos de primera necesidad para la elaboración de sus alimentos como: arroz, azúcar, aceite, fideos, leche y demás.
texts.en:
María is 36 years old.  She lives with her husband Crisanto.  Together they have three small children who live in the house they have rented for ten years.  

Since she was young, María learned that she could only succeed with a lot of effort and dedication since nothing is impossible in life.  When she started her family, she did not want to stop working, but she came and went on trips since she was a merchant.  When her children arrived, she decided to open a business in her home.  She decided to start a business selling food since her living room was large and perfect for the project.  She also sells certain food products, like a small store.  She has had this business for more than three years and works almost without resting.  Her husband helps her a lot, especially when she has to do something important and has to leave the store.  

This is her eighth loan with Kiva.  She is very happy with the financial support she has received to continue with her plans.  She promises to be punctual with her repayments.

María will invest the 1000 soles she has requested in the purchase of staple products needed to make her dishes such as rice, sugar, oil, noodles, milk, and other items.

loans.use: to purchase food products such as rice, sugar, oil, and other items.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.es:
Carolina, de 30 años de edad ,esta casada con Vidal, con quien tiene 2 hijos, a los que cuida en la casa que alquiló hace 10 años.Carolina comercializa productos comestibles en su casa propia desde hace 8 años. Ya es conocida entre sus vecinos, quienes todos los días desde muy temprano compran los comestibles para la elaboración de alimentos diarios. Su principal ventaja es que ofrece productos a precios bajaos, pues compra al por mayor de esa manera le permite reducir lo precios por unidad.Este es el primer crédito con KIVA, está muy contenta del apoyo financiero que recibe para continuar con sus planes y se compromete a ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.
Carolina, invertirá los S/.1000 soles en la compra de productos de primera necesidad para su tienda de comestibles como: sacos de arroz, azúcar, cajas de aceite y demás.
texts.en:
Carolina is 30 years old.  She is married to Vidal and they have two children who they care for in the house they have rented for ten years.  Carolina has sold food products in her house for eight years.  She is known among her neighbors who purchase her food products every day to make their daily meals.  Her primary advantage is offering products at low prices since she purchases at wholesale, which allows her to reduce her price per unit.  

This is her first loan with Kiva.  She is very happy with the financial support she will receive to continue with her plans.  She promises to make her repayments on time.

Carolina will invest this 1000 soles in the purchase of staple products for her grocery store such as sacks of rice and sugar, boxes of oil, and other items.

loans.use: to purchase food products such as rice, sugar, oil, and other items.

loans.name: Verónica Lizzette

texts.es:
Verónica tiene 39 años de edad, esta casada y tiene un hijo de 20 años de edad. Vive en una casa alquilada junto a su esposo, ella vende de forma ambulante antojitos, almuerzos y prepara la comida a los alumnos de la escuela en su comunidad; los días domingos se dedica a la venta de ropa usada. Tiene alrededor de seis años de dedicarse a ser cocinera, a ella le confían la salud de los alumnos de la escuela, ya que la conocen como una mujer correcta.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar un coche para instalar un puesto de venta fijo en la acera, para vender yuca frita, tostadas de plátano, tacos, entre otros antojitos más. Así, ella aprovechara la oferta de comprar el coche y venderá mucho más por la ubicación que tendrá. Su sueño siempre ha sido contra con un puesto formal de comida.
texts.en:
Verónica is thirty-nine years old, is married, and has one 20-year-old son.  She lives in a house that she rents together with her husband.  She sells snacks and lunches door-to-door, and also prepares food for the students of the primary school in her community.  On Sundays, she dedicates herself to selling used clothing.  She has about six years of experience being a cook; the students trust her with their health, since they known her to be a good woman.

The loan that she is requesting from Fundación Campo is to buy a food cart so that she can set up a fixed selling stall on the sidewalk where she will sell fried yucca, toasted plantains, tacos, and other snacks.  She will take advantage of this offer in buying her food cart, and she will sell a lot more because of the good location that she will have.

Her dream has always been related to having a formal food stall.

loans.use: to buy a food cart so that she can set up a fixed selling stall on the sidewalk where she will sell fried yucca, toasted plantains, tacos, and other snacks.

loans.name: Edith

texts.es:
Edith de 44 años de edad,esta casada con Wilfredo con quien tiene 5 hijos, pero solo vive con 3 de ellos en la casa que heredó de sus padres y donde vive desde su nacimiento.Edith se dedica a la siembra de arveja, papa y maíz, los que después de cada cosecha, lleva a la capital del país para comercializar a los compradores del mercado central, donde le pagan más por los alimentos que produce. Edith viaja por lo menos 3 veces por semana por eso espera comprarse un camión para reducir los gastos de envío. Le gusta mucho la agricultura y sobre todo sembrar arveja, porqué invierte poco y obtiene mayores utilidades en corto tiempo, menciona con mucha serenidad.Este es el quinto crédito con KIVA y esta muy contenta por el apoyo financiero que recibe para continuar con sus planes razón por la cual se  compromete a ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.
Edith, invertirá los S/.1000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Forty-four year old Edith is married to Wilfred.  Together, they have five children, though only three still at home, in the house that Edith inherited from her parents, and where she has lived since she was born.  Edith makes a living sowing peas, potatoes and corn.  After harvesting them she takes them to the country's capital city, to sell her products to sellers at the central market.  There in Lima, people pay a higher price for Edith's vegetables.  Edith travels to the city at least three times a week and so she hopes to buy a truck in order to reduce her travelling costs.  Edith very much likes agriculture and particularly enjoys sowing the peas because, with just a little investment, she calmly tells us that she makes a good profit in very little time.  This is Edith's fifth loan from Kiva and she is very happy with the financial support that she is receiving to continue with her business.  She promises to make her repayments on time.

Edith will invest the 1000 Nuevo Soles in buying organic fertliser to strengthen her crops.

loans.use: to buy organic fertiliser.

loans.name: Israel

texts.es:
Israel es oriundo de la Ciudad de Monterrey, México. Nació el dia 20 de Septiembre de 1976, cuenta con 36 años de edad. Tiene su domicilio en la Col. Mitras Poniente al oeste de esta ciudad y que desde Agosto del 2010 comparte con la Sra. Maria del Rosario, con quien contrajo matrimonio y aún no tienen hijos. 
Dejó de estudiar la secundaria técnica  para ponerse a  trabajar para ayudar a su mamá,  y sacar adelante a sus 3 hermanos menores. Su primer trabajo fue en una tienda comercial atendiendo los pedidos de los clientes.  Después se cambio por mayores ingresos al empleo donde actualmente trabaja, en una tienda de frutas, es el encargado de la venta y la distribución.

Israel ha solicitado un crédito KIVA porque quiere realizar las reparaciones necesarias al plafón y al techo de su casa, ya que se encuentra muy deteriorado y cuando llueve se moja toda la casa. El tiene la esperanza de recibir dicho crédito antes de que llegue la epoca de lluvia.

En este momento, su principal sueño es tener su casa en buen estado para nazca su primer hijo.
texts.en:
Israel is from the city of Monterrey, Mexico.  He was born on September 20th, 1976 and is 36 years old.  He lives in Mitras Poniente, in the west of this city and has shared his home with his wife, Maria del Rosario, since August 2010.  The couple don't have any children yet.

Israel stopped attending high school to start working so that he could help his mom and provide for his three younger siblings.  His first job was in a shop, filling customers' orders.  He then changed to his current job, working as a sales and distribution manager at a fruit shop, in order to make more income. 

Israel has requested a Kiva loan because he would like to make some necessary repairs to the ceiling and roof of his house.  They are in a very bad state of repair and the whole house gets wet when it rains.  He hopes to receive this loan before the rainy period begins.  Right now, Israel's main dream is to have his house in a good state of repair for when his first child is born.

loans.use: to fix his ceiling and roof

loans.name: Ana Sabina

texts.es:
Ana tiene 29 años de edad, esta casada y tiene dos hijos de ocho y doce años de edad. Su esposo trabaja de albañil, sus dos hijos estudian, su hija se gano una beca estudiantil. Ella tiene dos trabajos, los días lunes, miércoles y viernes elabora pan en una panadería de 2:00 p.m. a 6:00 p.m. y los días sábados  y domingos elabora y vende pupusas de 4:00 p.m. a 8:00 p.m. los insumos para elaborar las pupusas las compra en la ciudad, una vez por semana para llegar ahí aborda un autobús que tarda cuarenta y Cinco minutos.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar una plancha, hielera más grande y unos libros para su hija. Con la plancha nueva brindara un mejor servicio a sus clientes y con mayor rapidez, además de proporcionar a su hija unos  libros que necesita para adquirir nuevos conocimientos. Su objetivo es incrementar y fortalecer su negocio para que su familia posea una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ana is twenty-nine years old, is married, and has two children (8 and 12 years old).  Her husband works as a bricklayer and her two children study.  Her daughter won a school scholarship.

She has two jobs.  On Mondays, Wednesdays, and Fridays, she makes bread at a bakery from 2:00 p.m. until 6:00 p.m.  On Saturdays and Sundays, she makes and sells stuffed tortillas from 4:00 p.m. to 8:00 p.m.  She buys the ingredients that she needs to make these stuffed tortillas in the city.  Once a week, she boards a bus to get to the city; it takes her 45 minutes.

The loan that she is requesting from Fundación Campo is to buy a grill, a bigger refrigerator, and some books for her daughter.  With the new grill, she will offer a better service to her customers with greater speed.  Also, she will be able to provide her daughter with some books that she needs in order to learn.

Her objective is to increase and strengthen her business so that her family has a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a grill, a bigger refrigerator, and some books for her daughter.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María de 33 años de edad , esta casada y tiene 02 hijos con quienes vive en una casa alquilada.María es una mujer emprendedora. María se dedica a trabajar el campo , en estos años aprendió a producir zanahorias, arvejas, habas, papas, maíz y otras hortalizas. Ella menciona que el producto que más satisfacciones le da es la arveja, ya que es de mayor demanda. Eso en temporadas buenas, ya que hay meses donde los precios llegan a bajar, pero María se recupera con la venta de sus otros productos. Es muy inteligente. Con esta actividad puede otorgarle a sus 2 hijos una calidad de vida que el permita no carecer de los servicios básicos. Sus metas se enfocan en mejorar y aumentar su producción de hortalizas aprovechando los suelos fértiles de su localidad. Por eso también alquilará parcelas.Este es el tercer crédito con KIVA y esta muy contenta por el apoyo financiero que recibe para continuar con sus planes, ademas promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.
María, invertirá los S/.2000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos para la próxima cosecha.
texts.en:
María, 33, is married and has two children that live with her in a rented house. María is an enterprising woman; she works in agriculture. María has learnt to grow carrots, peas, beans, potatoes, corn and other vegetables. She says that the produce that makes her more proud is peas, because it is the one with the higher demand, at least during the good seasons. Sometimes prices drop to the floor and María uses the remaining produce as back up.

María is an intelligent woman. With this activity she is able to give her two children a good life and satisfy their basic needs. Her goals are to increase her vegetables production, taking advantage of the fertile soil in her locality, and renting more land.

This is María’s third loan with Kiva, and she feels very happy with the financial support she is receiving to continue with her plans. She promises to pay the installments on time. María will invest the 2000 soles [PEN] in compost to nurture her fields for the upcoming season.

loans.use: to buy compost.

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en: Marietta is 45 years old and married with four children. Marietta and her family live in the village of Del Pilar. To earn a living, Marietta is engaged in selling rice in her village. She has been doing this business for nearly three years. Now Marietta is asking for a loan in the amount of 50,000 PHP to buy three sacks of rice to sell. She hopes to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy three sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is from the village of Balug. She has been involved in a hog-raising business for 15 years. She keeps five mother pigs and six little pigs. She lives with her husband and children. 

Together with her husband, Agnes works hard to run their farm and cover their daily costs. Realizing that the farming business is the only source of income for the family, she would like to expand her business. As she does not have sufficient funds to cover the farm's costs she has applied for this loan.

With the loan's help, Agnes will purchase forage to feed her pigs. This will allow her to feed them and continue the expansion of the farm.

loans.use: to purchase forage to feed her pigs.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
This is Rosalie. She previously accessed a 40,000 PHP loan that she used to buy gardening materials and supplies needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures. She has this business for 15 years and it continues to grow. She is also a jeepney and tricycle operator for additional income. 

She would like to apply for a 50,000 PHP loan. She will be using the loan to buy fertilizer, seeds and other planting materials for her gardening. Her profits from his business will definitely help her sustain their daily needs and her children's education. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Rosalie dreams that her business will grow even more. She meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds and other planting materials for her gardening.

loans.name: Odette

texts.en:
Odette works hard to support her family. Odette is married and has a shrimp and fish vending business in the Philippines.

Odette requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional shrimp and fish to sell.

Odette has been in this business for two years now.

In the future, Odette would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional shrimp and fish to sell.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
This is William. He previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan, which he used to buy school supplies to expand his product inventory. His earnings were a big help in paying for his personal, household and business expenditures.

William would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan to buy more stock of school and office supplies. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. The money he earns from his business will help him sustain his daily needs. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

William hopes that his business will continue to be successful. He meets with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his life and business every week. This is where he draws strength and inspiration from the word of God he studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group comprises 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for office and school supplies needed in his business.

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Dina works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending. Dina is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food production business and for her food vending business.

Dina has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Ma. Cristina

texts.en:
Ma. Cristina, 39 years old, is married to a farmer and blessed with two children. She has managed a piggery business for almost ten years. In this business she earns a net income of PHP 3,000 per hog. 

She would like to avail herself of a loan amounting to PHP 5,000 to purchase hog feed for her hogs. She's hoping that her loan will be granted so that she will be able to improve further her business to gain more income.

loans.use: to purchase hog feed for her hogs.

loans.name: Donna

texts.en:
Donna is a hardworking entrepreneur who sells purified drinking water in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy more stocks of drinking water to sell to customers.

Donna successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further improve her business.

NWTF is re-listing Donna's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of drinking water to sell.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 43 years old and married with two children who are in school. 

Marivic is in the agricultural business. She raises pigs in the Philippines. Marivic has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Marivic has been raising pigs for six years now, and she has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Marivic would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena and her retail business are doing well. She has had a convenience store for five years. She earns about PHP 300 a day. Elena is a widow. She works hard to raise her children. 

Elena wants to re-stock her sari-sari (convenience) store, but she lacks the necessary capital. For this reason, she is taking out this loan amounting to PHP 40,000 to buy grocery items such as canned goods, beverages, detergent soap and condiments to sell. She hopes that she can obtain her desired loan to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy grocery items such as canned goods, beverages, detergent soap and condiments to sell.

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
This is Beverly. She previously accessed an 20,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Beverly dreams that her business will continue to grow and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Lay's Group

texts.en:
Lay is 48 years old and has three children. She lives under a wooden house located in Kampong Cham province.  Lay is a local rubber grower on three hectares of land, which she has been doing for 28 years. 

Lay and her co-borrower are requesting a loan from VisionFund for 1,000,000 KHR each. As the group leader, she will use her loan to buy rubber tree seeding and potash for her farmland. She hopes to grow healthy rubber trees so that she can collect more latex to sell.

loans.use: to purchase rubber tree seeding and potash for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Pheach's Group

texts.en:
Pheach, a local citizen from Kampong Cham province, is 41 years old and married. She has two children. 

For her family’s sake, rice cropping on a one-hectare area and duck raising are the main income sources she has had for 10 years, earning about 40,000 KHR per day. 

Preach has never been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) before. She is now in a group of five to apply for a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer and duck feed. She hopes both businesses will grow at a great pace so she can gain triple yield and make more profits to sustain her living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and duck feed.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy ghee, sugar and other ingredients for her sweet-meat making and selling business.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Jocelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a butcher shop business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from buying and selling ready-to-wear clothing. 

Jocelyn is borrowing PHP 32,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of meat to sell for her butcher shop business.

Jocelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of meat to sell.

loans.name: Perpetua

texts.en:
Perpetua is 66 years old, married, and has ten children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Perpetua has been raising pigs for 13 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling dry goods.

Perpetua is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Neng's Group

texts.en:
Neng is 43 years old and married. She is a local resident from Kampong Cham province. To make a living, Neng works as a rice farmer and she also plants rubber trees. She is able to earn up to 24,600 KHR per day and is able to save up to 9,100 KHR per day. 

Neng is the leader of a four-woman group and this will be her first loan with the Kiva partner VisionFund. Neng is requesting a 1,000,000 KHR loan to buy more rubber tree seedlings to cultivate. Her co-borrowers are each requesting the same loan amount. In the future, Neng hopes to harvest a good rice yield to make more income to buy a plot of farmland to expand her business. She also hopes to build a new house for her family.

loans.use: to buy rubber tree seedlings to plant

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Cempaka Group

texts.en:
Rini is 41 years old and is a widow with two children, one of whom is in elementary school. For the past six years, she has operated a business where she sells bed linens, pillows and blouses on credit from her house. Since her husband passed away one year ago, Rini has had to work harder to provide for her family's needs. Sometimes she works as a freelance employee in a district office in her town.  Rini is a member of the community group, “Cempaka.” She is grateful to be part of this group that she feels is very hardworking and genuine. The other group members  work in various other trades including selling cooked foods and herb drinks, mostly through small kiosks

Rini is requesting a loan to purchase bed linens and Muslim fashions such as Mukena (Islam), white cloaks that cover a woman's head and body worn at prayer for Eid.

loans.use: to purchase bed linens and Muslim fashions such as white cloaks that cover a woman's head and body during prayer

loans.name: Lailanie

texts.en:
Lailanie is 25 years old and married. She works managing a store in her community. Lailanie is a happy person who is very responsible in terms of her family's needs.

Lailanie is requesting a 5,000 PHP loan to purchase boxes of candies, snack foods, canned goods, and spices for her business. In the future, her wish is to build a house for her family with the help of her husband.

loans.use: to purchase boxes of candies, snack foods, canned goods, and spices

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy beads and thread for her embroidery business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds and to prepare his land for planting.

loans.name: Lizel

texts.en:
This is Lizel who is 22 and a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Mark, an employee, and mother to her four children. Along with her husband, Lizel manages her business selling chicken and fish. She works hard to continually provide income for her family's everyday expenses. Lizel buys different kinds of fish and chicken at wholesale prices and sells them by the kilo. She buys fish at the local fish port early in the morning and many of her customers prefer her products since they are assured freshness and cleanliness. Lizel's store is located in a temporary fish market and her regular customers are her neighbors and local community members. She earns a minimum of 1,000 PHP in daily sales. 

Lizel is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan to buy more fish and chicken to sell every day. She hopes that her business will continue to grow. In the future, she dreams of having her own house and lot. Lizel meets up weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy fish and chicken to sell

loans.name: Georgette

texts.en:
Georgette is 53 years old, married, and has six children.  She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store and room rentals businesses in the Philippines, which she has been doing for six years.

Georgette is requesting her second loan from NWTF for 29,500 PHP, which she will use to purchase more groceries to sell.  She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is 40 years old and married with three children. For the past 12 years, she has run a general store in the Philippines and she also earns an income from selling food and raising pigs. Rosalina works hard to provide for her family and has borrowed and repaid 14 previous loans from NWTF. 

Rosalina is requesting a 28,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell such as soft drinks, bread, egg, soap, noodles, and other products. In the future, she aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, bread, egg, soap, noodles, and other products

loans.name: Nyabinome Tweheyo Group

texts.en:
Nyabinombe group is located in Nyabinombe Trading Centre in rural Ibanda. The group is comprised of both men and women whose major activity is small-scale farming. They fall into different categories including divorcees, widows, single mothers/fathers and married people.
 
Metusela is a father with a wife and five children and two additional dependents. Regardless of his disability, Metusela is a very economically active member of the community. Metusela is mainly a small-scale farmer who grows vegetables and supplies them in a local market. He supplements his vegetable business with a poultry farm, which he resorted to after losing his brother in 2010 so that he could look after both his and the brothers’ children and take them to school. 

He will use the loan to buy more chickens, to buy a bicycle to help him to supply his vegetables to distant customers, and pay school fees. The main challenge is chicken diseases as well as wild animals that eat his chickens after he has invested in them, which affects his working capital. Sometimes he and the family members fall sick, which reduces labor to work on his businesses. 

Despite all the challenges, Metusela is a very hardworking and determined man looking forward to changing the future of his children by giving them a good education.

loans.use: To buy chickens and a bicycle and pay school fees.

loans.name: Malo

texts.en:
Malo is married and she works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 30,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy more items like sardines, snack foods and other groceries.

Malo has been in this business for 10 years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Malo successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further improve her business.

Malo aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items like sardines, snack foods and other groceries.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
This is Rebecca, 56, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is single, and she manages her house while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Rebecca operates a funeral parlor. She also has a junk shop. She earns a minimum of 70,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) in sales every month.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan for the operation expenses of her funeral parlor.

Rebecca dreams to be more successful in her business. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the operation expenses of her funeral parlor.

loans.name: Ter's Group

texts.en:
Ter is 26 years old and lives with her husband and one daughter in a rural village of the Moung Russey district in Cambodia. To feed the family, Ter and her husband earn a living as farmers by farming rice on 1.5 hectare of farmland. Besides this, her husband also supplements the income by catching fish. Having been in this business for 10 years, Ter and her husband earn about 12,000 KHR per day to spend on the family’s needs.
Ter has been with VisionFund for one cycle and completely paid back the past loan while the other members have been with VisionFund for three cycles. As the leader, she is leading her group to apply for another loan with VisionFund. Ter is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and rice seed for her farmland and she hopes to increase her crop yields so as to generate more income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and rice seed for her farmland.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 61 years old and married with five children.
She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Elizabeth is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to purchase additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs.
Elizabeth has been raising pigs for 10 years and also earns additional income from motorcycle transport.
She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream.  She dreams of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy used sweaters for making thread.

loans.name: Narith's Group

texts.en:
Nartih is 34 years old and married with three dependent children who are all still in school. Her family lives in a house with a thatch roof located in Battambang province’s Moung Russey district. The main source of her family’s income is from farming rice in her village. Her husband earns extra income for his family by working for others for a fee. She has been running her business for ten years, earning about KHR 17,000 per day and she is able to save about KHR 9,000 each day.
Narith’s group consists of three members who have been with VisionFund for three cycles. Narith successfully paid back the past loans which have helped her to sustain her family’s business and support her family’s needs. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan of KHR 1,400,000 each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her farmland. Narith hopes to increase her crop yields to earn more income to improve their living standard and also keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her farmland.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is now 51 years living happily with her family members. Her clothing business has improved and her monthly income is KES. 32,000.
She has now requested to borrow her third loan of KES 70,000 from KADET LTD. She intends to use this amount to purchase new clothing for men, ladies and children. The profits she earns will be used to pay back the loan and the rest will pay school fees for her children.
Her dream is develop her plot of land and build residential houses to rent out.

loans.use: to purchase new clothes for her clothing business.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines.
She is borrowing PHP 28,000 through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell.
Evangeline has been in this business for 30 years. Evangeline earns more income from selling prepaid mobile phone credits and selling water.
Evangeline has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Sopha's Group

texts.en:
Sopha is 37 years old, married and lives with her family in a village of the Sangke district. She has seven children to take care of and now they are all still in school. To make a living, she has been farming rice and catching fish for several years and currently she earns her family about 80,000 KHR per day.
There are two members in Sopha’s group and she is a second cycle client with VisionFund. Sopha, who is the leader, is leading her group to apply for a loan. She will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and gasoline for water pumping. Sopha hopes to increase her family’s income to improve their living standards and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 25 years old and married with two children who are in school. She is from Nyahururu. Mary runs a business selling groceries in the market.

Mary is requesting her first loan from KADET LTD to buy vegetables, onions, tomatoes and other products to stock. In the near future, she hopes to see her business expand.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, onions, and tomatoes

loans.name: Raksa's Group

texts.en:
Raksa is 30 and married with three children, all of whom are dependent on her and still in school. She lives with her family in a village of the Ek Phnom district of Battambang province. Raksa and her husband are rice farmers. They have been in this business for eight years and earn about 47,000 KHR each day after their daily expenses. Raksa has received four previous loans through VisionFund. She used the profit from her loans to help relieve the financial burden on her family.

Raksa is the leader of a three-member loan group with VisionFund. She will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farm as well as pay for land plowing and labor. With her loan, Raksa hopes to grow more crops and sell them for a good price to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farm

loans.name: Shella

texts.en:
Shella finished her college education, but prefers to run a business. Shella is renting a stall in the market where she manages a kitchen ware business. She is married and has school aged children. Her husband helps her in managing the business. They usually sell glasses, kettles, spoons and forks.
Shella needs additional capital to buy stock for her business. This month, the month of harvesting rice and corn is a high traffic season for her business. Shella is requesting a loan of PHP 48,000 to buy pails, laundry baskets, and plates. She hopes to sell more items, earn a higher income and be able to provide for her family’s needs.

loans.use: to buy pails, laundry baskets, and plates.

loans.name: Chouk's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of Battambang province’s Sangke district, Chouk is a 64-year-old mother of five children, some of whom are still in school while the others help with their family’s business. She and her husband are farmers who grow rice and sesame in the village to make a living. Together, they can earn about 60,000 KHR per day and can manage to save about 30,000 KHR each day.
Chouk’s group consists of two female members and she has been with VisionFund for three cycles. She completely paid back the loans with VisionFund. The past loans have helped her better support her family. Now she and her group member are applying for a loan. As the leader, she will use her portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her crop yield so as improve their living standard and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more merchandise and a shelf.

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Antony is 29 years old, married, and has two children who attend school.  He is from Nakuru.  Antony has a transport business and also operates a retail shop, which he has been doing for three years. 

Anthony is requesting his second loan, which he will use to boost his retail shop business by buying cooking oil and soft drinks.  He will also use the loan to repair his motorcycle.  He hopes to buy a piece of land in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil and soft drinks and repair his motorcycle.

loans.name: Tupou

texts.en: Tupou is a 61-year-old married woman with 8 children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro, taamu, bananas and yams to earn a living. She has been doing this for 3 years. Tupou has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers, chemicals, bush knives, weed killer, axes, and rakes. She has been a member of SBPD since 2012. With her profits, Tupou hopes to improve her plantation, support her family and pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to pay for needed farming equipment.

loans.name: Danna  Gisseth

texts.es:
Ella se llama Danna tiene dieciocho años de edad estudia actualmente  técnico profesional en contabilidad financiera en la institucion de educación superior; 
Sus metas a corto plazo son:
Obtener buenas calificaciones
Obtener un empleo estable
Adquirir  conocimiento acerca de su carrera que como tal es su motivación   
Sus metas a mediano plazo
Sostener un nivel alto en calificaciones 
La vida laboral este siempre con una excelente estabilidad tanto económica como social
Laboral según lo que estudia (contabilidad)
Seguir la proyección de una gran contadora publica 
Sus metas a largo plazo
Terminar la carrera 
Graduación con Honores.
Viajar a otro país.
Asesorar en la contabilidad pública en las grandes empresas del país. 
Obtener un  pull de contadores.
texts.en:
This is Danna. She is 18 and currently studying for a professional career in accounting at university.
Her short-term goals are:
To obtain good qualifications
To obtain stable employment
To acquire knowledge about her career
Her medium-term goals are:
To maintain high-level qualifications
For her work, economic, and social life to always be highly stable.
To work in her field of study (accounting)
To follow her goal to be a great public accountant
Her long-term goals are:
To finish her education
To graduate with honours
To travel to another country
To be a public accounting consultant to the country's large companies
To have an accounting company.

loans.use: to finish her academic program in accounting.

loans.name: Martha Alicia

texts.es:
Martha, requiere de un nuevo crédito por la necesidad de invertir más en el negocio, ya que menciona que es de mucha utilidad trabajar con prestamos. Este le ayudara a comprar  ropa para damas, niños y niñas. 
El préstamo anterior le permitió  mejorar sus inventarios y obtener mayores ingresos. Las circunstancias familiares y las condiciones económicas han mejorado.
texts.en:
Martha needs a new loan because she needs to invest more in her business. She says that it is very useful to work with loans. This will help her to buy clothing for women and children.
Her previous loan allowed her to improve her inventory and obtain a better income. Her family circumstances and economic situation have both improved.

loans.use: to buy clothing for women and children.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 51 years old and married with five children, one of whom is still in school. For the past 30 years, she has run a fishing business in the Philippines. Fe is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Fe is requesting a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her fishing business. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her fishing business

loans.name: Dieu Est Grand Group

texts.fr: DIEU EST GRAND est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans la même zone. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité et de faire face à la demande de leur clientèle, ce groupe s'est rapproché de ALIDé, en vue de l'obtention d'un prêt. La représentante du groupe, Zoula (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 38 ans. Zoula est mariée à Pierre et est mère de trois enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Zoula vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Zoula a arrêté l'école au niveau primaire. Pour contribuer aux diverses charges de la maison, Zoula a commencé depuis une vingtaine d'année la vente de fruits (bananes, avocat) par le système de distribution. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de son activité tout en la diversifiant, Zoula sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe DIEU EST GRAND, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: “Dieu is grand“ [“God is great“ ] is the name of a three-person group whose members  live in the same residential zone. In order to take their business to the next level and meet customer demand, the group has reached out to ALIDé with the goal o obtaining a loan. The group’s representative, Zoula (the one raising her hand in the photo) is 38 years old. Zoula is married to Pierre and has three dependent children, some of whom are in school. Zoula lives together with her husband and children. The spouses jointly provide for various household needs. For about 20 years, Zoula has been selling fruits (bananas, avocados) through a distribution system. With the goal of expanding and diversifying her business, Zoula, along with the other members of the “Dieu est grand” group, is seeking her first loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy fruits.

loans.name: Brisayda

texts.es:
Brisayda de 33 años de edad , esta casada con el padre de sus 3 hijos, quienes están en edad escolar. Todos ellos viven en una casa propia la cual construyeron con mucho esfuerzo. Brisayda se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles de primera necesidad que ofrece en una tienda acondicionada en su propio hogar. Lleva como 5 años en este negocio y menciona que le va muy bien, y que todo depende de los productos frescos y surtidos que sus clientes encuentran. “La atención a mis clientes es lo primordial, además este trabajo es más relajado que la agricultura”, dice. Una de sus metas es otorgarles lo necesario a sus hijos, en cuanto a sus estudios posteriores. Para ello seguirá trabajando como hasta ahora.Este crédito otorgado por KIVA sera muy util para seguir con sus proyectos , ademas se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Brisayda, invertirá los S/.1000 soles en la compra de productos comestibles tales como arroz , azúcar, aceite , entre otros .
texts.en:
Brisayda, age 33, is married to the father of her three school-aged children. They all live in their own home, which they built through great hard work. Brisayda sells basic food staples in a store in her own home. She has had this business for five years and says that it is going very well for her. Everything depends on the fresh products she stocks for her customers. "My customer service is fundamental. What's more, this work is more relaxed than agriculture", she says. This loan through Kiva will be very useful for her in continuing with her projects, and she promises to repay her quotas punctually.
Brisayda will invest the 1,000 soles in the purchase of edible products such as rice, sugar, and oil.

loans.use: to buy edible products such as rice, sugar, and oil.

loans.name: Ilhom

texts.ru:
Илхом  молодой мужчина в возрасте 33 лет.   К сожалению он разведён и  не имеет детей. Живет со своими родителями.   Он является   мастером  по ремонту жилых помещений , занимается отделочными работами и у него это хорошо получается.  Его единственный брат находиться в Российской Федерации на заработках, и по возможности отправляет денежные средства своим родителям.   Илхом решил произвести капитальный ремонт  в своем доме, так как они живут в очень плохих условиях.  Он накопил деньги но ему не хватает на покупку строительных материалов.  
 Илхом узнав у своих знакомых об организации Арванд решил получить кредит, и приобрети нужную сумму.   На полученный кредит Илхом планирует купить строительные материалы и отремонтировать свой дом. 
Он заранее благодарит Арванд за помощь и поддержку.
texts.en:
Ilkhom is a young man of 33. He is divorced, has no children, and lives with his parents. He is an expert home repairman — he does finishing work — and this is working out well for him. His only brother is working abroad in Russia, and he sends as much money as he can to his parents. Ilkhom has decided to do some major repairs on his house, for their living conditions are very poor. He has saved up some money, but it is not enough to buy the necessary building materials.
After hearing about Arvand from his friends, Ilkhom decided to take out a loan. He plans to use the money to buy building materials and repair his house. He thanks you in advance for help and support.

loans.use: to purchase of building materials

loans.name: Akmal

texts.ru: Акмал холостой молодой человек. Ему 30 лет. Он живет вместе с отцом и матерью в городе Конибодом в северной части Таджикистана. Его отец начальник хлопкоочистительного завода города Конибодом, а мать домохозяйка. У Акмала высшее юридическое образование, однако по специальности он не работает. Акмал работает в сфере предоставления услуг. Он успешный молодой бизнесмен. Он владелец ресторана "Ясмин", который предназначен для проведения свадебных торжеств. Акмал управляет этим рестораном уже в течение года и хорошо справляется своей должностью. В его ресторане работают два повара и четыре официанта. В месяц в его ресторане в среднем справляется пять свадет. Сейчас Акмал запрашивает кредит для ремонта ресторана. Он хочет провести ремонт, чтобы увеличить спрос клиентов на его ресторан в сезон свадеб.
texts.en: Akmal is a single young man. He is 30 years old. He lives with his parents in the town of Konibodom in the north of Tajikistan. His father is the director of  a cotton cleaning factory in Konibodom, and his mother is a homemaker. Akmal has graduated from law school, but he does not work in his field. He is in the service industry. He is a successful young businessman. He owns a restaurant named “Yasmin” for wedding celebrations. He has been managing this restaurant for a year and is doing his job well. His restaurant employs two chefs and four waiters. On the average, each month there are   five wedding receptions held in his restaurant. At present Akmal is requesting a loan for renovation works. He wants to renovate his premises in order to increase customer demand during the wedding season.

loans.use: to renovate his restaurant.

loans.name: Rath's Group

texts.en:
Rath is 36 years old and the married mother of four children. She lives in a rural village of the Sangke district, Cambodia. For the past 15 years, Rath has been farming rice and catching fish to support her family. She currently earns about 40,000 KHR each day. Rath has successfully received seven previous loans with VisionFund that she used to better support her family and business.

Rath is the leader of a two-person group loan. She will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer and seed for her farm as well as buy a fish trap for her fishing business. In the future, Rath hopes to increase her rice yield to sell for a good price to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seed for her farm

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store in the Philippines. She has operated her business for the past 21 years and earns additional income from buying and selling rice and corn. Gemma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She has successfully repaid her previous loans.

Gemma is requesting a 28,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase stock to sell such as eggs, spices, shampoo, soap, and other items. In the future, she dreams of saving enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase eggs, spices, shampoo, soap, and other items

loans.name: Chisungo Group

texts.en:
Kundai is 37 years old, married, and has three children who attend school. She also cares for three dependents. She is from Murehwa, Zimbabwe. Kundai runs a retail business selling clothes, handbags, shoes, blankets, and jackets, which she has been doing for three years. 

Kundai is requesting a loan for $1,200, which she will use to buy clothes. Her main challenges are bad debts and the irregular market dynamics.  The extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to send her children to better schools. In the future, Kundai plans to own a retail shop for clothes.

loans.use: to purchase clothes, winter jackets, handbags, and blankets.

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr:
Madame  Fatoumata est âgée  de 33 ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle   vit dans une famille nucléaire   au quartier Bagadadji  de  Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Enseignante de profession, en plus de cette fonction elle mène des activités génératrices de revenus, commencé  auprès de sa mère qui vendait beaucoup d’articles (condiments, encens, jus de fruit, habits et chaussures). Après plusieurs années passées à ses côtés, elle décida de mener le commerce de chaussures et d’habits. Elle mène cette activité depuis 10 ans et jouit d’une grande expérience et clientèle. Sa force de vente est due à la qualité de sa marchandise.  
Dans le souci de satisfaire sa clientèle, elle  sollicite ce prêt. Après 4 prêts solidaires et 5  prêts individuels correctement remboursés elle est à son 6ème prêt individuel qu’elle  compte utiliser pour acheter  10 pièces de pagnes et 3 ballets de chaussures,  elle s’approvisionne à Bamako.  
Fatoumata  vend au comptant et crédit à une clientèle mixte, Avec ce prêt,  elle envisage de  réaliser un bénéfice mensuel 60 000 FCFA, ce dernier lui permet de rembourser son prêt et de pérenniser son activité.
texts.en:
Fatoumata is 33 years old, married, and mother of two children. She lives in a nuclear family in the Bagadadji neighborhood of Ségou (fourth-largest administrative region in the Republic of Mali).

She is a teacher by profession and, in addition, she carries out revenue-generating activities that were started by her mother, who sold many different items (condiments, incense, fruit juice, clothes, and shoes). After several years working alongside her mother, she decided to run her own business of buying and selling shoes and clothes. She has been running this business for ten years now and has a good amount of experience as well as many clients. She is able to sell a lot of goods thanks to the high quality of her merchandise.

She is seeking this loan with a view to helping her satisfy her clients. After four group loans and five individual loans, all of which were correctly repaid, she is now on her sixth individual loan, which she plans to use to buy 10 pagnes and 3 crates of shoes. She stocks up in Bamako.

Fatoumata  sells her goods for cash or for credit to a mixed clientele. With this loan, she plans to earn a monthly profit of 60,000 FCFA, which will enable her to repay her loan and continue to run her business.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes

loans.name: Herminio

texts.es:
Herminio, de 41 años de edad , es viudo y tiene 5 hijos a los que cuida en la casa que compró hace 18 años. A pesar de las dificultades que tiene siempre saca la fuerza necesaria para seguir adelante, pues tiene muchos hijos a quienes cuidar . Desde muy joven comenzó a cuidar de la tierra, pues sus padres le enseñaron el noble oficio de la agricultura. Ahora el produce la tierra en las hectáreas que le heredaron donde siembra, papa, maíz, alverja en zona alta y frutas como manzana, plata y demás cítricos en la zona cálida. Comenta que gracias a las tierras fértiles que posee, puede obtener buenos ingresos económicos que le ayudan a mejorar sus ingresos, pues cada cosecha lo comercializa a la capital del país, donde viaja cada 15 días. Ahora desea mejorar sus ganancias, adquiriendo mayor producción y espera poder lograrlo con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo.
Este es el primer préstamo con KIVA, espera el apoyo financiero para seguir trabajando,además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. 
Herminio, invertirá los S/.1000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus frutales.
texts.en:
Herminio, a 41 year old, is a widower and has 5 children who he cares for in the house that he bought 18 years ago.  Despite the difficulties that he has had in achieving upward mobility, he has always had the motivation to do so, yet he also has to care for his many children.  Since he was very young, he has worked the earth, as his parents taught him the noble endeavor that is farming.  He now works upon the hectares of land which he inherited, where he plants potatoes, corn, and peas in the highlands and fruits like apples, plantains, and citrus fruits in the warmer regions.  He says that thank to the fertile lands which he possesses, he can make a good living, which helps him to grow his income as he sells each harvest in the country's capital city, where he travels every 15 days.  He now wants to improve his profits by creating additional production and he hopes to achieve this end through hard work and effort.  

This is his first loan through KIVA, and he is waiting for this financial aid in order to continue working, and he also promises to be punctual in his payments.  Herminio will invest the 1000 Soles in buying organic fertilizers to add nutrients to his fruit crops.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizers.

loans.name: Miguel Geovany

texts.es:
Miguel tiene 24 años de edad y una familia conformada por su esposa y un niño que viene en camino, ya que su esposa esta embarazada. Él se dedica a trabajar en una tienda ubicada en el centro de la ciudad, desde hace 3 años. A demás, en su día de descanso se dedica  a trabajar en su casa, ayuda a su esposa en sus tareas de la casa es una familia de bajos recursos que comparte el día a día, él es una persona muy conocida de la zona tiene buena relación con los vecinos y es una persona muy tranquila, respetuoso con todas las personas.
Él tiene que caminar 4 kilómetros desde su casa hasta la ciudad, todos los días para poder ir a trabajar y la dificultad que se le presenta es que hay momentos en que no hay transporte tan seguido para poder transportarse él y su esposa para el trabajo y por eso tiene pensado comprar una motocicleta para ser mas fácil el transportarse.
El préstamo que solicita a Fundación Campo, es para comprar una motocicleta. Para facilitar el transportarse todos los días a su trabajo, ya que entran bien temprano a su trabajo, por que su jefe es bien estricto con la puntualidad. Por eso ha tenido problemas pero con la compra de la motocicleta ese problema se resolverá y también para transportase en alguna emergencia que pueda ocurrír en algún momento por que a ellos les queda muy lejos la ciudad. Como es su primer crédito piensa salir bien, para que a futuro poder solicitar un nuevo crédito por cual quier necesidad que se le presente ya que a pensado que es una buena opción trabajar con fundación campo.
texts.en:
Miguel is 24. His family includes his wife and a baby on the way. Miguel has worked at a store in the city centre for three years. On top of this, in his free time he works on his home and helps his wife with the housework. The family has few resources in their day-to-day living. He is a very well-known person in the area and has a good relationship with the neighbours. He is a very peaceful person who is respectful to others.
He has to walk 4 kilometers from his home to the city every day in order to go to work. The difficulty is that there are times where there is no transportation available to get him and his wife to work. For this reason, he plans to buy a motorcycle to make it easier to get around.
This loan that he is requesting from Fundación Campo is for the purchase of a motorcycle to facilitate his daily work commute. Now that the weather is getting nicer, his boss is very strict about punctuality. This has caused problems, but with the purchase of a motorcycle this problem will be resolved. It will also be a method of transportation in case there is any emergency at any time, because they live very far from the city. Since this is his first loan, he wants to do well so that he can request a new loan in the future for whatever necessity may present itself. He thinks that working with Fundacion Campo is a good decision.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to get to work every day.

loans.name: Soklim's Group

texts.en:
Soklim is 32 years old and married, with three children. She and her family live in a village of the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province. 

To make a living, she and her husband have been planting cassava for 12 years, earning about KHR 40,000 per day. To create more income, Soklim and her husband work for others, for a fee, in the rubber fields.  

Soklim is in her second loan cycle, while her co-member is just with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund Cambodia, for this cycle. Soklim has successfully used the past loan to improve her family’s livelihood. Now Soklim is leading her group to apply for a loan with VisionFund Cambodia. 

Soklim will use her portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland; she will also use a portion of it to spend on labor costs. With this loan, she hopes to grow her crops better and produce higher yields in order for her to increase her family’s income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Concepción Del Carmen

texts.es:
Concepción tiene 27 años de edad, tiene dos hijos.  Es una persona muy conocida y emprendedora. Ella se creció trabajando con su madre en la agricultura, sabe sembrar maíz; hoy en día se dedica a trabajar en la ciudad en un negocio de lavado de automóviles, como control de calidad ese es el cargo que desempeña es una persona muy amable con todas las personas del trabajo y donde ella vive. Ella tiene dos hijos pequeños un barón y una hembra los niños los cuida la madre cunado ella tiene que ir a trabajar, es una madre responsable a pesar que es una madre soltera a podido salir a delante.
El préstamo que solicita a Fundación Campo, es para cancelar el alquiler del terreno para sembrar granos básicos como maíz, frijol y arroz. Ella no posee demasiado dinero para poder alquilar el terreno, por eso opto por el crédito. La necesidad que será cubierta con el crédito es poder comprar los insumos y poder alquilar el terreno para poder cultivar y poder realizar a tiempo la siembra del maíz y poder lograr una buena cosecha para este invierno.
Ella piensa que en el futuro podrá seguir trabajando en la siembra del maíz; ya que cuenta con el apoyo de la fundación.
texts.en:
Concepción is 27 and has two children. She is a very well-known and enterprising person. She grew up working with her mother in agriculture and knows how to cultivate corn. She now works in the city doing quality control for a car-washing business. She is very kind to everyone she works with and to all her neighbours. She has two small children, a girl and a boy. Her sister-in-law cares for the children when she works. She is a responsible mother, and even though she is a single mother she has been able to get ahead.
This loan that she is requesting from Fundacion Campo is to pay the rent on a plot of land for sowing basic staples such as corn, beans, and rice. She does not have enough money to rent the land, so she has opted for this loan. This loan will allow her to buy the necessary supplies and to pay the rent on the land so that she can cultivate crops and plant the corn on time. She will be able to obtain a good harvest for the winter.
