She thinks that in the future she will be able to continue to work sowing corn, since she has the support of Fundacion.

loans.use: to pay the rent on a plot of land for sowing basic staples such as corn, beans, and rice.

loans.name: Ameen

texts.en: Ameen is a married man and has three children living in Sana`a, Yemen. He is a teacher by profession working eight hours a day. He is a very ambitious man whose dream is to raise his children well. Inadequate capital and inflation mean he may not achieve his children's demand. He intends to buy some things for his house so he applied for a loan of 349,999.92 YER from AMB to buy furniture to use for his house.

loans.use: to buy furniture to use for his house.

loans.name: Jesugnon Group

texts.fr: Le groupe JESUGNON est formé de trois personnes qui résident dans la maison. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Aimée, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Aimée est âgée de 31 ans et n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Aimée est mariée à un mécanicien du nom de Grégroire. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Aimée vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Aimée vend du maïs depuis près de quinze ans. Aimée s’approvisionne dans un marché et une région du Bénin. Dans le souci de renforcer davantage son activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Aimée désire augmenter le stock de ses produits. Pour ce faire, Aimée sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe JESUGNON, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux premiers crédits reçus ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: The Jesugnon Group consists of three people who live in a house.  The representative of the group, Aimee, is the one with her hand raised in the photo.  Aimee is 31-years old and has not attended school.  Aimee is married to a mechanic named Gregoire.  The couple have four children, all in school and their dependents.  Together, the couple takes care of the various household expenses. To meet her different responsibilities, Aimee has sold corn for almost 15 years.  Aimee stocks up at a market in a region of Benin.  To strengthen her business and better respond to customer needs, Aimee wants to increase her inventory of products.  To do this, Aimee and the other members of Jesugnon Group are asking for their third loan from Alide.  Their first two loans were fully repaid.

loans.use: to buy bags of corn.

loans.name: Rukhsora

texts.ru: Рухсора 32-летняя замужняя женщина. У нее двое маленьких детей - сын и дочь. Ее муж в данное время находится на заработках в загранице. Рухсора проживает в городе Конибодом на севере Таджикистана. У нее среднее техническое образование. Она занимается земледелием уже 4 года. У нее имеется 7га орошаемой земли, на которой она выращивает хлопок и ячмень. Сейчас Рухсора хочет обработать землю и после посеять хлопок и ячмень. С этим намерением она обратилась за кредитом для закупа минеральных удобрений, топлива, семян хлопка и ячменя. Рухсора надеется получить хороший урожай и за счет прибыли с продажи улучшить семейный быт.
texts.en:
Rukhsora is a 32-year-old, married woman. She has two small children: a son and a daughter. Her husband is currently working abroad. Rukhsora resides in the town of Konibodom in northern Tajikistan. She has a technical high school education. 

She has been engaged in agriculture for four years. She has seven hectares of irrigated land, on which she grows cotton and barley. Rukhsora now wants to prepare the ground and after to sow it with cotton and barley. With this intention, she applied for a loan to buy mineral fertilizer, fuel, and cotton and barley seeds. 

Rukhsora hopes to get a good crop and to use the profits from sales to improve her family life.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizer, fuel, cotton and barley seeds

loans.name: Sokphan's Group

texts.en:
Sokphan is 29 years old and married. She lives with her husband and two children in a rural area of the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province. All of her children are still in school. 

She and her husband are farmers who grow cassava. Having been in this business for ten years, together they can earn about KHR 50,000 per day. 

Sokphan is in her third loan cycle with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund Cambodia, and she completely paid back the loans, which have helped her improve her family’s living conditions. Now, she is leading her group to ask for a loan. 

As the leader, Sokphan is going to use this loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland; she will also use a portion of it for labor costs. She hopes to grow her business and make more crops, to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland and to pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 37 years old and supports a family of four. He is married to Leah, a house wife, and together they have two children aged six and three years respectively. Samuel has been in the transport industry for the last ten years making a monthly income of 15,000 Kenyan shillings (KES).

Samuel first learnt about KADET LTD from his colleagues in the business who were already registered members. He has now acquired a loan of 71,177 KES, which will assist him in purchasing his own motorcycle. He plans to use his profits to educate his children.

His hope and dream is to own a fleet of taxis.

loans.use: to buy his own motorcycle

loans.name: Adelyn

texts.en: Her general store is the primary source income of Adelyn. She is from the village of Del Pilar, Alicia. She has been in her business for three years and usually earns a minimum of PHP 300 a day. She is 36 years old and happily married to Ramill.  Adelyn is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 25,000 to buy grocery items such as canned goods, beverages, condiments and assorted types of bread to sell. She hopes that she can obtain her desired loan to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy grocery items such as canned goods, beverages, condiments and assorted types of bread to sell

loans.name: Meka

texts.en:
Meka is a 32-year-old married woman with five children. She has a small plantation and she grows taro, 'taamu', bananas and yams to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years. 

Meka has requested a loan purchase fertilizers, chemicals, bush knives, weed killer, axes, rakes, etc. She has been a member of SBPD since 2012. With her profits, Meka hopes to improve her plantation, support her family, and cover her children's education.

loans.use: to pay for chemicals, bush knives, weed killer, axes, rakes, etc.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a 52-year-old married woman with seven children.

To earn a living, she makes and sells masi popo and ice cakes in her community. She has two years of experience with this business.

Maria is seeking a loan to buy additional ingredients and necessities, including sacks of sugar, flour, yeast, frying pans, and forks. She plans to use the profits she generates as a result of the loan to better support her family and to save for her business's future needs. Maria became a member of SPBD this year.

loans.use: to expand and improve her business by purchasing additional ingredients and necessities (e.g., sugar, flour, yeast, frying pans, and forks)

loans.name: Ana Daisy

texts.es:
Ana, solicita un nuevo préstamo por la necesidad de invertir más en el negocio.  Este le permitirá comprar cerdos grandes y otra parte lo invertirá en insumos agrícolas para el cultivo. 
El crédito anterior le ayudo a crecer y tener todo lo necesario para trabajar. Las circunstancias familiares han cambiado, posee mejores ingresos y viven mucho mejor que antes.
texts.en:
Ana is soliciting a new loan because she needs to make additional investments in her business. This will permit her to buy adult pigs and, also, to invest in agricultural supplies for her crops.

Ana's previous loan helped her business expand, providing all that was necessary for her work. As a result, Ana's family circumstances have changed; she has better income now and lives much better than before.

loans.use: to buy adult pigs and, in addition, to invest in agricultural supplies for her crops.

loans.name: Maribel Celestina

texts.es:
Maribel tiene 39 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Pisco, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido, playas hermosas, atractivos turísticos muy visitados en todo el año como lo es las “Islas Ballestas” y el “Candelabro de Paracas”, asimismo se desarrolla la agricultura, en especial el cultivo de algodón, maíz, entre otros. Maribel es muy trabajadora, pero cuando tiene un tiempito libre le gusta mucho jugar vóley con sus amigas de su barrio y en algunas ocasiones le encanta disfrutar de uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Aji de gallina”. Debido a los pocos recursos económicos d sus padres ella solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado mucho estudiar la carrera de enfermería.

Día a día Maribel trabaja como agricultora, ella tiene una pequeña parcela en la cual ha sembrado maíz, ella trabaja alrededor de 9 horas diarias y con el fruto de su trabajo puede solventar los gastos de su hogar y apoyar a sus padres; ella cree que el va bien porque le gusta lo que hace y sobre todo por sus ganas de salir adelante.

Maribel está muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva ya que es la segunda vez que le brindan su gran apoyo y en esta oportunidad podrá comprar insecticidas, fertilizantes, entre otros; de esta manera podrá tener un cultivo en buenas condiciones y poder tener una buena cosecha, así ella seguirá trabajando cada día para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener más parcelas y ser una gran empresaria”.
texts.en:
Maribel, 39, lives in the city of Pisco, a city with a warm climate, beautiful beaches and popular touristic attractions, like the Ballestas islands and the Paracas Candelabra. There are also many agricultural activities, especially cotton and corn plantations. Maribel is a hardworking woman, but when she has some free time, she likes to play volleyball with her friends from her neighborhood and sometimes she enjoys having a delicious “aji de gallina,” one of her favorite dishes.

Due to her parents’ lack of resources, she could study only up to the fifth year of secondary school, but she would have liked to study to become a nurse. Maribel works every day in agriculture. She has a small piece of land where she is growing corn. She works around nine hours every day and thanks to her work, she is able to pay for her home expenses and to support her parents. She believes she does well because she likes her job and because of her will to succeed.

Maribel wants to thank Kiva lenders, since this is the second time they give her their great support. This time, she will buy insecticides, fertilizers and other supplies, in order to have a healthy plantation and a good harvest. She will continue working every day to make her dream come true: to acquire more land and become a great entrepreneur.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, compost and other agicultural supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a carport roof.

loans.name: La Trinite 1 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe LA TRINITE 1 est formé de quatre personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Yolande Nadou, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Yolande Nadou est âgée de 44 ans et a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire. Yolande Nadou est marié à un certain Moumouni. Le couple a un enfant scolarisé et à leur charge. Yolande Nadou vit ensemble avec son mari et son enfant. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la maison. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Yolande Nadou vend des tissus depuis près de vingt ans par la méthode de distribution. Yolande Nadou s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le souci de renforcer davantage son activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Yolande Nadou désire augmenter le stock de ses produits. Pour ce faire, Yolande Nadou sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe la TRINITE 1, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: The Trinite 1 group consists of four people who live in the same neighborhood.  The representative of the group, Yolande Nadou, is the one with her hand raised in the photo.  Yolande Nadou is 44-years old and stopped attending school at the secondary level.  She is married to Moumouni and they have one child who attends school and is their dependent.  Yolande Nadou lives with her husband and her child.  Together, the couple takes care of the household expenses. To meet her different responsibilities, Yolande Nadou has sold fabric by distribution for nearly 20 years.  Yolande Nadou stocks up at a market in Benin. In order to strengthen her business and to better respond to customer needs, Yolande Nadou wants to increase her inventory of goods.  To do this, she and the other members of Trinite 1 Group are asking for a second loan from Alide.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Jesukpego 9 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe JESUKPEGO 9 est formé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Honorine, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Honorine est âgée de 34 ans et n'a pas fréquenté l’école. Honorine est mariée à un certain Lucien. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Honorine vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Honorine assure ensemble avec son mari, les charges de la maison. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Honorine vend des plateaux d’œufs frais et des liqueurs dans un quartier du Bénin depuis près de quinze ans. Honorine s’approvisionne dans une région du Bénin. Dans le souci de renforcer davantage son activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Honorine désire augmenter le stock de ses produits. Pour ce faire, Honorine sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe JESUKPEGO 9, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: The Jesukpego 9 Group consists of three people who live in the same neighborhood.  The representative of the group, Honorine, is the one with her hand raised in the photo.  This is the first time that this group is seeking financial support from Alide in order to grow their business.  Honorine is 34-years old and did not attend school.  She is married to Lucien. They have four children, all attending school and their dependents.  Honorine lives together with her children and husband.  Together with her husband, Honorine takes care of their household expenses.  To meet her various resposibilities, Honorine has sold platters of fresh eggs and liquor in a neighborhood of Benin for nearly 15 years.  Honorine stocks up in a region of Benin.  In order to further strengthen her business and to better respond to her customers' needs, Honorine wants to increase her inventory of goods.  To do this, Honorine and the other members of Jesukpego 9 Group are asking for a first loan from Alide.

loans.use: to buy liquor and platters of fresh eggs.

loans.name: Ravshanjon

texts.ru: Равшанчон жительница города Конибодом. Конибодом находится на севере Таджикистана. Равшанчон вдова с тремя детьми. У нее двое сыновей и одна дочь. Ей 56 лет. Ее старший сын и невестка уехали на заработки в Россию. У Равшанчон среднее техническое образование. В течение 20 лет она работала швеей на швейной фабрике. Сейчас Равшанчон работает дома. Она занимается вышиванием национальных одеял (курпа и курпача) и принимает заказы у себя дома. У нее очень много клиентов, так как Равшанчон славится опытной мастерицей. Кредит запрашивает для закупа ткани с целью расширения своей деятельности.
texts.en:
Ravshanjon is an inhabitant of the town of Konibodom, which is located in northern Tajikistan. Ravshanjon is a widow with three children, two sons and a daughter. She is 56 years old. Her older son and his wife left for Russia to work. Ravshanjon has a secondary technical education. 

For 20 years, she has worked as a seamstress in a sewing factory. Ravshanjon now works at home. She is involved in embroidered national quilts ('kurpa' bed covers and 'kurpacha' mattresses) and takes orders at her home. She has many customers, because Ravshanjon is famed as an experienced seamstress. 

The loan is requested for purchasing fabrics in order to expand her activities.

loans.use: to buy fabrics

loans.name: Kitita

texts.en:
Kitita is a 38-year-old farmer who is married to Rhoda and is the father of six children, aged 14,12, nine, seven, four and two years respectively. He has been farming wheat on his own piece of land for the last 20 years, making a monthly income of 50,000 Kenyan shillings (KES). 

After learning about KADET LTD from his brother, who is a long-time client of the agency, Kitita has acquired his first loan of 100,000 KES as an individual client. This will enable him to prepare his land, as well as purchase seedlings and fertilizers. He plans to use the proceeds to plant a variety of other crops like maize and beans.

Kitita hopes to expand his business into a large commercial venture one day.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
This is Agnes, a 55-year-old resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Herbert, a pensioner, and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating businesses. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Agnes operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. For instance, it is the place to go to buy small amounts of shampoo, cooking oil, or even an egg. She earns income by purchasing supplies/goods at wholesale prices and selling such items on an individual basis. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She explains that she typically earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

She is now seeking a loan in the amount of 10,000 PHP loan to help her continue to operate the business. Specifically,she will use the loan proceeds to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Agnes hopes that, with the help of the requested loan, her business will be bigger. She dreams of operating a supermarket in the future. She meets with her co-fellowship members every week to share stories of her life and her business, which allows her to draw strength and inspiration from the other members and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is comprised of 15-30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To expand her business by purcasing additional inventory (e.g., groceries, toiletries and beverages).

loans.name: Kheng

texts.en:
Kheng is a 57-year-old, married woman with seven children. She and her family live in a wooden house in the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province. Four of her children are in school and still depend on their parents.

The main source of her family’s income is from rice farming and growing cassava. She has been in the farming business for almost twenty years. She explains that she typically earns approximately 30,000 KHR per day.

This is the fourth loan Kheng is seeking through Kiva's partner, VisionFund. She successfully used the prior loans to improve her family's living conditions. Now she is seeking another loan with VisionFund, the proceeds of which would be used to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to increase her crop yield and sell the crops for a good price so that she can continue to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To increase her crop yield by purchasing fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Kat's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in Dambae district where crop farming is a common way to make a living, Kat, 26, is a married mother of three children. The sources of her family’s income are rice farming and planting cassava. She and her husband have been in these businesses for six years. They can earn about 28,000 KHR per day and manage to save about 6,000 KHR each day after daily expenses. 

This is the sixth loan for Kat with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, and she successfully used the past loans to relieve her family’s financial burden and increase family’s income. She is now leading her group to seek for a loan. She is going to use her portion to buy pesticides for her farmland and a portion to spend on labor fees. With this loan, Kat hopes to increase her crop yields so as to earn more income to improve her family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy vegetables for vegetable-selling business

loans.name: Virgen Del Carmen Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Virgen del Carmen está en su ciclo número doce  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, el cual les permite saber su nivel de ingresos, y todas ellas están con un ingreso muy bajo.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Aurelia, quien través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y la aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa, ella se encuentra mejorando su situación de pobreza, pero igualmente está consciente de que este trabajo y esfuerzo que está haciendo debe ser continuo y permanente para lograr un éxito total, ya que con ello podrá dar un mejor bienestar a su familia. Ella se dedica a la venta ambulante de todo tipo de productos, como ser prendas, calzados, y demás productos, y con ello está tratando de mejorar sus ingresos y ayudar a sus familiares.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de sus productos principales para la venta,  como ser ropas , zapatos para esta nueva temporada de invierno los cuales la ayudaran a mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The 'Virgen del Carmen' group is in its 12th loan cycle within the Women's Committee Program.  The women all work and help each other to make progress.  They all completed the 'make poverty history' survey which lets them know their income levels.  They all have a very low income.

One of the members of this group is Aurelia who, through her own efforts, with continual hard work and by applying the behavior of a successful woman, is improving her situation and working her way out of poverty.  However, she is aware that this work and effort on her part must be continual and permanent in order to achieve complete success which will enable her to better provide for her family.

Aurelia's business is selling all kinds of goods such as clothing, footwear, etc. as an itinerant street vendor.  Through this work, she is trying to improve her income and help her family members.  She is requesting this loan to buy the main products she sells in her business such as clothing and shoes.  She will buy goods for the winter season and this will help her to improve her income and quality of life.

loans.use: to buy clothing and shoes to sell

loans.name: San Arnoldo Group

texts.es:
Gracias al trabajo de las miembros de este grupo, ya están en su cuarto ciclo. Ellas son de la ciudad de Curuguaty, una zona bastante alejada de la ciudad, que tiene poco acceso a los medios de comunicación y transporte. Ellas están trabajando también en su grupo para poder hacer crecer su barrio y su entorno.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Gabina, quien se dedica a la venta de comidas en forma ambulante. Cuenta que tiene una buena clientela que siempre compra los alimentos que hace, siempre tiene muy buena venta ya que todo lo que hace es muy rico. Gabina cuenta que quiere que su barrio crezca más, que haya más seguridad y que también pueda haber más medios para acceder hasta donde están.
Ella solicita de este crédito para la compra carnes, verduras, condimentos y demás insumos para poder seguir haciendo los alimentos que vende, ya que está mejorando mucho sus ventas.
texts.en:
Thanks to the work of the members of this group, they are now on their fourth loan cycle.  They are from the city of Curuguaty.  They live in an area which is quite a long way from the city and has little access to means of communication and transportation.  They are all working together as a group in order to improve their neighborhood and their environment.

One of the members of this group is Gabina, whose business is selling food as an itinerant street vendor.  She reports that she has very good customers who always buy the food she prepares.  She always makes very good sales because everything she prepares is absolutely delicious.  Gabina says that she would like her neighborhood to experience further improvements.  She would like for it to become safer and for there to be more means for accessing their area.

Gabina is requesting this loan to buy meat, vegetables, condiments and other supplies so that she can continue preparing the food that she sells as her sales are improving a lot.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, condiments and other supplies

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael resides in the Nkubu, Meru region of Eastern Kenya with his wife. He has four children, one of whom is still in school. He has been an active farmer for 20 years, growing bananas, maize, and beans, and producing milk from his dairy cattle.

He has approached Juhudi Kilimo for a loan of 30,000 KES to help him purchase irrigation equipment. This will provide a good water supply for his crops and thus produce a high yield. This will help him provide a better education for his child.

The major challenge that he faces is inadequate funds. He says that Juhudi has seen him through his farming activities.

loans.use: to purchase irrigation equipment

loans.name: Lola

texts.ru: Лола добрая и целеустремленная женщина. Ей 36 лет. Она разведена и не имеет детей. Лола более 3 года работает в городском управлении по бракам. Она порядочная женщина и выполняет свою работу отлично. Она живет вместе с 2 сестрами. Одна из ее сестры учится в университете и Лола должна оплатить за учебы сестры в университете. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2850 сомони для оплаты обучения сестры. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Lola is a kind and purposeful woman. She is 36 years old. She is divorced and has no children. Lola has been working in municipal government in the area of marriages for more than three years. She is a decent woman and does her job with excellence. 

She lives with her two sisters. One of her sisters is studying at university and Lola must pay for her sister's studies. She is requesting a loan of 2,850 somoni to pay for her sister's education.

loans.use: to pay for her sister's tuition

loans.name: Yurina Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por cuatros socios emprendedores una de ellas es Francis tiene 22 años de edad, casada,  con tres hijos de 2, 10, 2 años respectivamente tiene cinco años de vender mercadería en general como cosméticos de la Avon, ropa usada, ropa nueva etc., anteriormente era trabajadora de la zona franca y con su salario fue ahorrando para dedicarse a vender mercadería en general y eso le permite cuidar a sus niños en su casa, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de cosméticos de la Avon como crema para las manos, cremas para el cuerpo, crema facial, pantalones de varones y la compra de una vitrina de vidrio para acomodar sus cosméticos para una mejor presentación, Esthela tiene 47 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de ropa usada, María tiene 29 años de edad su negocio es una pulpería y venta de nacatamales, juan tiene una pulpería y servicio de taxi.
texts.en:
This group consists of four enterprising members.  One of them is a 22-year-old woman named Francis.  She is married and has three children (a 10-year-old and two two-year-olds).  Francis sells general merchandise such as Avon cosmetics, used clothing, new clothing, and other products.  She previously worked in the Free Trade Zone, but she saved up her salary so that she could sell general merchandise full-time.  This enables her to stay at home and look after her children.  Her loan will be invested in the purchase Avon cosmetics such as hand crèmes, body crèmes, and facial crèmes.  She will also buy men’s trousers and a glass display case for storing the cosmetics and presenting them better.  

The other members are as follows:
•	Estela is 47 years old and in the business of selling used clothing.
•	María is 29 years old.  She is in the grocery business and also sells Nicaraguan tamales.  
•	Juan manages a store and also provides taxi services.

loans.use: to buy hand crèmes, body crèmes, facial crèmes, men's trousers, and a glass display case.

loans.name: Mercedes Alexandra

texts.es:
La Señora Mercedes vive en Guayaquil, ella tiene 30 años de edad. Todo empezó cuando  decidió vender estos productos en batidos  con frutas, por su salud y por la salud. Poco a poco mejoro su negocio teniendo mas cliente ya que los productos naturales con frutas son muy rentables. 

Ella trabaja sola con sus productos, y su labor empieza por la mañana, ella vende productos OMNILIFE y tambien ropa, no tiene ninguna dificultad en su trabajo. Ella está casada, su esposo trabaja de operador de maquinas, tiene 2 hijos y ambos son menores de edad, y estudian en escuela fiscal.

Ella con el préstamo comprara ropa, productos OMNILIFE, frutas para la venta a sus clientes. Ella quiere para un futuro comprarse una casa, un carro, y que sus hijos estudien y aumentar las ventas de sus productos.
texts.en:
Mercedes lives in Guayaquil; she’s 30-years-old.  Everything started when she decided to sell these products in blended fruit drinks for her health and for health.  Gradually her business improved acquiring more customers because natural products with fruit are very profitable.

She works alone with her products and she starts work in the morning.  She sells Omnilife products and also clothes; she has no difficulties at work.  She’s married and her husband works as a machine operator.  She has two minor children attending public school.

She will use the loan to buy clothes, Omnilife products and fruit to sell to her customers.  She wants in future to buy a house and a car and that her children study and to increase sales of her products.

loans.use: to buy clothes, Omnilife products and fruit to sell.

loans.name: Christinah

texts.en:
Christinah is a 53-year-old, married woman. She and her husband are blessed with two children. The children are 16 and 18 years old.

To earn a living, she operates a retail shop. She has been in this business for three years. Her current monthly income from the business is approximately 26,600 KES.

She is seeking to borrow a loan in the amount of 60,000 KES, which she intends to make use of by buying more stocks of wheat flour, soft drinks, and washing detergents. She plans to reinvest any profits generated as a result of the loan back into the business. She successfully repaid her previous loans, and this would be her third loan.

loans.use: To expand and improve her retail busines by purchasing additional inventory (e.g., wheat flour, soft drinks, and washing detergents)

loans.name: Soifua

texts.en:
Soifua is a 23-year-old, married woman with two children.

To earn a living, she makes and sells pancakes in her community. She has two years of experience with this business.

Soifua is requesting a loan to buy additional ingredients and necessities, including sacks of sugar, flour, yeast, frying pans, and forks. She plans to use the profits she generates as a result of the loan to better support her family and to save for her business's future needs. Soifua became a member of SPBD this year.

loans.use: to expand and improve her business by purchasing additional ingredients and necessities (e.g., sugar, flour, yeast, frying pans, and forks)

loans.name: Surayo

texts.ru:
Сурайё  женщина в возрасте 45 лет.  Она вдова, к большому сожалению она потеряла  мужа несколько лет тому назад, и осталась одна с дочкой.  Ее дочка  учится  в ВУЗ-е.(студентка).  Сама Сурайе  работает в одной из столовой своего села. Ей очень трудно одной но она не унывает и старается делать все чтобы ее дочка не нуждалась не в чем.  Как говорит Сурайе "я живу ради своей дочки" .
Сурайе  зарабатывает  очень  мало. Но она  также  дома занимается откормом скота.  От этого бизнеса она получает хорошую прибыль.  
Сурайе давно хотела отремонтировать свой дом и особенно комнату своей дочери и с этой целю она обратилась в Арванд чтобы получить кредит.  На полученный кредит Сурайе планирует купить строительные материалы и обновить комнату дочери.
texts.en:
Surayo is a woman of 45 years. She is a widow; unfortunately, she lost her husband a few years ago and was left alone with her daughter. Her daughter goes to college. Surayo herself works in one of the dining rooms in her village. It is very difficult for her but she does not give up and is trying to do everything so that her daughter will not need for anything. As Surayo says, "I live for my daughter."

Surayo earns very little, but she is also engaged in fattening cattle at her home. She gets a good profit from this business. 

Surayo has long wanted to renovate the house and especially her daughter's room, and with this goal she turned to Arvand for a loan. Surayo plans to use the loan to buy construction materials and to update her daughter's bedroom.

loans.use: to buy building materials

loans.name: Noy's Group

texts.en:
Noy is 26 years old and married. She lives in a rural area located in the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She has two children, both of whom are dependent on her and still in school. Noy and her husband have been growing cassava and rice to earn a living for several years. The current business earns them about 19,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. She saves about 8,000 KHR per day. 

This is Noy's first loan with Kiva’s partner VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her cultivated land. She will also use a portion to spend on labor costs. Noy hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her rice and cassava crops in order to achieve a standard lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for materials needed in making mufflers.

loans.name: Kuña Joaju Group

texts.es:
Kuña Joaju es de la ciudad de Curuguaty, esta empezando a trabajar y asistiendo a las capacitaciones ya que están en su ciclo uno. Ellas son de una zona muy alejada y con poco accesos a fuente de comunicación. Todas ellas luchan por sacar adelante a su familia, y también por ayudar a su comunidad, para que poco a poco vayan creciendo.
Celiza, una de las integrantes, se dedica a la venta de remedios naturales tanto para tereré. Es un trabajo muy sacrificado ya que tiene que recorrer por las calles, pero con su esfuerzo ella es consciente que ayudará a su familia y pondrá un poco también por su comunidad.
Ella solicita este crédito para la compra de remedios naturales, con los cuales podrá seguir con sus ventas y ganando el ingreso para su familia. Celiza sueña con que su barrio vaya creciendo y mejorando, que sea más seguro y haya mas educación.
texts.en:
The “Kuña Joaju” group is from the city of Curuguaty and is starting work and attending training because they are in cycle #1.  All of them come from a very distant zone that’s poorly communicated.  They all struggle to move their families forward and also to help their community so that it can gradually grow.

Celiza, one of the members, sells natural remedies for ‘tereré’ [an herbal tea similar to mate].  It is very demanding work because she must wander through the streets but she’s aware that with her effort she’ll be able to help her family and also contribute a little to her community.

She’s requesting this loan to buy natural remedies to continue with her sales and earning income for her family.  Celiza dreams with her neighborhood’s growing and improving; that it’s safer and that there is more education.

loans.use: to buy natural remedies to sell.

loans.name: Halicha

texts.ru: Халича является женщиной  в возрасте 50 лет, замужем имеет 3 детей. Она занимается откормом крупно рогатого скота в течении 15 лет.  Халича имеет большой опыт в разведении скота, ее отец являлся пастухом в течении 25 лет в колхозе их деревне. В детстве Халича слушала рассказы своего отца про то как он ухаживал и пас на пастбищах скот. Почти все в кишлаке отдают пасти свой скот пастухам, Халича также доверяет пастуху свой скот, до вечера , а бывает и по несколько дней пастух уносит скот в горы на зеленные луга. Халича хочет размножить  скот, и тем самым увеличить свой капитал.   В этом году ее сын жениться и она должна достроить свой дом, она планирует после откорма продать скот и на полученную прибыль реализовать свои планы. Она очень надеется что Арванд поможет в реализации ее планов.
texts.en:
Halicha is a woman of 50, married, and with three children. She has been engaged with fattening livestock for 15 years. 

Halicha has extensive experience in livestock breeding; her father was a shepherd for 25 years on the collective farm in the village. As a child, Halicha heard stories from her father about how he mated and grazed the livestock in pastures. Almost everyone in the village gives the shepherd their livestock to graze. Halicha similarly trusts the shepherd with her livestock until the evening and sometimes the shepherd takes the livestock into the mountains to a green meadow for several days. 

Halicha wants to multiply her livestock and thus increase her capital. This year, her son will get married and she must finish building her home. She plans to sell her cattle after fattening them, and the profits will help to realize her plans. 

She hopes for Arvand's help in implementing her plans.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Petimani

texts.en:
Petimani is a 37-year-old, married woman, with six children. To earn a living, she has a small plantation and she grows taro, taamu, bananas, and yams. She has been doing this for three years. 

Petimani has requested a loan to purchase fertilizer, chemicals, bush knives, weed killer, axes, rakes, etc. She has been a member of South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) since 2012. With her profits, Petimani hopes to improve her plantation, support her family, and fund her children's education.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, chemicals, bush knives, weed killer, axes, rakes, etc. for her plantation.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El grupo Kuña Guapa está en su primer ciclo, ellas son de la ciudad de Curuguaty, una ciudad bastante alejada de Asunción, donde muchas de ellas se encuentran muy alejadas de la ciudad y con poco acceso a la comunicación.
Fátima, una de las miembros, cuenta que se dedica a las ventas, ya que tiene una pequeña despensa con la que surte a su vecinos y personas de otras zonas, es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora. Cuenta que su barrio ha ido mejorando, pero que aun le falta mucho por salir adelante y crecer, ya que esta muy alejado, es por eso que ellas y sus compañeras tambien hacen actividades para mejorar.
Fátima solicita de este crédito para la compra de carnes, verduras, leche, productos a granel y demás, con lo que podrá seguir dando buena variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The “Kuña Guapa” group is in its first cycle.  They are from the city of Curuguaty a city quite far from Asunción.  Many of them live far from the city and have few means of communication.

Fátima, one of the group members, relates that she’s in sales; she has a small grocery store that supplies her neighbors and people from other zones.  She’s a very hardworking, enterprising woman.  She relates that her neighborhood has been improving but it still needs much more to get ahead and grow since it’s very far away.  This is why she and her fellow members do activities in order to improve.

Fátima requests this loan to buy meat, vegetables, milk, bulk products, etc. so she can continue providing good variety to her customers.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, milk, bulk products, etc.

loans.name: Rosario Elizabeth

texts.es:
Rosario Elizabeth es una joven emprendedora regiomontana de 26 años, nacida en la ciudad de Monterrey, Méx.; es la mas chica de 3 hermanos del matrimonio formado por doña Maria del Rosario (mamá) y el Sr. Juan (papá). Con mucho esfuerzo de sus padres, realizó sus estudios primarios en la escuela de la misma colonia donde vive y  sus estudios técnicos los hizo en la Secundaria Tecnica # 60.  En esa etapa le nació el interes de ser una gran Estilista, por lo que decició ingresar en el Instituto de Belleza Rivera en el centro de esta ciudad, preparándose durante 2 años para culminar sus estudios. Posteriormente prestó sus servicios en la Estetika Stilo (cadena de estéticas) en donde estuvo cerca de una año. 

Una tia muy cercana a ella,  la Tia Esperanza, la animó a poner su propio negocio en su domicilio, iniciando con muy poco mobiliario, una silla, un espejo pequeño y un juego de tijeras y empezó a dar el servicio de corte de cabello en su colonia. Actualmente cuenta con una gran clientela, por lo que decidió solicitar un crédito para adquirir más mobiliario para dar un mayor servicio e incrementar sus ganancias y seguir creciendo como microempresaria, ademas de seguir ayudando a sus padres. Su mayor ilusión es tener sus propios locales y establecer varias sucursales.
texts.en:
Rosario Elizabeth is a 26 year-old entrepreneur from Monterrey, Mexico. Born in the city of Monterrey, she is the youngest of three children born of the marriage between Maria del Rosario (her mother) and Juan (her father).

With much encouragement and support from her parents, she completed her primary studies at the school in her neighbourhood. She completed high school at the Polytechnic # 60. During high school she became interested in becoming a great stylist and she decided to enrol in the Rivera Institute of Beauty located in the city centre. There she trained for two years in order to complete her studies. Later she offered her services at Estetika Stilo (a chain of beauty salons) where she worked for nearly a year. 

Her aunt Esperanza, with whom she is very close, encouraged her to start her own business at home. Beginning with very little furniture - a chair, a small mirror, and a pair of scissors - she began to offer haircuts in her neighbourhood. 

At the moment, she has a large clientele, which is why she has decided to request a loan to acquire more furniture. This will enable her to offer better service, to increase profits and to continue growing as a small business, as well as to continue helping her parents. Her dream is to have her own premises and to establish several branches.

loans.use: to buy furniture for her business.

loans.name: Pes' Group

texts.en: Pes was born 45 years ago in the Dambae district of Kampong Cham Province. She is married and the mother of nine children, seven of whom are still in school. She and her husband are farmers and have been in this line of work for 25 years. Their farm is the family's main source of income, but Pes also works for others for a fee. From her work, she is able to earn about KHR 13,000 per day. Pes has taken out two previous loans from VisionFund and repaid both after using them to improve her family's standard of living. She is now confidently leading a four-person loan group which is requesting a new loan. She will use her portion of it to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland. She goal is to raise a good cash crop so that she can earn a larger profit and keep her children in school until graduation.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Phal's Group

texts.en:
Phal is 33 years old and has four children, two of whom attend school. She is a villager from a rural area located in the Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia, where rice farming is the main source of the family’s income. She supplements her income by raising pigs. Phal has been in this business for 10 years. She earns approximately 38,000 KHR a day and saves about 20,000 KHR a day. 

Phal is leading her group to request a loan.from VisionFund.  She will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and piglets to raise. She hopes this loan will help her to increase her family's income so as to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Malaeniu

texts.en: Malaeniu is 35 years old and married. She farms a small plot of land where she grows cabbage, cucumbers, beans and pumpkins to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years and is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer, chemicals, bush knives, weed killer, axes, rakes and other items. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. With her profits, Malaeniu hopes to improve her farm, better support her family and pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to pay for chemicals, bush knives, weed killer, axes, rakes and other items.

loans.name: Arístides

texts.es:
Arístides tiene 62 años de edad, esta acompañado y tiene cinco hijos; pero solo uno vive con él y tres nietos.

Él nació en una hacienda, ya que sus padres ahí Vivian, desde entonces a trabajo en corrales, cañales, algodoneras y cultivos tradicionales de maíz y sorgo; actividades que realiza por tradición familiar. Los insumos agrícolas, los compra en la ciudad para llegar ahí camina un kilómetro y medio a pie o en bicicleta, luego aborda un autobús durante unos treinta kilómetros. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para preparar 3,500 metros cuadrados de terreno para sembrar pipían. Él posee un motor de riego y tuberías de dos pulgadas, de tal manera que lo utilizara para regar la pipianera este cultivo es rentable en época de verano, se vende a buen precio. Con esta inversión espera, generar un poco de solvencia económica; ya que el cultivo de maíz que ha venido produciendo no le ha generado ingresos solo ha sido para consumo de la familia. En  un futuro, desea mejorar su casa ya que es de bahareque; también desea incrementar el área de cultivo, comprar un sistema de riego con mayor capacidad y trabajar durante todo el año con sus hijos.
texts.en:
Aristides, 62, has a spouse and five children but only one and three grand-children live with him.  He was born on a country estate since that’s where his parents lived and since then he’s worked in the corrals, in the sugarcane fields, on cotton plantations and growing traditional crops like corn and sorghum; these are activities he does as family tradition.  He buys his farm supplies in the city and to get there he covers a kilometer on foot or by bicycle and then rides a bus for about 30 kilometers.

The loan he’s asking Fundación Campo for is to prepare 3,500 square meters of land to plant pumpkins.  He owns an irrigation pump and two-inch tubing that he’ll use to water the pumpkin fields.  This is a profitable summer crop that sells at a good price.  He hopes with this investment to gradually attain economic solvency since his corn crops haven’t been generating income; they have been just for family consumption.  In future, he’d like to make home improvements since it’s currently made from mud and reeds.  He’d also like to increase his cultivated square footage and to buy a larger-capacity irrigation system and to work year-round with his children.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Lucio

texts.es:
Lucio tiene 68 años de edad, esta casado y tiene dos hijos. Él es agricultor desde muy pequeño, fue su padre quien le enseño. Los insumos agrícolas los compra en el pueblo más cercano que esta a once kilómetros de su casa, eso le dificulta un poco trasladar los insumos. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar una maya metálica para asegurar la vivienda, moler sácate para alimentar dos vacas que posee, comprara 10 quintales de concentrado para la época seca y al comprar por mayor le dan mejor precio. Su deseo es mejorar cada día, brindar seguridad a su familia y también vender productos agropecuarios como maíz, frijol, leche y queso para recibir mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Lucio, 68, is married and has two children.  He’s been a farmer since he was very little; his father taught him.  He buys his farm supplies in the nearest town which is 11 kilometers from home; this makes transporting the supplies a bit difficult.

The loan he’s requesting from Fundación Campo is to buy cyclone metal fencing mesh to secure his home, to mulch grass to feed the two cows he owns and to buy ten quintals of feed concentrate for the dry season since buying at wholesale means a better price.  His wish is to improve more every day, to provide security for his family and also to sell agricultural products like corn, beans, milk and cheese in order to earn improved income.

loans.use: to buy cyclone fencing, to mulch grass for cattle feed and to buy 10 quintals of feed concentrate fore the dry season.

loans.name: Mariela Del Carmen

texts.es: Maricela es una mujer emprendedora tiene 29 años de edad, casada con tres hijos de 2,3 y 13 años de edad respectivamente. Desde hace 10 años es propietaria de una pulpería, Cybert café vende ropa nueva y cosméticos de la Avon, Vogue. Tiene de ser cliente con la institución 10 años consecutivos demostrando responsabilidad y puntualidad en sus pagos. Su esposo le ayuda en el negocio en la administración del Cyber, con el crédito anterior logro comprar dos computadores, una fotocopia además e invirtió más productos en su pulpería. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de granos como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, carne de res, carne de pollo, sal, medicamentos populares, y realizara mejoras en su vivienda para ubicar la pulpería en mejores condiciones como materiales de construcción cemento, arena, bloques, piedrín, hierro etc.
texts.en:
Maricela is an enterprising woman. She is 29 years old, married, and has three children who are two, three, and thirteen years old, respectively. She has been the owner of a grocery store and Internet cafe for ten years. She also sells new clothing and Avon and Vogue cosmetics. She has been a client of our institution for ten consecutive years and has shown responsibility and timeliness in her payments. 

Her husband helps her manage her Internet cafe business. With the previous loan she was able to purchase two computers and a copy machine, and also invested in more products for her grocery store. She will invest this loan in purchasing grains like rice and beans, sugar, oil, beef, chicken, salt, and commonly used medications. She will also make home improvements in order to have a better business location for her grocery store. She will buy construction materials like cement, sand, blocks, gravel, iron, etc.

loans.use: to buy grains like rice and beans, sugar, oil, beef, chicken, salt, and popular medications, as well as renovate her grocery store.

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita previously took out a 17,000 PHP loan to buy larger quantities and varieties of grocery items and products for her store. The additional earnings she made helped her pay for her children’s education and meet her personal, household and business expenditures. She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan to buy more of these items to display in her store because more items means higher profit. This will help her meet her family’s daily needs and pay for her children’s education. Estelita hopes that her business will run smoothly and her family will live in good health. She meets up weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and draw strength and inspiration from her religion. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study religion, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for groceries, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Kon's Group

texts.en:
Kon is a 52-year-old resident from the Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham province. She is married and has seven children. She is a rice farmer. Kon has been in this business for 30 years and is able to earn about 38,000 KHR per day. She saves about 20,000 KHR each day after daily expenses.  

Kon’s group consists of four members who are just with VisionFund this cycle. Now she is leading her group of four to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy rice seeds and fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to get a high crop yield from her current business.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds and fertilizer

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Ushangi

texts.en:
Ushangi is 21 years old. He lives in the Zestafoni district with his mother and sister. Ushangi has requested a loan from local financial institutions several times to start a family business, but he has had no success. His loan request was rejected each time, because of low income and his family’s poor living conditions.
 
The main source of the family's income is from agricultural activities. In particular, they have a vineyard and a plot of land where maize is grown. With the harvested grapes they make wine. The sell the wine and the maize locally at the markets. The family's total income is rarely enough to cover their monthly expenses. 

Ushangi requested a loan from Credo to start a family business. His loan request was approved under a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides credit with "soft" conditions for a business start-up or re-startup to the country's rural poor who do not have access to credit products. Generally, these customers are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With the loan Ushangi will renovate commercial space that he owns. He wants to start selling cars. He will purchase from Europe at a low cost and sell at a marked-up price in Georgia. For this business he needs an office to work from. After the office is renovated Ushangi will be able to start working and making a profit to bring additional income to the family. He will reinvest part of the profit in his business. The increased income will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: To renovate commercial space

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for chemicals, bush knives, weed killer, axes, rakes and other items.

loans.name: Santa Martha Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres socias emprendedoras originarias de la cuna del folklor nicaragüense una de ellas es Jazmina mujer de 33 años, acompañada, con cuatro hijos menores de edad, desde hace 20 años que se dedica a vender ojuelas ambulantes en parques, mercados, a su localidad y tiene 6 años de ser cliente de la institución por ser responsable y cumplidoras en sus pagos, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de materia prima como harina, aceite, leñas, bolsa,papel de envolver, plásticos transparentes, azúcar, canela etc, Maria tiene 34 años de edad y vende ojuelas y Lidia tiene 38 años de edad y vende artesanía textil osea guayaberas, cotonas, delantales, trajes típicos etc.
texts.en:
This group is formed by three enterprising women born in the cradle of Nicaraguan folklore. One of them is Jazmina, a 33 year-old woman who has four young children. For the past 20 years she has earned a living selling a pastry called "hojuelas" in parks and markets in her city. 

She has been a client of the institution for 6 years now because she has been responsible and reliable in her payments. She will use the loan to purchase raw material like flour, oil, firewood, bags, wrapping paper, plastic cups, sugar, cinnamon etc. 

Maria is 34 years of age and sells "hojuelas". Lydia is 38 years old and sells textile handicrafts such as men's shirts, woven cotton shirts, aprons, and traditional clothing etc.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials such as flour, oil, firewood, bags, wrapping paper, plastic cups, sugar, cinnamon etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a water tank and irrigation pipes

loans.name: Abdusalom

texts.ru: Абдусалому 35 лет. Он энергичный и умный бизнесмен. Он всегда стремится к новшеству и 3 года назад он начал свой бизнес, производством напитков, как напиток шиповника, яблоки и других фруктов. Он собственник бизнеса и справляется с бизнесом сам. Он имеет свой производительный цех и рабочих, которые работают в основе договора и ежемесячно получают зарплату вовремя. Его работники знают его как честного человека, а другие бизнесмены как сильного соперника. Его любимая жена работает поваром в кафе, а дети еще не трудоспособные. Им 13, 7 и 2 года. Дети ходят в среднюю школу и в детский сад. Абдусалом планирует развевать бизнес, а для этого он должен купить новое оборудование для производства напитков. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 долларов США для покупки оборудования. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Abdusalom is 35 years old. He is an energetic and smart businessman who always aims to innovate. Three years ago, he started his own business producing beverages made from rose hip, apples, and other fruit. He owns the business and runs it by himself. He has a production plant where his employees work on a contract basis and always receive their monthly salaries on time. His workers know him to be an honest man, and other businessmen consider him a strong competitor. His beloved wife works as a cook in cafe. Their 3 young children, who are 13, 7, and 2 years old, attend school and daycare. Abdusalom plans to develop his business, but in order to do so, he needs to purchase new equipment for beverage production. He is seeking a loan of 3,000 US dollars for that purpose. He is waiting for your kindness.

loans.use: To buy equipment for the production of more juice

loans.name: Maria Concepcion

texts.es: María es una microempresaria emprendedora tiene 36 años de edad, acompañada tiene tres hijos uno 2, 18 y 19 años respectivamente. Lleva 4 años de ser cliente de la institución, su negocio es la venta de tortilla y una pulpería en su domicilio donde una de los hijos mayores le ayudan en la administración del negocio con el crédito anterior logro comprar tres vitrinas, un frezer, dos televisores para poner alquiler de videos juegos, el crédito lo  invertirá en la compra de una activo fijo como es una mantenedora compra de granos básicos como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, carne de res, carne de pollo, medicamentos populares, sal etc.
texts.en:
Maria is an enterprising small-business owner. She is 36 years of age and has three children aged 2, 18 and 19 respectively. She has been a client of the institution for four years now. 

She sells tortillas and runs a convenience store in her home. One of her older children helps in the administration of the business. 

With her previous loan she bought three display cabinets, a freezer, and two television sets to use to rent out videos games. 

She will use this loan to purchase a fixed asset such as a cool-storage unit, and to buy basic grains like rice, beans, sugar, oil, beef, chicken, popular medicines, salt etc.

loans.use: to purchase a fixed asset such as a cool-storage unit, as well as to buy grains like rice, beans, sugar, oil, beef, chicken, popular medicines, salt etc.

loans.name: Juhudi Group

texts.en:
Mwanahawa, who is in her early 40s, is single, with three children, of whom only one goes to school. The other two children are still small. Mwanahawa has been a food vendor for five years now. She works from 5.00 am to 5.00 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This will be Mwanahawa's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to buy more chairs, increase her food stock, and improve upon her selling place by repairing the floor. She has successfully paid back her loan. She used the profit to cover household expenses and school fees. 

Mwanahawa will use this loan to buy a deep freezer to help sell more cold drinks. Her dream is to one day be able to own a big restaurant.

Mwanahawa will share this loan with her loan group, 'Juhudi Group,' with 15 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy a deep freezer to help sell more cold drinks.

loans.name: Valentin

texts.en: Valentin is 50 years old and married with five children. He lives in Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. He owns and operates a retail business which is a hypo business (stain remover) in the local community to earn a living. He has been in his business for over five years and earns 8,000 PHP every month. He  joined GDMPC in the year 2007, and now he has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional gallon vessels. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase additional gallon vessels

loans.name: Nareth

texts.en:
Nareth is 37 years old. married, and has three children, who attend school. She lives in a rural area located in the Tbaung Khmum district of Cambodia, To make a living and take care of her children, she and her husband are farmers, which they have been doing for 17 years. They supplement their family’s income by working for others for a fee.

Nareth is requesting her first loan from VisionFund, which she will use to buy a motorbike for her family to use.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her family to use.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 22 years old, not married, but she supports three people in her family. She has been in business for the last three years, with monthly income of KES 20,000. Mary was happy with her first loan, which boosted her business. 

She is taking her second loan from Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) in the amount of KES 30,000, which she will use to purchase more stocks of maize flour, soft drinks, and crates of milk for sale in her shop.

Her anticipation is to open another business, apart from the shop she has. Her hope and dream for her future business is to buy herself a plot.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of maize flour, soft drinks, and crates of milk to sell.

loans.name: Camino Del Desierto Group

texts.es: Este grupo esta formado por  cuatros socias emprendedoras una de ellas es Ligia mujer de 35 años de edad, acompañada con dos hijos, desde hace dos años su negocio es la venta de comida y venta de cosméticos de la Avon, quien vende en su casa la comida y los cosméticos de la Avon por encargos a clientes, vecinos y amigos de su  localidad, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de materia prima como arroz, frijoles,azúcar, aceite, carne de res, carne de pollo, verduras, platanos, perecederos, leñas, cosméticos como cremas faciales, cremas para las manos , perfumen de varon, perfume de dama, alineadores, pinturas de uñas, pinturas de labios etc. Lizeth tiene 25 años y su negocio es de venta de cosméticos de la Avon, Brenda tiene 28 años de edad y tiene un pequeño taller de zapaterías, y Veronica mujer de 30 años su negocio es compra y venta de calzados.
texts.en:
This group is made up of four enterprising members. One of them is Ligia, a 35-year-old woman who is in a common-law marriage and has two children. For the last two years, she has been in the business of selling food and Avon cosmetics. She sells the food in her house and the Avon cosmetics through orders placed by customers, neighbors, and friends in her area. 

Ligia will invest the loan in the purchase of ingredients and supplies like rice, beans, sugar, oil, beef, chicken, vegetables, plantains, perishables, and firewood, as well as cosmetics like face creams, hand creams, men's cologne, women's perfume, eyeliners, nail polish, lipstick, etc.

Lizeth is 25 years old and her business is selling Avon cosmetics, Brenda is 28 years old and has a small shoe workshop, and Veronica is a 30-year-old woman who buys and sells footwear.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of ingredients and supplies like rice, beans, sugar, oil, beef, chicken, vegetables, plantains, perishables, firewood, along with Avon cosmetics like face cream, hand cream,  men's cologne, women's perfume, eyeliners, nail polish, lipstick, etc.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen works hard to support her family. Helen is widowed and has a restaurant business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her business.

Helen has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Helen would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy used clothes for her thread-making business.

loans.name: Somach's Group

texts.en:
Somach, 25, lives in one of the remote areas of the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province. She has two children who are too young for school. 

To support this family, Somach and her husband have been growing cassava on one hectare of farmland as their main source of income. To better feed the family, Somach also sells grocery items in her village. She has been with both businesses for five years, and she is able to save only KHR 13,000 per day. 

This is the second loan for Somach. She has used her first loan successfully in improving her living condition. She is now leading her group to ask for a loan of 1,200,000 KHR each. 

As the leader, Somach is going to use her portion to buy pesticides for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on labor fees. She hopes to grow more cassava to earn more income for her family, so as to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.ru:
Гулчехра очень спокойный и открытый человек. Её опыт работы сказывается на её лице – добрый  и приятный. Ведь она учитель – гид в мире знаний. У Гулчехры двадцати  трехлетний стаж работы в сфере преподавания. За эти годы она воспитала много учеников, которые смогли стать гордостью своих родителей и выражают  благодарность своей учительнице – Гулчехре. Наряду со своими учениками Гулчехра воспитала и вырастила своих четыре детей, которые на сегодняшний день двое из них учатся в школе, один учиться в ВУЗ-е, а дочка создала свою семью. Гулчехре с мужем как любящие, заботливые и ответственные родители небезразлично будущее детей. И Она как никто знает и понимает, что для реализации своих планов им необходимо определённые денежные средства.  Отсюда же она бережно относится к семейному бюджету и делает заначки. У неё всё строго «по расписанию», так как одной зарплатой учителя тяжело поставить на ноги четверых детей и обеспечит себе хорошую старость. Но, как и любая женщина Гулчехра хочет надеть красивые платья, иметь свою шкатулку с ювелирными изделиями…
Приближается «последний звонок» и Гулчехра решила купить себе ювелирные изделия и этим наградить, или же отблагодарить себя за проделанный очередной годовой труд. Но не имея нужную сумму денег на руках, Гулчехра решила воспользоваться услугами ООО МДО «Арванд»  и приобрести кредит. Она надеться, что Арванд доверятся ей и предоставят необходимую сумму денег. Заранее благодарить за поддержку и за кусочек женской радости от приобретения желаемого.  Гулчехра ещё одно доказательство того, что женщина – хранитель очага, важное и особенное часть общество, которое имеет право быть счастливой несмотря ни на что.
texts.en: Gulchehra is a very patient and open-minded person. Her work experience shows on her kind and pleasant face, for she is a teacher, a guide to the world of knowledge. She has worked in this field for 23 years. In all this time, she has taught many students who have become a source of pride for their parents and who express gratitude to their teacher, Gulchehra. She has brought up 4 children of her own, 2 of whom are currently in school, 1 who is doing post-secondary studies, and a daughter who has started her own family. As she and her husband are caring and responsible parents, they are taking an active interest in their children's futures. She is well aware that in order to realise their plans, they need a certain amount of financial resources. With this in mind, she is very careful with the family budget and is saving a nest egg. She strictly controls spending because it is very difficult to bring up 4 children and provide for her own old age on only a teacher's salary. But, like all women, Gulchehra likes to wear beautiful dresses and have a jewelry box full of beautiful things. The end of the school year is approaching and she has decided to buy herself some jewelry as a reward to thank herself for the successful completion of another year of work. However, she does not have enough cash on hand, so she has decided to take advantage of the loan services of MDO Arvand. She hopes Arvand will trust her and lend her the funds that she needs. She extends her gratitude in advance for the support and for the piece of feminine happiness that comes from obtaining a desire. Gulchehra is proof that women are keepers of home and hearth, important and special members of society, who deserve to be happy no matter what.

loans.use: to buy jewelry

loans.name: Nang's Group

texts.en:
Nang, 31, is living in a rural village of the Tbaung Khmum district of Kamong Cham Province. She has three children, all of whom are dependent on her and still in school. Nang has been farming rice and growing cassava  for 11 years on two hectares of farmland as her main sources of income. She is able to earn about 14,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Nang’s group consists of two members who have been with VisionFund for two cycles. Now she is leading her group to ask for another loan. Nang wants to use her portion to spend on plowing the field and a portion of it to spend on labor fees. She hopes to earn more income from her current businesses so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To spend on plowing the field

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Ang's Group

texts.en:
Ang, age 43, lives in a wooden house in a village in the Tbaung Khmum District, and she is married. She is the mother of five children, one of whom is still in school. Rice farming and cassava planting are the sources of income for her family, which Ang and her husband have been doing for 23 years to make a living. Her family’s daily income is about 17,000 KHR but she manages to save about 7,000 KHR each day after daily expenses.

Ang has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for two loan cycles, and she completely paid back those loans. After the loans, she feels confident that she will make her life better. She is now leading her group to apply for a loan. She is going to use her portion to cover the rental fees of her farmland. 

She hopes to make a better living and to keep her children in school.

loans.use: To cover the rental fees of her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is an old client of Ugafode, married to Mr Phillipo and both residing at Cell 5, Ntungamo District. Harriet deals in supplying firewood to her customers and to schools in particular. However, she faces some challenges, i.e., the place where she collects firewood is far from her marketplace where she works. She therefore needs the loan to buy three bicycles to help collecting firewood. She also wants to diversify and expand by adding charcoal to the business because of low sales of firewood during holidays and the rainy season. 

The client has approached Ugafode again for their services and thanks the institution for being a solution provider. In the photo is the client and the Ugafode credit officer (right to left)

loans.use: To buy three bicycles

loans.name: Mano Amiga Group

texts.es: Socias emprendedoras de éxito esta formado tres socias una de ellas es Mariela es una mujer que tiene 37 años edad, acompañada con dos hijos su negocio es tener una pulpería en su domicilio por mas de cuatro años, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de granos como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, carne de res, carne de pollo, productos lácteos, jabon de baños, jabon de lavar ropa, huevos, pan, medicamentos populares, sal, Ace etc. Amparo tiene 69 años de edad y su negocio venta de ropa y Anielka tiene 27 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de ropa nueva.
texts.en:
This communal bank is formed by three successful and enterprising members. One of them, Mariela, is 37 years old, she has a partner and 2 children living with her. She has had a small grocery store operated from her home for four years. She will use the loan to purchase staple foods such as rice, kidney beans, sugar, oil, beef, chicken, dairy products, eggs, bread, bath soap, laundry soap, salt, etc.
The other members of the communal bank are Amparo, aged 69, who sells clothing and Anielka, 27 years old, who sells new clothes.

loans.use: to purchase staple foods such as rice, beans, sugar, beef, etc.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is taking out another Kiva loan of 20,000 KES. She is requesting a loan so that she can invest in the purchase of jeans, clothes for men and women, and uniforms for elementary and high school students. She gives thanks to Yehu Microfinance Trust and Kiva lenders for the opportunity to access loans.

loans.use: to purchase jeans, uniforms and clothes for men and women.

loans.name: Gonzalo Martinez Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres socias emprendedoras una de ellas es Yessenia mujer de 30 años de edad, soltera desde hace 20 años hace y vende cosa de horno, viejitas, rosquillas las vende en su domicilio y ambulante, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de maíz, maseca, leñas, queso, sal, etc. Juana tiene 51 años de edad y su negocio tiene un taller de bordado y Maria tiene 43 años y su negocio es hacer y vender yoltamal, güirilas, rosquillas etc.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three enterprising members. One of them is Yessenia, a single 30-year-old woman. For twenty years, she has made and sold baked goods like viejitas and rosquillas [savory treats made with corn and cheese], which she sells both at home and on the street. She will invest the loan in the purchase of corn, corn flour, firewood, cheese, salt, etc. 

Juana is 51 years old and her business is an embroidery workshop. Marta is 43 years old, and her business is making and selling yoltamal [a tamale made with fresh corn], güirilas [toasted corn patties], rosquillas, etc.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of corn, cheese, firewood, corn flour, salt, etc.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
La señora Gladys tiene 55 años, es viuda desde hace poco tiempo, tiene hijos, pero quienes ya son todos mayores e independientes. Gladys, gracias a su esfuerzo y al de su difunto marido pudo criar a sus hijos y hacer de ellos personas de bien.
Ella es modista y tiene una Boutique con prendas exclusivas en un circuito comercial de la ciudad de Encarnación, se dedica a este trabajo hace más de veinte años. Tiene su local propio y tiene  mucha clientela de la zona y de la ciudad de Posadas ya que es muy conocida. Además la señora posee una jubilación de la Argentina ya que estuvo varios años trabajando allá.  Gracias a esta actividad ella ha podido salir adelante, mantener su hogar y solventar cualquier gasto imprevisto.
Gladys solicita de este crédito para invertirlo en el reacondicionamiento de su local, ya que quiere mejorar su salón para poder dar un mejor aspecto a su negocio y que sus clientes se sientan cómodos. Agradece a la fundación y a Kiva por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo.
texts.en:
Sra. Gladys, age 55, has been widowed for just a short time. She has children, but all of them are grown and independent. Thanks to their efforts, Gladys and her late husband were able to raise their children and help them become good people.

She is a designer and has a boutique where she sells exclusive clothing at a shopping center in the city of Encarnación. Gladys has been in this line of work for more than 20 years. Since she has her own shop, she has many customers in the area and from the city of Posadas where she is well-known. In addition, Sra. Gladys receives a retirement pension from Argentina since she had worked there for many years. Thanks to her business, she is able to move forward, maintain her home, and pay for any unforeseen expenses.

Gladys is requesting a loan so that she can invest in the remodeling of her shop. She wants to improve the main area of her shop because providing a better look for her business will make her customers feel comfortable. She is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for the opportunity that has been given to her.

loans.use: to remodel her boutique.

loans.name: Paulita

texts.en:
Paulita is a 52-year-old married woman with four children. She has a small plantation, and she grows taro, taamu (giant taro), bananas and yams to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. 

Paulita has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers, chemicals, bush knives, weed killer, axes, rakes, etc. She has been a member of SBPD since 2012. With her profits, Paulita hopes to improve her plantation and support her family, as well as her children's education.

loans.use: to pay for chemicals, bush knives, weed killer, axes, rakes, etc.

loans.name: San's Group

texts.en:
San is aged 31 years old and married. She is a mother of two children who are still in school. To make a living, she and her husband have been farming rice, etc. Having been in this business for 9 years, she is able to earn about 25,000 KHR per day and manages to save about 7,000 KHR each day after offsetting daily expenses. 

San’s group consists of three female members who live in the same village of Tbaung Khmum district of Battmbang province. She is a second-cycle client with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now leading her group to apply for a loan, San will use her portion to rent more plots of farmland for her farming business. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her crop yield so as to make a living better.

loans.use: To rent more plots of farmland for her farming business

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of six children, Luciana works hard to support her family. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from her general store.  Luciana is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase a new fish box and fish for her fish vending business.

Luciana has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a new fish box and fish for her business

loans.name: Adriano

texts.en:
