Adriano is a 63-year-old farmer from Ubay, Bohol. He has been in the rice farming business for more than 30 years now. This is the source of his income.

 Adriano is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this loan, Adriano will be able to improve his farm and its harvest. In the future, Adriano has hopes of making his business a success and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy seasonal fruits for her husband to sell.

loans.name: Roger

texts.en:
Roger is 39 years old and married with one child. He lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental in the Philippines. He owns and operates a retail business in the local community to earn a living. He has been in this business for over five years and earns 15,000 PHP every month. 

He joined GDMPC this year and now he has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP  to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods, sugar, coffee, eggs and dried fish.  He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods, sugar, coffee, eggs and dried fish.

loans.name: Vamalasi

texts.en:
Vamalasi is a 37-year-old, married woman with two children. She has a small plantation in which she grows cabbage, cucumbers, pumpkins and laupele to earn a living.  She has been working in her plantation for three years. 

Vamalasi has requested a loan to use purchase fertilizers, chemicals, bush knives, weed killer, axes and rakes.  She has been a member of SBPD since 2012. With her profits, Vamalasi hopes to improve her plantation, support her family and pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to pay for chemicals, bush knives, weed killer, axes and rakes to improve her plantation.

loans.name: Anatalia

texts.en:
Anatalia runs a sari-sari or variety store business, selling various goods and items to the people in her place in Alicia, Bohol. Anatalia is also engaged in a food-vending business, selling home-cooked foods. She works hard to earn a living, so that she can help her husband in meeting their family needs.

Anatalia is asking for a loan to buy more groceries to sell, like canned goods, noodles, candies, seasonings, and cooking ingredients, like meat and vegetables. With this loan, Anatalia believes that she can improve her business and her earnings.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell, like canned goods, noodles, candies, seasonings, and cooking ingredients, like meat and vegetables.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes lives in West Point, one of the most populous and best-known markets in Montserrado county. She is 35 years old and has two children aged 12 and 21 years old. For the past three years she has been running a shop where she sells soft drinks in the local market. One of the problems she faces is that the prices are too high.  She enjoys the interaction with her customers and the profit she makes daily gives her  money for her expenses and that makes her proud of her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more soft drinks for her business, her dream is to become a big businesswoman  and  build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks for her business

loans.name: Hawa M.

texts.en:
Hawa is 26 years old and lives in West Point, a very crowded community that is well-known in Montserrado County. She is married with three children with ages ranging from 3 months to 10 years old. She is living together with her husband and kids at home. Two of the children are in school while the other is still a baby. Her husband is a potential businessman who assists her with some business etiquette.

Hawa sells soap around and in the local market every day. The business has been on-going for the past two years. She obtained this business by selling cold water. Since then, she has not encountered any problem from her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more soap in order to expand her sales. She even has thought of building her dream house.

loans.use: to purchase more soap in order to expand her sales.

loans.name: Douglas

texts.en:
Douglas lives in Nkubu, in the Meru region of Eastern Kenya. He is married and has three children. He has been in farming for over fifteen years, growing cash crops. He operates a retail business as an extra source of income.

Douglas approached Juhudi Kilimo for a loan of KES 40,000 in order to purchase irrigation equipment. This will help him in providing water efficiently for his crops and livestock for better production. He wants to be the leading farmer in the entire country.

His main challenges are lack of capital and poor markets.

loans.use: to buy irrigation equipment.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 33 years old and single. He has a retail shop business in Makueni town. He has been in this business for the last one year, and it has been profitable.

This will be his first loan with KADET LTD., and he plans to use the amount to buy more stock of goods to sell. These goods include both maize and wheat flour, sugar, rice, cooking fat and detergents. He anticipates to make more income with which he will buy more goods to sell.

Samuel hopes to grow his business and later open a wholesale business.

loans.use: To buy more stock for sale, including maize and wheat flour, sugar, rice, cooking fat and detergents.

loans.name: Japhet

texts.en:
Japhet lives in Chogoria, in the Meru region of Eastern Kenya. He is 44 years of age and married with three children, two of whom are in school. He has been a mixed farmer for over twenty years, growing horticultural crops.

Japhet has requested a loan from Juhudi Kilimo of KES 40,000 for the purchase of poultry. He wants to have over five thousand poultry birds, both layers and broilers. This will help improve the family's living standards by providing better education for his children.

The major challenges Japhet faces are animal diseases and insufficient funds. He said that he likes Juhudi Kilimo for their quick processing of loans.

loans.use: to buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Eleie

texts.en:
Eleie is 39 years old and lives in the West Point community, which is well known and populated in Montserrado County. She is single, with two children ages 14 and 17. Both of them are in school and live at home. 

Eleie is not educated, but a very good business manager. Moreover, she has been selling water and soft drinks for the past five years without encountering major problems. The business emerged from the monthly earnings of her children's father. 

She is requesting a loan to buy more cold water and soft drinks for her business. Her plan is to build her dream house.

loans.use: to buy more cold water and soft drinks for her business.

loans.name: Fatu

texts.en:
Fatu is 31 years old and lives in the West Point community, which is a populated area in Montserrado County. She is living together with her husband and children. She has three children, with ages 3 years to 9 years old, and who are attending school.

Fatu is not educated, but sells oil, rice, pepper, etc., which she manages well. These goods have been sold for the past five years without encountering any problem. Her mother assisted her with some funds, which she used to start her business. She is asking for a loan to increase her stock for her business.

loans.use: to increase her stock for her business.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa is a 28-year-old married woman with two children. To earn a living, she has a small plantation in which she grows taro, tamu, bananas, and yams. She has been doing this for three years. 

Luisa has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers, chemicals, bush knives, weed killer, axes, rakes etc. She has been a member of SBPD since 2012. With her profits, Luisa hopes to improve her plantation and support her family and her children's education.

loans.use: to pay for chemicals, bush knives,weed killers, axes, rakes etc.

loans.name: Resma

texts.en: Resma is 39 years old and married with three children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns farmland, planting and harvesting rice for sale in the local community to earn a living. She has been in her business for over five years and earns 10,000 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in the year 2009, and now she has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is a widow, with three school-going children, and she works hard to ensure that her children are well-supplied with the basics. Her greatest challenge is providing food and school fees for her children. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. 

Juliet does a business of buying detergents to make soap and now she is requesting a loan of KES 10,000 to buy the chemicals and the detergents for her to make the soaps and sell them to gain profit, which will enable her to support her family.

loans.use: to buy the chemicals and the detergents for her to make soaps.

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en: Emelita is 50 years old, married with five children. She lives in Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a copra production in the local community to earn a living. She has been in her business for over five years and earns 15,000 PHP every month. She joined in GDMPC in the year 2008, and now she has requested a loan of 21,000 PHP to pay for the labor of copra production. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to pay for the labor of copra production

loans.name: Doris

texts.en: Doris, 30 years old, is a widow with two school-going children and she works hard to pay school fees for her children. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water and her greatest challenge is food and clothes for her kids. She has a business of producing and selling gravel and she is requesting a loan of Kshs 10,000 to help her employ more human resources and boost the production of gravel.

loans.use: to help her employ more human resources and boost the production of gravel.

loans.name: Porferia

texts.en:
Porferia is 51 years old and married with four children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Porferia has a jeepney transport business in the Philippines. Porferia requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy tools and equipment for her jeepney.

Porferia has been in this business for six years. In the future, Porferia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and equipment for her jeepney.

loans.name: Komasa

texts.en:
Komasa lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well-known market areas in Montserrado county. She is 32 years old, and she stopped her education in 12th grade. She is married and has two children, aged 1 and 10, who live at home. Only one of her children attends school.

For five years now she has been selling charcoal in her community. One of the problems she faces is her small income, but she enjoys the interaction with her customers. The profit she makes enables her to buy food for her household, and this makes her proud of her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal to resell at her business. She plans to build a house for her children, in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal, to resell at her business

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena is 56 years old and married with three children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Magdalena is borrowing PHP 24,000 through NWTF to purchase rice seeds and pay the laborers' salaries.

Magdalena has been farming rice for 32 years and also earns additional income from fishing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds and pay the laborers' salaries

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well-known market areas in Montserrado county. She is 39 years old, single, and has five children between 16 and 26 years old. Her five children live at home and three attend high school while the older ones attend college.

For 8 years she has been selling charcoal in the community market. Lower income is the problem she faces now. But she enjoys the interaction with her customers and the profit she generates every day. She is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal to resell at her business. Her dream is to have a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal, to resell at her business

loans.name: Sasha

texts.en:
Sasha is from Goris town. He has already been involved in agriculture for four years. He breeds cattle and cultivates greens. His livestock currently includes two mother pigs, two little pigs, fifteen chickens and two turkeys.

Agriculture helps Sasha to have an income, which is very important for sustaining his family. He lives with his mother (who is 77 years old and is a pensioner) and wife. 

Realizing that the agricultural business is the only source of income for the family, Sasha would like to expand it.

He has applied for this loan to purchase three pigs, forage for feeding the livestock and seeds for cultivation. The loan will help him to expand his livestock and gather more income.

loans.use: to pay for three pigs, forage for feeding the livestock and seeds for cultivation.

loans.name: Marinel

texts.en:
Marinel is single and has one kid. She is engaged in the business of sales. She has a stall in the market in which she sells cosmetics, clothes and accessories products. Marinel has been in this business for eight years. With her income from the business, she is able to satisfy the needs of her child.

Marinel wants to borrow a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy shoes, slippers and perfumes to sell. She believes that by borrowing this loan she will increase her sales and income as well. She will manage the business well to ensure its growth.

loans.use: to buy shoes, slippers and perfumes to sell.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou works hard to support her family. Marilou is married and has a buying and selling rice business in the Philippines.

Marilou has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

Marilou has been in this business for 15 years now.

In the future, Marilou would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is a 48-year-old resident of Clarin, Misamis Occidental in the Philippines. She provides for her three children's needs from the small amount of PHP 8,000 she gains monthly from her transportation service business. She has been in this business for seven years as an aid to the income gained from her husband. 

This year Elsie has become a member of GDMPC, and she has applied for a PHP 12,000 loan at GDMPC micro-finance to purchase vehicle spare parts and accessories. In the future she would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase vehicle spare parts and accessories.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en: Elisa is 48 years old, married with three children. She lives in Misamis Occidental. She  raises pigs for sale to earn a living. She has been in her business for over five years and earns 7,000 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in the year 2011, and now she has requested a loan of 9,000 PHP to purchase feed for her pigs.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her pigs

loans.name: Angelito

texts.en:
Angelito is a farmer from Ubay, Bohol. He is a married man and a father of four children ages 11,10, 8 and 5. Angelito has been in the farming business for more than 15 years now. 

He is asking for a loan from CEVI, a micro-finance partner of Kiva, to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. Through this loan, Angelito will be able to improve his farm and his harvest. In the future, Angelito has hopes of expanding his business and saving money for the schooling of his children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
This is Elizabeth. Her previous loan was a big help for her business. She was able to buy spare parts for her van and had it repaired. Aside from her variety store, she also has a variety store for additional income. She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan in order to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of their van unit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Elizabeth hopes that her business will continue to expand and dreams to have a better life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance of their van.

loans.name: Samson

texts.en: Samson is 38 years old, married, and has three children. He is from Ndunyu Njeru. Samson used his previous loan to buy a power saw and his business improved. He is requesting his second loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to buy more timber to use in his timber yard. He hopes to see his business expand in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more timber to use in his timber yard.

loans.name: Virgen Del Socorro Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres socias una de ellas es María tiene 39 años de edad, acompañada con dos hijos. Tiene cinco años de tener su negocio de una pulpería y tiene dos carretones que vende raspados ambulantes que les paga a dos trabajadores, inicia su negocio vendiendo raspados y de las ganancias ahora cuenta con su pulpería en su domicilio el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de granos como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, sopas magi, huevos, pan, leche, carne de res, carne de pollo, sal. Productos lácteos, jabón de baño, jabón de lavar, medicamentos populares etc. también va adquirir materia prima para los raspados como hielo, piñas, azúcar, frambuesa, colorantes, vasos, cucharas, bolsas etc. Ana vende tortilla y frijoles cocidos y Mariela vende cosméticos de la Avon.
texts.en:
The group is made up of three members.  One of them is María, 39, who's married and has two children.

She has had her grocery store for five years.  She also has two mobile carts where she pays two workers to sell snow cones.  She started her business selling snow cones and with the profits now she has her grocery store in her house.

She'll invest the loan in staples such as rice, beans, sugar, oil, Maggi-brand soup, eggs, bread, milk, beef, chicken, salt, dairy products, bath soap, detergent, popular medicine, etc.  She's also going to acquire raw materials for snow cones, including ice, pineapples, sugar, raspberry, coloring, glasses, spoons, bags, etc.

Ana sells tortillas and cooked beans and María sells Avon cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy staples for her store and raw materials for snow cones

loans.name: Meilein

texts.en:
Meilein is married and has a fish selling business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years now and works hard to support her family. 

Meilein requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy fish additional to sell. In the future, Meilein would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Karla Group

texts.es: Grupo esta formado por tres socias emprendedoras una de ellas es Karla mujer de 32 años de edad, casada y con tres hijos de edad, tiene 6 años de tener su negocio como es una sala de belleza, de ser clientes de la institución tiene 5 años de ser responsable porque cumple con sus obligaciones, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de tintes, uñas acrílicas, agua oxigenada, cintas de ceras, tijeras para cortar pelo, pinturas de uñas, etc. Magaly tiene 27 años de edad su negocio es de una panadería y Martha tiene 41 años su negocio es venta de leche.
texts.en: This group has three enterprising women in it, including 32 year old Karla.  She is married and has three children.  Karla has had her beauty salon for six years and has been with the communal bank for five years.  She is responsible and carries out her responsibilities.  Karla will use the loan to buy dyes, fake nails, hydrogen peroxide, wax ribbons, hairdressing scissors, nail varnish and more.  Magaly is 27 years old and has a bread shop while Marth is 41 and sells milk.

loans.use: to buy dyes, fake nails, hydrogen peroxide, way ribbons, hairdressing scissors, nail varnish and more.

loans.name: Moslah

texts.en:
Muslah is 33 years old, a married man with three children. He is a teacher who lives in Sana`a, Yemen. He has always been a person concerned with community education and that of his family. He has a taxi where he works daily in the evening. He is always looking for ways to give the best to his children because the monthly salary from teaching is not enough. 

The car he uses as a taxi needs maintenance, so he applied for a loan of 220,000.08 YER from AMB to buy spare parts for repairing his taxi. He hopes to buy a new car to increase his profit and improve his living standards.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for repairing his taxi

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
A married mother who is blessed with three children, two of whom go to school, Theresa has been selling school supplies, beauty products such as hair pins, nail polish, and cosmetics, as well as baked breads for the past 19 years. She is really thankful and blessed because through her hard work and adaptation to new marketing strategies, she has been able to improve her sales and income.

In order to support her two children in their studies and sustain her family's basic necessities, Theresa and her husband seek to expand her business and make it more profitable. To accomplish this she is requesting a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy stocks of cosmetic products, baked breads, candies and school supplies for her stall. She is confident that this loan will help her in achieving her goals in life. Theresa hopes and prays that people will continue to lend her capital to ensure the ongoing smooth flow of her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of cosmetic products, baked breads, candies and school supplies for her stall.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy used her previous loan to purchase tyres and to service her PSV to be in better condition.  Right now she is borrowing a loan of KES.65,000 which she will use to purchase fertilizer and seeds for planting.  She is venturing into farming and still runs her transportation business.  This is her fifth loan and she successfully repaid her previous loan.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Aitu

texts.en:
Aitu is 67 years old, married, and has five children. She has a big plantation where she grows taro, taamu (a large root vegetable),yams, and bananas, which she sells in her community and at the market. She has been doing this for three years. 

Aitu is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy buy chemicals, weed killer, rakes, and bush knives to help her in planting her crops. She has been a member of SBPD since 2010. Aitu will use the profits from her sales to support her family as well as her children's education.

loans.use: to pay for chemicals, bush knives, weed killer, axes, and rakes.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is a 59 year-old married man.  He is a farmer and he has been in business for 20 years.  At present, his monthly income from the business is KES.40,000.  He is borrowing a loan of KES. 50,000 which he intends to use in order to purchase fertilizers and seeds for planting.  He will repay the loan with the anticipated profit. This is his fourth loan and he successfully repaid his previous loans.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen has been running a farm for already six years. He lives with his mother, wife and four year-old little daughter. Armen breeds cattle (he has nine cows and three calves).  He also cultivates wheat, potato, beans (haricots) and grows nut, apple and pear trees. As the only breadwinner of the family, Armen works hard to gather a good harvest and high income. 

As the farming business is the only source of Armen's income, he has applied for this loan to expand the farm.

With the loan's help Armen will purchase three calves and forage for feeding the livestock.

The loan is very important for Armen to earn more income and improve his family's living condition.

loans.use: to pay for three calves and forage for feeding livestock.

loans.name: Aliitasi

texts.en:
Aliitasi is a 36 year-old woman who is married with four children. She owns and operates a small store, selling items such as snacks, sugar, rice, salt, tinned food and more. She has been doing this for more than three years. 

Aliitasi needs a loan in order to refill her stock and buy a fridge. She hopes to use her profits to expand her business in order to support her family and her children. She became a member of Kiva partner SPBD in 2012 in order to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to pay for a sack of sugar, salt, a bag of rice, snacks, tinned food, etc.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita, a 64-year-old married mother of seven, lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental where she owns and operates a motorcycle transport enterprise to make a living. In business for over eight years, she earns PHP 20,000 every month.

Rosita joined GDMPC in 2010 and is now requesting a loan of PHP 24,000 to purchase spare parts and new tires. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and new tires.

loans.name: Melchora

texts.en:
Melchora is married, and she works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 19,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell at her store.

Melchora has been in this business for 13 years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Melchora successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Melchora aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is a 48-year-old, married woman and a mother of five children, from Ubay, Bohol. She runs a sari-sari or variety store business, selling food and other goods to the people in her place. Her husband works as a farmer. 

Anita is asking for a loan to buy additional stocks to sell, like canned goods, candies, soda, rice, and biscuits. With this loan, she will be able to attract more buyers to her store and, with more customers, she can sell more and earn more. In the future, Anita hopes of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell, like canned goods, candies, soda, rice, and biscuits.

loans.name: Djeneba

texts.fr:
DJENEBA est âgée de 39 ans, mariée  sans enfant. Elle   vit dans une famille nucléaire  au quartier Pelengana Sud  de Ségou
N’ayant pas fréquenté l’école pour des raisons sociales, (issue d’une famille ancrée dans les valeurs ancestrales) elle commença très tôt à faire les activités génératrices de revenus auprès de sa mère  qui vendait des habits en cotonnade teint en banco et appelé Bogolan. Après plusieurs années d’apprentissage à son côté, elle  décida d’opter  pour mener le commerce du tissus bazin car ce dernier est très prisé sur le marché. Elle  mène cette activité depuis 10 ans et jouit d’une grande expérience et clientèle. Sa force de vente est due à la maîtrise du rouage de ce secteur d’activité mais également, à son prix abordable et la qualité de sa marchandise.  
Dans le souci d’augmenter son fonds de commerce et de faire plus de bénéfice, elle sollicite ce nouveau prêt. Après un 1er prêt individuel correctement  remboursé, elle est à son 2eme prêt individuel qu’elle compte utiliser pour acheter 2 pièces de bazins riches. Elle  s’approvisionne à Bamako  et  vend au comptant à une clientèle mixte et très généralement elle participe aux exportations  au Sénégal. Avec ce prêt elle  envisage de réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 150 000FCFA. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de rembourser son prêt et contribuer aux dépenses de la famille.
Son ambition est   d’ouvrir une boutique de prêt à porter.
texts.en:
Djeneba is 39 years old, married without children. She lives in a nuclear family in the South Pelengana neighborhood of Segou.

She did not attend school for social reasons (coming from a family deeply rooted in traditional values), so  very early on she began to pursue income-generating activities alongside her mother who sold dyed cotton clothes in the banco style called Bogolan. After several years of learning at her side, she decided to opt for trading Bazin fabric because it is very popular in the marketplace.

She has been doing this for the past 10 years and has acquired an extensive experience and a large customer base. Her selling strength is due to her  mastery of the inner workings in this sector,  but also to her affordable prices and the quality of her goods.

In order to increase her working capital and make more profit, she is requesting a new loan. After a first individual loan was repaid properly, she is on her 2nd individual loan she will use to buy two pieces of "bazin riche" (high-quality bazin fabric, 100% cotton).

She resupplies in Bamako and resells cash to a mixed clientele. She also often participates in exports to Senegal.

With this loan she hopes to obtain monthly profits of 150,000 FCFA. The profits will enable her to repay her loan and contribute towards family expenses. Her ambition is to open a shop selling ready-to-wear clothes.

loans.use: buy lengths of bazin fabric

loans.name: Oscar Orlando

texts.es: Don Oscar de 50 años de edad se dedica a la agricultura siembra maiz y frijol y tambien tiene cultivo de loroco desde hace 4 años los productos que cultiva los vende a los negociantes de la zona, vive en casa propia y tiene un hijo de 17 años, con los productos que comercializa ha podido solventar los gastos de su hogar y ayudar a su hijo, el solicita un credito para poder comprar: semillas, abonos, entre otras cosas, y asi poder seguir solventando sus gastos ya que no tiene otros ingresos monetarios.
texts.en:
Don Oscar is a 50-year-old farmer who grows corn and beans. He also has been cultivating loroco for the past four years. The products he cultivates are sold to the merchants in the area.

Oscar lives in his own home and has a 17-year-old son. With the products he sells, he is able to pay the household expenses and help his son. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy seeds, compost, and other supplies. As a result, he can continue meeting his expenses since he has no other forms of income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, compost, and other farming supplies.

loans.name: Dirisa

texts.en:
Dirisa is 43 years old. He has four children, ages 8, 10, 13, and 16.  He is a humble, hardworking and God-fearing man.

His business deals in both poultry and rentals. He started the business in 2010 to raise additional income and pay his children's school fees. 

His clients are people in his area that roast chickens. His business challenges include a lack of prevention procedures, vaccinations, and poor feed. The loan funds will be used to buy chicken and stock feed.

loans.use: to buy broilers and chicken feed

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
Doris tiene 28 años de edad, es casada, tiene 4 hijos y vive en la ciudad de Tela, Atlantida.
Doris hace 4 años decidio dedicarse a cultivar palma africana, de donde se extrae el aceite. Este producto lo comercializa a intermediarios en el mercado y el pago que recibe es bastante rentable. tambien desempeña otras actividades como la sastreria como otro ingreso extra para aportar al hogar.Ella ha trabajado 4 creditos con Odef los cuales le han permitido invertir en el negocio y mantenerlo activo. Actualmente solicita el quinto de 11000 lempiras para la compra de fertilizante para el mantenimiento de la finca de palma.Manifiesta que con la inversion que haga las produccion aumentara y tendra mejores ingresos. La meta que tiene es con las ganancias que obtenga podra costruir su casa de material, ya que la actual donde vive es de barro y esta algo dañada.
texts.en:
Doris is 28 years old, married, and has four children. She lives in the city of Tela, Atlantida.

Four years ago, she decided to cultivate African palms in order to extract the oil. This product is sold to brokers at the market and she is paid a profitable amount. She also engages in other activities, such as tailoring, as a way of generating extra income for her household.

Doris has worked with four loans from ODEF, which has enabled her to invest in her business and keep it active. She is now requesting her fifth loan in the amount of 11,000 HNL so that she can buy fertilizers for maintaining her palm farm. Doris says that this investment will increase her production and result in more income. Her goal is to use the profits she earns to build a house of various materials. She currently lives in an adobe house that is starting to fall apart.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her African palm farm.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy Wanjiku resides in Nkubu in the Meru region of Eastern Kenya. She is 61 years old, married, and has three adult children. She has been a farmer for the past 20 years producing milk, tea leaves, fruits, arrow roots, and maize.

She approached Juhudi Kilimo for a loan of 60,000 KES for purchasing a chuff cutter. She says that by receiving this loan, there will more food for the family. She is currently budgeting for a pick-up for agricultural purposes.

The challenges that she faces in this business are periods of dry spells, pests, and diseases.

She is determined to maximize production through Juhudi funds.

loans.use: To purchase a chuff cutter

loans.name: Magdaline

texts.en:
Magdaline is a farmer in Tala town where she keeps dairy cows as well as cash crops such as maize, beans, and vegetables for selling. She has been in the farming business for the last five years, and it has been profitable. She is 40 years old, married, and has four children.

This will be her first loan from KADET LTD, and she plans to use the loan amount to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer and hybrid seeds for planting during this rainy season. She will use the generated income to pay school fees for her children.

She hopes to expand her business by planting in large scale and thereby make more income and be able to provide for the basic needs for her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and hybrid seeds for planting.

loans.name: Vineta

texts.en: Vineta is a 56-year-old woman who is married with six children. She owns and operates a small store, selling items such as snacks, sugar, rice, salt, tinned food, and more. She has been doing this for more than three years. Vineta needs a loan to refill her stocks and buy a fridge. She hopes to use her profits to extend her business in order to support her family and her children as well. She became a member of SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to pay for sacks of sugar and salt, bags of rice, snacks, and tinned food, etc.

loans.name: Jane Jemutai

texts.en:
Jane used her previous loan to buy pesticides to spray her wheat and pyrethrum farm. Right now, her monthly income is 70,000 KES. She is borrowing a loan of 50,000 KES which she intends to use to purchase fertilizers and seeds for planting.

She will use the profit from the business to pay school fees for her children. This is her fourth loan, and she successfully paid her previous loan.

loans.use: To buy pestcides to spray wheat and pyrethrum

loans.name: Villy

texts.en: Villy is 39 years old and married with one child. He lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He owns and operates a motorcycle transport business in the local community to earn a living. He has been in his business for more than three years and earns 3,000 PHP every month. He joined GDMPC in 2010, and now he has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase spare parts and new tires. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and new tires.

loans.name: Olepa

texts.en: Olepa is a 39-year-old married woman with four children. She makes and sells coconut buns in her community to earn a living. She has two years of experience with this business. Olepa needs a loan to buy coconuts, vegetable oil, sacks of sugar, yeast, and flour. She plans to use her profits to extend her business in order to support her family and save more. Olepa has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to pay for flour, sacks of sugar, yeast, coconuts, vegetable oil, etc.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 34-year-old man from Olkalou and is married with four children who are in school.

Joseph used the previous loan well as he was able to buy dairy cows, fertilizers, and spraying chemicals that enable his farming business to do well. He has applied for his fourth loan from Kadet Ltd to enable him buy maize seedlings to use in his farm.

He hopes to see his business expand in the near future.

loans.use: To buy maize seedlings

loans.name: Asmin

texts.en: Asmin is a mother of three school-going children, and she is married. She owns a house with electricity and piped water. Currently, she raises poultry to earn a living. She is now requesting for a loan of 50,000 KES to buy more poultry feeds such as maize and grains for her chicken to expand the productivity of her chicken thus earning more profit.

loans.use: to buy more poultry feeds

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a 53-year-old married mother of four. She resides in Nkubu in the Meru Region of Eastern Kenya. She has been in the farming business for the past 15 years. She sells milk, beans, bananas, maize, and tea leaves.

She has come to Juhudi Kilimo to request for a loan of 30,000 KES to be used to purchase piglets. She says that the pigs will help generate more income for the family. Besides rearing pigs, Lucy's vision is to rear 10 producing dairy cows.

The market there is unreliable thus posing a major challenge for her produce. She says that Juhudi needs to provide its clients with other products like emergency and school-fees loans.

loans.use: To purchase pigs.

loans.name: Taua

texts.en:
Taua is a 49-year-old woman who is married, with nine children. She has a big plantation where she grows taro, taamu, yams, and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for three years. 

Taua needs a loan to buy chemicals, weed killer, rakes, and bush knives to help her in the planting of her crops. She has been a member of South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) since 2012. Taua will use the profits from her sales to support her family and her children's education.

loans.use: to pay for chemicals, bush knives, weed killer, and rakes for her plantation.

loans.name: Arnel

texts.en: Arnel is from Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 39 years old and married. To make a living, Arnel provides motor transport services. Arnel has been engaged in his business for four years and earns approximately 30,000 PHP per month. In 2009, Arnel joined Kiva partner GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Arnel is requesting a new loan of 40,000 PHP, which will be used to repair his existing vehicle in order to provide better service. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to repair his existing vehicle in order to provide better service

loans.name: Pule

texts.en:
Pule is 32 years old, married, and has one child. She has a big plantation where she grows taro, taamu (a large root vegetable), yams, and bananas, which she sells in her community and at the market. She has been doing this for three years. 

Pule is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy buy chemicals, weed killer, rakes, and bush knives to help her in planting her crops. She has been a member of SBPD since 2012. Pule will use the profits from her sales to support her family as well as her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals, bush knives, weed killer, and rakes.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is 48 years old, married, and has three children. He sells cereals, which he has been doing for the seven years. He earns an average monthly income of 15,000 KES. 

William is requesting his fourth loan from KADET LTD for 100,000 KES, which he will use to purchase cereals, such as maize, beans, and millet, to stock his cereals business. He anticipates using his profits to pay school fees for his children. In the future, William hopes to be financially stable and to save money to enable him to pay college fees for his children.

loans.use: to purchase cereals to sell.

loans.name: Faalelava

texts.en:
Faalelava is a 34-year-old woman who is married, with two children. She has a big plantation where she grows taro, taamu, yams, and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for two years.

Faalelava needs a loan to buy chemicals, weed killer, rakes, bush knives, etc. to help her with the planting of her crops. She has been a member of South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) since 2012. Faalelava will use the profits from her sales to support her family and her children's education.

loans.use: to pay for chemicals, bush knives, weed killer, rakes, etc. for her plantation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more chickens.

loans.name: Laafilabumb De Yagma Group

texts.fr:
Mme COLETTE est la représentante du groupe LAAFI LA BOUMB DE YAGMA. Mme se porte bien.  Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants. Le plus âgé a 06ans le moins âgé a 03ans. 01 va à l’école et elle a 02 personnes à sa charge.
Mme vend des plats en plastique. Elle exerce ce métier depuis  04ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché  de Secteur 10 et au grand marché. Ses clients sont les femmes et hommes.
Mme veut  s’acheter  01 douzaine de gobelet et 01 douzaine de plats, 01douzaine de seaux et 1/2douzaine de bouillards.
Elle  épargne  ses bénéfices  afin d’ouvrir une boutique pour son activité. Mme ambitionne agrandir  son champs  d’activité  et aider et soutenir son mari dans les charges de la famille.
texts.en:
Madam Colette is the representative of the group LAAFI LA BOUMB DE YAGMA. Madam is well. She is married and mother to 2 children. The oldest is 6 years old and the youngest is 3 years old. One goes to school and she has 2 dependents.

Madam sells plastic dishes. She has been practicing this profession for 4 years. She gets her supplies at the market in Sector 10 and at the large market. Her customers are women and men.

Madam wants to buy herself 1 dozen cups and 1 dozen dishes, 1 dozen buckets and 1/2 dozen kettles.

She saves her profits in order to open a shop for her business. Madam has the ambition of expanding the scope of her business and to help and support her husband with the responsibilities of the family.

loans.use: to buy herself 1 dozen cups and 1 dozen dishes, 1 dozen buckets and 1/2 dozen kettles.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is a 26-year-old, industrious gentleman, who has been in the transport industry for the last four years. He learned about Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) from his colleagues in the motorcycle business.

He needs a loan since he has now acquired another motorbike at the same cost and has employed a colleague in the business. He hopes to use the increased proceeds to open a cinema and video show in Narok Town. His dream is attain financial sustainability.

loans.use: to purchase another motorcycle.

loans.name: Daler

texts.ru: Далер трудолюбивый человек. Ему 41 лет. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. Дети Фурузон, Фарзона, Фарахноз и Ёкубджон учатся в средней школе. Жена Далера Парвина является домохозяйкой. Далер более 16 лет занимается купле продажей обуви на местном рынке. Он продает женские, мужские и детские обуви. Далер имеет своих клиентов и благодаря широкому ассортименту и хорошему сервису его клиенты неоднократно делают покупки с его товара. Он хочет развевать бизнес дальше, но не имеет денег для покупки товара для нового сезона. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 долларов США для покупки обуви. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Daler is a hard-working person. He is 41 years old, married, and raising 4 children. His kids Furuzon, Farzona, Farakhnoz and Yokubjon attend secondary school, while his wife takes care of the household. For over 16 years, Daler has been a footwear retailer at a local market, selling women's, men's and children's shoes. He has many regular clients who return to his shop thanks to the wide assortment of merchandise and good service.

Daler would like to continue developing his business but lacks the funds to stock up on merchandise for the upcoming season. He is requesting a loan of US$3000 to purchase footwear and is counting on your kindness.

loans.use: to stock up on shoes for the new season

loans.name: Clemence

texts.en:
Clemence is married and has three children in school. She owns a house with electricity and piped water. Currently she sells clothes at her village’s market.

Clemence is applying for a 50,000 loan through Yehu to buy more clothes to sell. She will use her increased income to meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Sidiq

texts.ru: Сидику 32 года. У него жена и один сын. Он со своей семьей проживает в городе Конибодом в северной части Таджикистана. Сидик является бизнесменом. В течение 8 лет он занимается куплей и продажей машин. Сидик в месяц дважды закупает свой товар с автомобильных рынков города Худжанд и Конибодом. После проведения внешнего ремонта машин, он продает их с наценкой на этих же рынках. Кредит берет для купли и продажи легковых автомобилей с целью расширения бизнеса.
texts.en: Sidiq is 32 years old and has a wife and a son. Together with his family, he lives in the city of Konibodom in the north of Tajikistan. Sidiq is an entrepreneur and has been buying and reselling cars for the past 8 years. Twice per month, he purchases cars from the automotive markets of Khujand and Konibodom. After carrying out necessary body work on the cars, he resells them with a markup at the same markets. Sidiq is taking this loan to purchase cars for subsequent resale in order to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase cars for repair and resale

loans.name: Guiguilaalahkan Group

texts.fr:
Mme KAWALO représente le groupe GUIGUILAALAHKAN. Mariée, elle est mère de 04enfants. Le plus âgé à 19ans et le moins âgé à 11ans. Les 04 vont à l’école.
Mme vend des condiments et légumes depuis07ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de toecin et larlé. Ses clients sont les hommes et femmes.
Elle veut s’acheter 01sac de choux et 01sac d’aubergine.
Mme épargne pour renforcer  son activité. Elle ambitionne agrandir son activité et veut participer aux charges de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Kawalo represents the Guiguilaalahkan group. She is married and the mother of four children. The oldest is 19 and the youngest is 11 years old. All four attend school.

She has been selling condiments and vegetables for the past seven years. She resupplies at the Toecin and Larlé markets. Her clients are both men and women.

She wants to buy one bag of cabbages and one bag of eggplants. She saves to strengthen her business activity. She aims to expand her business and wants to contribute towards her household costs.

loans.use: buy one bag of cabbages and one bag of eggplants

loans.name: Aissatou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe composé de trois femmes et habitant la même localité font partie du même banc villageois. Le banc villageois est créé depuis juin 2008. Elles ont pour activité principale le petit commerce.

Celle qui est à l'extrême droite sur la photo, est la responsable du groupe, elle est célibataire et est âgée de 40 ans.Son activité consiste à vendre des bijoux tels que les boucles d'oreilles ,les bagues.

Elle dispose d'une forte expérience pour ce type d'activité en plus sa clientèle ne cesse d'augmenter au fil des mois.

Avec le financement reçu elle compte investir dans l'achat de nouveaux bijoux pour faire fructifier son commerce.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three women who live in the same district and who belong to the same Banc Villageois. Their Banc Villageois was formed in June 2008. Their are principal businesses are running small shops.

Aissatou is shown at the far right in the photo, and is the leader of the group. She is a single woman and is 40 years of age. Her business consists of selling jewelry such as earrings, rings and necklaces. Aissatou has extensive experience in this business and her client base only continues to grow as the months go on.

With the loan she receives, Aissatou intends to invest in the purchase of more jewelry to grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase jewelry such as earrings, rings and necklaces.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock for his store.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a resident of Nkubu, in the Meru Region of Eastern Kenya, where she lives with her husband and three children. 

Hellen has been a farmer for over 20 years. She is 40 years old. In addition to farming, she also has a retail business as an extra source of income.

Hellen approached Juhudi Kilimo for a loan request of KES 50,000 to purchase poultry. This loan will help in improving her family's living standards. In the future, Hellen wants to have over 5,000 chickens, both layers and broilers. 

Lack of sufficient funds and poor markets have been her major challenges. She is happy with Juhudi Kilimo for funding her.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Savriniso

texts.ru: Савринисо очень умная и трудолюбивая женщина. Ей 27 лет. Она несколько лет назад вышла замуж, но она не сошлась с мужем и поэтому развелась. Она не имеет детей. После развода она вернулась к родителям. Данное время она живет с матерью. Савринисо после развода начала работать в государственной организации секретарем. Она очень любит свою работу и честно выполняет ее. Ее коллеги знают ее как добросовестную и добрую женщину. Савринисо тратит свои деньги для покупки необходимого средства для проживания. Ее мать попросила ее купить корову. Так как она больна и нуждается каждый день пить парное молоко. Она не смогла отказаться любимой маме и поэтому она обратилась в ИМОН с целью получения займа в сумме 3000 сомони для покупки коровы. Она является повторной клиенткой ИМОН и обещает погасить займ во время. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Savriniso is a very intelligent and hard-working woman. She is 27 years old. Several years ago, she got married, but the relationship did not work out and she divorced her husband. Savriniso has no children. After her divorce, she returned to her parents' home and currently lives with her mother. Following the divorce, Savriniso started to work as a secretary at a government office. She loves her work and performs it honestly. Her colleagues know Savriniso as a conscientious and kind woman.

Savriniso spends her money on life necessities. Recently, her mother asked her to buy a cow as she is ill and must drink fresh milk daily. Savriniso was unable to refuse her mother and thus has turned to IMON for a loan of 3000 somoni in order to make the purchase. She is a return client of IMON and promises to pay off the loan on time. Savriniso is counting on your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a cow for her ill mother who needs to drink fresh milk every day

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is thirty-six years of age, married and has two children, both of whom are in school. She resides with her family in Nkubu, Meru Region of Eastern Kenya, where she has practiced farming for over twenty years, producing bananas and cereals.

Judith requested a loan from Juhudi Kilimo of KES 60,000 to purchase irrigation equipment. Through this equipment, water will flow to her farm and her crops, and it will result in a greater yield. Thus, their living standards will improve.

In the next five years, Judith wants to have a pick-up to make transportation of her products easy. Her main challenges are lack of capital and crop pests and diseases.

She appreciates Juhudi for funding her.

loans.use: to purchase irrigation equipment.

loans.name: Tulaga

texts.en:
Tulaga is a 50-year-old married woman with eight children. She has a small garden where she grows cabbages, beans, eggplants and tomatoes that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for two years.

Tulaga needs a loan to buy tools such as rakes, bush knives etc. to help her in her business. 

She has been a member of SBPD since 2013. Tulaga will use the profits from her sales to improve her business and support her children's education.

loans.use: to pay for chemicals, bush knives, weed killer, axes, rakes, wheelbarrow, seeds, etc.

loans.name: Gibson

texts.en:
Gibson Miriti resides in Nkubu, Meru Region of Eastern Kenya. He is thirty-one years of age, married and has two children, one of whom is of school-going age. He has been an active farmer for over ten years, planting bananas and other horticultural crops.

Gibson approached Juhudi Kilimo for a loan request of KES 60,000, which will be used for the purchase of irrigation equipment. This equipment will be used for irrigating his crops, and thus produce a higher yield. Hence, this will help him pay school fees for his children.

In the future, he wants to acquire a pick-up for easy transportation of his produce to the market place.

loans.use: to purchase irrigation equipment.

loans.name: Armida

texts.es: Armida, se dedica a la crianza de cerdos. Ella vive con sus hijos, esta acompañada y solo ella trabaja en el hogar. Este lo aprendio con sus padres quienes desde joven le inculcaron el oficio, no tiene horario establecido. El prestamo que requiere le permitira invertir en la compra de cuatro cerdos para engordarlos y luego venderlos. Este le ayudara a crecer en el negocio y tener todo lo necesario para trabajar.  Su sueño es aumentar las ventas, ampliar la clientela y preparar a sus hijos para que en el futuro sea profesionales.
texts.en: Armida raises pigs.  She lives with her children and is married.  She is the only one who works in the home.  She learned from her parents, who taught her from when she was very young.  She doesn't have a fixed schedule.  She needs this loan so she can buy four pigs to raise.  This will help her grow her business and have what she needs to work.  Her dream is to increase her sales, expand her customer base, and prepare her children for a future as professionals.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Umwete Group

texts.fr:
Bonaventure fait partie du groupe Umwete  et est un des victimes de  l’incendie du marché central de Bujumbura. Il est client  de Turame depuis  3 ans. Il  habite à  Bujumbura. Il est marié à Bernadette. Ensemble ils ont  4 enfants  âgés de 5 à 13 ans, tous étudient.

Il  faisait le commerce de boutique (sucre, chaussures,) au marché central de Bujumbura. Il a perdu des marchandises d’une valeur de  800 000 Fbu (512,82$) par l’incendie.

 Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il  obtient, il  va  augmenter  son capital en achetant des articles de sa boutique (sucre, chaussures,…) à revendre, pour continuer de gagner sa vie.
texts.en:
Bonaventure is a member of the Umwete Group and is one of the victims of the fire at the central market in Bujumbura. He has been a client of Turame for the past three years. He lives in Bujumbura and is married to Bernadette. Together they have four children aged five to 13 years old, all of whom are studying.

Bonaventure ran a small shop (selling sugar, shoes, etc.) at the central market in Bujumbura. He lost goods worth 800,000 FBU ($ 512.82) in the fire. With the loan he receives from KIVA, Bonaventure plans to increase his capital by purchasing items for his shop (sugar, shoes, etc.) that he will sell to continue earning his living.

loans.use: to purchase items for his shop (sugar, shoes, etc.) that he will sell to continue earning his living.

loans.name: Dasse's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est constitué de 25 membres sont issus du même village. Elles ont pour activité le petit commerce et l'agriculture.

Madame à l'extrême droite sur la photo,est responsable du groupe, elle est âgée de 42 ans, elle est mariée et mére 05 garçons, l'aîné est âgé de 25 ans et le cadet de 15 ans. Sa principale activité est le commerce, elle tient une boutique dans le village.

Elle dispose d'une bonne expérience de ce type de commerce car l'ayant pratiqué pendant plusieurs années.

Avec le financement,elle compte acheter 09 sacs de riz à 15000f le sac,07 sacs de farine à 21500f le sac,04 bidons de 20l d'huile à 17500f le bidon,04 sachets de 05kg de vermicelle à 4500f le sachet,02 sac d'oignons à 6500f le sac et 01 carton de 18 paquets de bombom à 750f le paquet.

Son objectif est de pouvoir accumuler des gains pour constituer un fonds afin d'acheter un terrain et assurer la dépense quotidienne.
texts.en:
This group consists of 25 members who live in the same village. They make their livings engaging in different small businesses and agriculture.

The member shown at the far right of the photo is the leader of the group. She is 42 years old, married, and the mother of five boys between the ages of 15 and 25 years old. Her main business is running a shop in the village. She has good experience with this type of business as she has been running it for several years.

With the loan she receives, this borrower plans to buy nine sacks of rice at 15,000f each, seven sacks of flour at 21,500f each, four 20-liter cans of oil at 17,500f each, four 5-kg sacks of vermicelli at 4,500f each, two sacks of onions at 6,500f each, and one 18-pack of bombom at 750f for the carton. Her objective is to earn enough income so that she can purchase land and provide for daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase, rice, flour and onions.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine.

loans.name: David De Jesus

texts.es: Cliente microempresario y emprendedor es David, tiene 49 años de edad, casado y con tres hijos, el se dedica desde hace 25 años tiene un taller de mecánica  en su domicilio tiene un trabajador. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de llantas seminuevas, para la comercialización, aceite para vehículos, tarros de grasas etc.
texts.en:
This entrepreneur and small businessman is David. He is 49 years old, married, and has three children. For the past 25 years, he has managed an auto repair shop in his home. He has one employee.

His loan will be invested in the purchase of semi-new tires to sell, motor oil, jars of grease, and other items.

loans.use: to buy tires, motor oil, grease, and other items.

loans.name: Mele

texts.en:
Mele is a 54-year-old woman who is married and has eight children. For the past two years she has grown taro, taamu, yams and bananas on her plantation. She sells her produce within her community or at the local market.

Mele has been a member of SBPD since 2012. She is applying for a 1000 WST loan to buy chemicals, weed killers, rakes and bush knives to help her in planting her crops. She will use her increase in profits to support her family and pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, weed killers, rakes and bush knives.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha lives in Nkubu, part of the Meru region of Eastern Kenya. She is 51, married and has three children, one of whom attends school.

For the past nineteen years Martha has farmed their land, producing tea leaves, eggs, bananas and maize. Too little money is her main challenge.

Martha likes doing business with Juhudi, as she feels their products are favorable and affordable. She is applying for a 60,000 loan to buy more chickens. She says that within the next five years she will have raised over two thousand of them. The returns from doing so will provide better living standards for her and her family.

loans.use: to buy more chickens.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 27 years of age, married, and has one child. They reside in Nkubu, in the Meru Region of Eastern Kenya.

Nancy has been a farmer for over ten years, planting bananas and cereals. She also operates a retail business as an extra source of income.

She has requested a loan of KES 50,000 to be used in purchasing irrigation equipment. This will help in pulling water to every part of the farm and, thus, help to improve their production yield. It will also improve their living standards because of the high profits. In the future, Nancy wants to have the biggest cereals store in the entire country.

Lack of capital, crop pests, and diseases are the biggest challenges. Nancy likes Juhudi for its quick processing of loans.

loans.use: to purchase irrigation equipment for her farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase dairy goats.

loans.name: Minesota

texts.en: Minesota is a 37-year-old single woman with two children. She has a small plantation where she grows cocoa beans that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for three years. Minesota needs a loan to buy tools such as rakes and bush knives to help her operate her business. She has been a member of SBPD since 2010. Minesota will use the profits from her sales to improve her business and support her children's education.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, bush knives, weed killer, axes, and rakes.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
This is Gloria, 55, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Francisco, a construction worker, and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Gloria operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a small amount of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns a profit by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

She is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan to help her continue operating her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Gloria dreams that her business will continue to grow and hopes that her grandchildren will have a good education. She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To buy grocery items, toiletries, and beverages

loans.name: Mark

texts.en:
Mark is a 35 year-old married man and was blest with three children, two of whom attend school.  He has been practicing mixed farming for the past seven years.  He grows tobacco and fruits and sells in the local market.  Besides farming, he is a teacher by profession.

He has requested a loan of KES.50,000 from Juhudi Kilimo so that he can put up a zero grazing unit to help with his livestock.  The use of this loan will help him educate his children.  He plans on buying his own car.  The challenges he faces are poor infrastructure and pests and diseases.
He says that Juhudi Kilimo has affordable interest rates for small scale farmers.

loans.use: To construct a zero-grazing unit

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is a resident of Nkubu, Meru Region of Eastern Kenya. She is fifty years of age and has three children, two of whom are still in school.  She has been involved in farming for thirteen years, dealing with milk, bananas, coffee, maize and beans.

She has approached Juhudi Kilimo for a loan request of KES.60,000 for acquiring water pumps and generator.  She says that this loan will help in the provision of better education for her children.  In the next five years, she plans to have purchased two acres of land.

Her main challenge in this business is inflation.  Julia says that Juhudi Kilimo will help her fulfill her dreams.

loans.use: To purchase water pumps and generators.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.ru: Хасан житель города Исфара, расположенный в северной части Таджикистана. Ему 48 лет. Он женат. У него трое сыновей и одна дочь. Старший сын женат, он предоставляет услуги по ремонту квартир. Двое младших сыновей находятся на заработках в России. Жена Хасана, его дочь и невестка ведут домашнее хозяйство. Сам Хасан занимается животноводством. Он покупает, откармливает и перепродает крупнорогатый скот. В разведении скота ему помогает жена. Хасан берет кредит для закупа крупнорогатого скота с целью перепродажи.
texts.en: Hasan live in Isfara, in northern Tadzhikistan. He is 48 years old, married, and has three sons and one daughter. His eldest son is married; he repairs people's apartments. The two younger sons are working abroad in Russia. Hasan's wife, daughter, and daughter-in-law take care of the household. Hasan himself is engaged in animal husbandry. He buys, fattens, and resells cattle. His wife helps him take care of the animals. Hasan is seeking a loan to buy cattle in order to fatten them for later resale.

loans.use: to buy cattle in order to fatten them for later resale.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is a 34-year-old married woman and a mother of three children from Ubay, Bohol. She operates a sari-sari (variety store) business where she sells goods to the people in her neighborhood. Betty requests a loan to buy more groceries including canned goods, rice, biscuits, cooking ingredients, soap, and detergents to sell. 
In the future, Betty hopes to make her business successful and sustainable. In addition, she wants to save money to meet her children's school expenses and to repay her loan on time.

loans.use: to buy groceries including canned goods, rice, biscuits, cooking ingredients, soap, and detergents to sell

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.es:
Gregorio es una persona de 60 años, vive con su familia que esta conformada por su esposa y 10 hijos en la cual todos colaboran en la siembra del maíz, es una familia muy unida, él es una persona muy conocida en la zona, muy amable y respetuoso con las personas. Se dedica al comercio de animales compra y vende los animales también cultiva caña de azúcar y realiza molienda la cual saca dulce de atado eso lo aprendió desde pequeño; su padre le enseño el oficio de la molienda y hasta el día de hoy sigue trabajando en eso. Compra los insumos en el pueblo más cercano que esta a unos 4 kilómetros de su casa. Al mismo tiempo que compra los insumos y alimentos para su casa, pasa comprando los animales que le servirán para la venta. El traslado de los insumos y de los animales es muy difícil, ya que debe caminar 8kilometros para poder llegar a su destino.
El préstamo que solicita a Fundación Campo, es para iniciar con un pequeño comercio de compra y venta de ganado y cerdos por que ya se acerca la época de siembra y el cliente quiere trabajar para poder tener dinero para poder sembrar el maíz y frijol.
Él espera buenos resultados con el negocio del ganado y una buena cantidad de maíz y con eso poder tener un mayor ingreso para su familia.
texts.en:
Gregorio is 60 years old and lives with his family, which includes his wife and ten children.  They all help plant corn and it’s a very united family.  He is a person very well-known within the zone; he’s very friendly and respectful of others.  He sells animals, buys and sells them and also raises sugarcane and does grinding and extracts sugar.  His father taught him how to grind and he continues to work in this field.  He buys his supplies in the nearby town, four kilometers from his home.  At the same time he buys supplies and food for his home and the animals he resells.  Transporting the supplies and animals is very difficult because he must walk eight kilometers to reach his destination.

He is asking for this loan through Fundación Campo to start a small business buying and selling livestock and pigs.  The planning season is approaching and he wants to work so that he can have money to plant corn and beans.

He expects to have good results with his business and good quality of corn.  In this way her can have a better income for his family.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Yarling Del Rosario

texts.es: Socia microempresaria de éxito es Yarling tiene 41 años de edad, acompañada, tiene tres hijos, desde hace 15 años se dedica a vender ropa usada y ropa nueva de forma ambulante, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de ropa íntima como brazieres, bóxer de dama, bóxer de varón, bikinis, toallas pequeñas, toallas grandes, licra, bóxer micro fibra etc.
texts.en: Yarling is a partner in a successful microbusiness. She is 41 years old. She is in a relationship and has three children. Yarling has been selling new and used clothing at street markets for 15 years. She will invest this loan in buying intimate clothing, such as bras, men’s and women’s underwear, bikinis, small and large towels, lycra, microfiber underwear, etc.

loans.use: to buy intimate clothing, such as bras, men’s and women’s underwear, bikinis, small and large towels, lycra and microfiber underwear

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es: Fernando, tiene la edad  de 67 años, está casado,  vive con su esposa y su hija los cuales su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes y otros productos para aplicarle a la siembra y así que tenga una buena geminación, y semilla de buena calidad, además pagar mano de obra para la aplicación de los productos y asistencia de la plantación una vez que tenga desarrollo, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones de clima y suelo que cuenta la zona para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia de varios años en el manejo de granos básicos. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad al igual que una cosecha adecuada, y tener a corto plazo una producción importante. Con el ingreso de la cosecha que espera obtener quiere utilizarla en el bienestar y estudio de su familia y cumplir con algunas metas familiares y seguir invirtiendo más en los cultivos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Fernando is 67 years old.  He is married and lives with his wife and daughter, who are his biggest priorities.  With this loan Fernando plans to buy fertilisers and other products for when he sows his crops.  With this the seeds will grow better and he will have a better quality product. In addition he will use the money to pay labourers to apply the products and to assist with the planting once everything is ready.  This way he will be able to do a good job.  Fernando is planning to take advantage of the good weather conditions and the good state of the ground in the region for these crops.  He will also use his years of experience to manage these basic grains.  As well as buying better products of a higher quality so that the crops develop well and healthy, he will also have a good yield with good production levels in the short term.  He hopes the harvest will generate a good income to look after his family's well-being and education.  He also wants to achieve some personal goals and continue investing in the plantation.  This is Fernando's first loan with Fudecosur.  He has no other loans with state banks but Fudecosur has provide Fernando with a loan under better conditions and with a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to sow beans.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 30 years old and is from Nyahururu.  He is married and has five children who are in school.

James has a retail shop business that he has been doing for many years. He has applied for his first loan from KADET LTD., to enable him to buy cooking fat, sugar, and soft drinks to add to his stock for sale.  He hopes to expand his business and open up a supermarket in the future.

loans.use: To buy cooking fat ,sugar, soft drinks for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy spare parts for auto-rickshaw driving.

loans.name: Jonina

texts.en: Jonina is a 27 year-old single woman with no children. She has a small plantation and she grows taro, taamu, bananas and yams to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years.  Jonina has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers, chemicals, bush knives, weed killer, axes, rakes, etc.  She has been a member of SBPD since 2013. With her profits, Jonina hopes to improve her plantation and support her family.

loans.use: to pay for chemicals, bush knives, weed killer, axes, rakes. etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a water tank and irrigation pipes

loans.name: Carlosa

texts.en: Carlosa, a 53-year-old married mother of six from Ubay, Bohol, operates a food vending business selling home-cooked foods to the people in her area. She is requesting a loan to buy additional ingredients to sell such as meat, vegetables, seasonings, etc. With this, Carlosa will be able to improve her business and earnings.

loans.use: to buy additional products to sell such as meat, vegetables, seasonings, etc.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a 36-year-old, married woman who resides in Nkubu, in the Meru region of Eastern Kenya. She has been an active farmer for over ten years, producing cereals and horticultural crops.

She approached Juhudi Kilimo for a loan of KES 20,000 which will be used to purchase rabbits. The rearing of rabbits will help enhance her living standards. Joyce sees her business growing to 5,000 rabbits.

The main challenges she faces are insufficient capital and poor transportation. Joyce appreciates Juhudi Kilimo for its faster processing of loans.

loans.use: to buy rabbits.

loans.name: Kisa

texts.en: Kisa is a 36 year-old single woman with no children. She has a small plantation and she grows taro, taamu, bananas and yams to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years. Kisa has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers, chemicals, bush knives, weed killer, axes, rakes, etc.  She has been a member of SBPD since 2013. With her profits, Kisa hopes to improve her plantation and support her family.

loans.use: to pay for chemicals, bush knives, weed killer, axes, rakes, etc.

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en: Rachel is married.  She owns a house with electricity and piped water. For the last three years, she has been running a poultry business to earn a living. Apart from that, she does farming. She is requesting a loan of Ksh 50,000 to buy poultry feeds, such as grains of maize for her chickens, so that she can increase the productivity of her chicks.  This should later enable her to earn a good profit and support her family without many challenges.

loans.use: to buy poultry feeds, such as grains of maize, for her chickens

loans.name: Khalid

texts.en:
Khalid is a 45-year-old married man with three children. He has been a teacher for many years. He lives in Sana`a, Yemen. 

He starts his job at 7:00 a.m. and finishes at 12:00 p.m. He has a low salary, which is not enough to provide support for his family. 

Khalid is asking for a loan of 250,000.02 YER to buy a computer, which he will use for creating reports and different documents. He hopes to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a computer, which he will use for creating reports and different documents.

loans.name: Taumaoe

texts.en: Taumaoe is a 32 year-old married woman who has five children. She has a small plantation, and she grows taro, taamu, bananas and yams to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years. Taumaoe has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers, chemicals, bush knives, weed killer, axes, rakes, etc.  She has been a member of SBPD since 2012. With her profits, Taumaoe hopes to improve her plantation in order to support her family and her children's education as well.

loans.use: to pay for chemicals, bush knives, weed killer, axes, rakes, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase irrigation equipment.

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
This is Liezel, 41, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Arthur, a supervisor, and a mother to their children. Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating her business. She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their everyday needs.

Liezel maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. The dealers' prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers rely on as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 2000 PHP in sales every week.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a 15, 000 PHP loan. She will use the loan to buy additional supplies and products like shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, soap, fabric softener, undergarments and other products needed in her business. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business.  

Liezel hopes that her business will continue to grow and dreams of having her own house. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.
