* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and products like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Barbara

texts.en: Barbara is a 37-year-old woman who is married with 4 children. She runs a sewing business where she tailors clothes in her community. She has more than 3 years of experience with this business. Barbara has requested a loan to buy herself a sewing machine, needles, materials, threads, and other items. She plans to use her profits to extend her business and support her family and as well as her children. She joined SPBD this year to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to pay for materials, needles, a sewing machine and threads.

loans.name: Ransford Alex's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above are teachers of a secondary school in the eastern city of Koidu. Like their counterparts in SMT’s other operational areas, they have come to request a loan of 3,900,000.00 Sierra Leonean Leones for the entire team. With the help of this loan, they will be able to meet their immediate and most pressing financial needs. At the end of each month, their school’s bursar can deduct money from their salaries to repay SMT/Kiva lenders.

Sidikie (who is pictured in the middle) is the featured leader of this team. Born in Jaima in eastern Sierra Leone, the 28-year-old is single with one child who is attending primary school. A school teacher for six years now, Sidikie has requested this loan to pay college fees for himself and to buy house-building materials such as iron corrugated sheets, nails, cement, etc. for the construction of a home.

loans.use: to pay college fees for himself and  to buy house-building materials such as iron corrugated sheets, nails, cement, etc. for the construction of a house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase water tanks and water pump.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is 52 years old and has children who are in school.  Susan has a cereals business that she has been doing for the past four years.  She has applied for her second loan from KADET LTD. to enable her to buy beans, maize and rice to add to her stock. She hopes to expand her business and be able to have employees in the near future.

loans.use: To buy beans, maize and rice to sell.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en: Carmelita is a 57 year-old married woman from Ubay, Bohol.  She is a mother of eight grown up children. She has been engaged in a rice farming business together with her husband for more than 22 years now. This is the source of their income.  Carmelita is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm, and piglets to raise. With this, she will be able to improve her farm and augment its harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm, and piglets to raise

loans.name: Mavlon

texts.ru: Человек с огромным сердцем доброты и прекрасной душой, который живет среди высоких Таджикских гор, нуждается вашей поддержки, так как последние время у него проблемы с финансами. Его зовут Мавлон.  Ему  49 лет, женат и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Климат его местожительство весьма благополучный для выращивания сельхоз культур, а также для скотоводства. Более  28 лет он занимается скотоводством. У него 2  коровы и дополнительно он предоставляет услугу строителя домов и других объектов. Его жена домохозяйка и поэтому Мавлон является основным кормильцем в семье. Мавлон тратит все свои деньги для покупки продуктов питания и других необходимого средства. Он должен отремонтировать дом, так как его дом очень старый и нуждается в капитальном ремонте. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 4000 сомони для покупки строительных материалов, как цемент, древесина, краски и.т. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: A man with a huge heart and a wonderful, kind spirit, who lives up in the high Tadzhik mountains, needs your support, for lately he has been having financial problems. His name is Mavlon. He is 49, married, and is raising 3 children. The local climate is extremely favorable for growing crops and raising livestock. Mavlon has been engaged in animal husbandry for more than 28 years. He has two cows, and he also builds houses and other structures. His wife is a homemaker, and therefore Mavlon is the family's main source of income. Mavlon spends all of his money on food and other necessities. He has to fix his house, for it is very old and needs some major repairs. He is asking for a loan in the amount of 4000 somons to buy building materials, such as cement, lumber, paint, etc. He awaits your kind assistance.

loans.use: To buy building materials such as wood, cement, paint for repairing his house

loans.name: Martha Vanessa

texts.es: Microempresaria de éxito, emprendedora originaria de las ciudad de las flores, tiene 34 años de edad, casada y con dos hijos ella se dedica a un taller de artesanía de madera, desde hace 3 años, cuenta con dos trabajadores asalariados, ella fabrica muebles de cocinas, muebles de sillas abuelitas, roperos, centro de entretenimiento etc. el crédito lo solicita para invertir en materia prima como madera de guapinol, lijas 80, sellador,sener, laca, clavos etc.
texts.en:
Martha is a successful micro-business enterprising woman. She is originally from the city of flowers. She is 34 years old, married and with two children. 
She has had a woodcraft workshop for 3 years and has two employees on a salary. She makes kitchen furniture, traditional rocking chairs, wardrobes, entertainment centers, etc. She needs the loan to invest in raw materials such as Brazilian cherry hardwood, sandpaper, sealer, paint thinner, lacquer, nails, etc.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials such as Brazilian cherry hardwood to build wardrobes, entertainments centers, etc.

loans.name: Razia Group

texts.en:
Razia, 51, lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She has three kids and her husband has operated an automobile workshop for 15 years. They are facing financial problems due to their low monthly income.

Razia has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan. She wants to invest in her husband’s business so that their income and saving will increase. The main purpose of the loan is to allow her husband to buy new tools for repairing and tuning automobiles. The old tools are obsolete and can't be used for work now. His customer base will increase if he has the latest equipment and tools and he can work more efficiently.

In future, with his profits, he wants to expand his workshop by adding some more space to it.

Razia is very hopeful that this loan could solve many problems of her family and she is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for their help.   

NOTE: In the picture Razia is raising her hand

loans.use: to buy new tools for her workshop.

loans.name: Johana Del Carmen

texts.es: Johana es una cliente de éxito tiene 38 años de edad, emprendedora , acompañada , tiene un año de vender ropa nueva y variada, a empleados de empresas privadas, vecinos de su domicilio y ambulante, el crédito lo invertirá en al compra de ropa como pantalón de varon, pantalón de mujer, camisas de varon, camisolines de dama, bóxer de varon, bóxer de dama, shores, blusas etc.
texts.en:
Johana is a successful and enterprising client. She is 38 years old and married. For the past year, Johana has been selling various types of new clothing to employees of private businesses, neighbors near her home, and other customers she encounters as a traveling vendor.

Her loan will be invested in clothing such as men’s trousers, women’s trousers, men’s shirts, women’s camisoles, men’s boxers, women’s boxers, shorts, blouses, and other items.

loans.use: to buy men’s trousers, women’s trousers, men’s shirts, women’s camisoles, men’s boxers, women’s boxers, shorts, blouses, and other items.

loans.name: Arben Sabino

texts.es: Don Arben tiene 53 años de edad, divorciado, tiene 13 años de ser propietario de un taller de carpinterías, tiene 6 trabajadores asalariados. El fabrica muebles de estantes, centro de entretenimiento y ataúdes de muertos, el crédito  lo invertirá en la compra de materia prima como maderas, selladores, galon de sener, cerraduras, tablas, lijas etc.
texts.en:
Don Arben is 53 years old and divorced. For 13 years, he has been the owner of a carpentry workshop where he has six salaried employees. His workshop manufactures shelving, entertainment centers, as well as coffins for the dead.

His loan will be invested in the purchase of raw materials such as wood, sealants, paint thinner by the gallon, locks, boards, sandpaper, and other supplies.

loans.use: to buy wood, sealants, paint thinner, locks, boards, sandpaper, and other supplies.

loans.name: Maura Justina

texts.es: Maura es originaria de las ciudad de Masaya tiene desde hace 18 años tiene una pulpería , es casada tiene dos hijos menores, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de granos como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, carne de res, carne de pollo, huevos, leches, pan, jabon de baño, jabon de lavar, pamper, medicamentos populares, etc.
texts.en:
Maura is originally from the city of Masaya. She has managed a general store for 18 years. Maura is married and has two young children.

Her loan will be invested in the purchase of basic staples such as rice, beans, sugar, oil, beef, chicken, eggs, milk, and bread. She will also buy bath soap, laundry soap, diapers, popular medicines, and other products.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, oil, beef, chicken, eggs, milk, bread, bath soap, laundry soap, diapers, popular medicines, and other products.

loans.name: Edil Richard

texts.es: El señor  Edil tiene 34 años, es una persona sencilla, honesta y muy trabajadora proviene de una familia humilde, por el momento está viviendo en la casa de su madre, con su hermana y otros familiares.  Actualmente se dedica a la actividad de transporte urbano de carretera desde varios años y también realiza trabajos como técnico en electro medicina, en el transcurso del tiempo se ha ganado a sus clientes por el buen servicio y trato que brinda. El señor Edil cuenta con dos hijos de ocho y doce años, los cuales dependen del ingreso del señor edil, ya que su madre se encuentra en otro país. Desde que era joven se dedicó al servicio de transporte urbano de carretera logrando pagar sus estudios, ya que el señor Edil logro alcanzar el grado de técnico en electro medicina. El crédito que está solicitando es para la reparación y mantenimiento de su vehículo.
texts.en:
Sr. Edil is 34 years old. He is a simple, honest, and hardworking individual who comes from a humble family. At the moment, he lives at his mother’s house along with his sister and other relatives. He has been working in the transportation sector for many years, but he also gets jobs working as an electro-medicine technician. Over the course of time, he has gained customers due to the good service and attention he provides. Sr. Edil has two children, ages 8 and 12, who are dependent on him. His mother lives abroad.

At a young age, he wanted to work in the highway transportation business so that he could pay for his studies. Edil was able to complete a technical program in electro-medicine. The loan he is requesting will be used to repair and maintain his vehicle.

loans.use: to pay for vehicle repairs and maintenance.

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en:
This is 25-year-old Mariatu from Tombo which is a western rural area in Sierra Leone. She is married with 1 child, aged 3 years, and one other relative at home. She started her business because her husband is leaving her for another woman. She wants to create a permanent source of income to support her child.    

Mariatu runs a baby clothing business. She sells baby powder, baby clothes and towels. She has been running this business for 3 years. She will start selling door to door to establish her business.  She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and lack of enough capital. 

Mariatu has requested a loan in order to buy different kinds of baby items like baby powder, baby clothes and towels. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her child and improve her status. In the future, she plans to buy a plot of land. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy different kinds of baby items like baby powder, clothes and towels

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 43 years old and is from Nyahururu, Kenya. He is married with eight children who are all in school.

Paul has a business selling firewood and has applied for his first loan from KADET LTD to enable him buy more firewood to add to his stock. He is optimistic that his business will do better after the loan.

He hopes to improve his family's standard of living in the near future.

loans.use: To buy more firewood

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 49 years old and is from Olkalou, Kenya and is married with three children all of whom are in school.

Florence has a farming business that she has been running for many years and has applied for her second loan from KADET LTD to enable her to buy seedlings and fertilizers to use in her farm.

She hopes to improve her family's standard of living and expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizers

loans.name: Shakeela

texts.en:
Shakeela is 38 years old and a hard working and diligent woman. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan along with her husband and six children. Only two of her children are going to school because of financial constraints. She can’t afford the educational expenses for all of them. Her husband is a wood cutter by profession and he has a very low monthly income.

Shakeela is a very responsible and skilled woman. She is using her tailoring skills to generate an additional source of income for her family. She is very experienced in stitching clothes and dresses. She has been doing this work for 5 years. Her clients are very satisfied with her work.
 
Shakeela has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan to expand her business. She wants to open a tailoring business and need to purchase two new sewing machines. Her production and monthly income could be increased by having additional capacity. She would reinvest the profit in her business and also use part of it to pay educational expenses. She desires to send all of her children to school. She is very hopeful that the loan would be helpful for her family.

loans.use: To purchase new sewing machines for her tailoring business

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
This is Evangeline, aged 35 and a resident of Silang, Cavite in the Philippines. She is married to Elmer, a seaman and a father to their children. She and her husband manage their own household. At this time, she is working hard to provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Evangeline oversees operations for their Tricycle transportation business. They have one Tricycle that carries up to four passengers to their destination within the community. In her business the regular customers are the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 every day.

To help her continue operation of her business she is requesting a Php16, 000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy spare parts, accessories and also for the maintenance of their motorcycle. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Evangeline hopes for her business’ continuous growth and good health for her family. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and maintenance of her tricycle unit.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer de 41 años y originaria del estado de Queretaro, llego a Monterrey hace 25 años junto con su esposo, donde se instalaron en un terreno en lo mas alto de una loma en la zona norponiente de esta ciudad, lugar que se llama Lomas de la Unidad Modelo y empezaron a construir su  casa. 
5 años despues de haber llegado, su marido fallecio quedando ella con una pequeña niña de 4 años y desde entonces  para sacar adelante a su hija, se ha dedicado a vender Dulces en la avenida Aztlan, cercano a un centro comercial conocido en la colonia Valle de Topo Chico.  

La Sra. Maria pudo sacar a su hija adelante y hoy en dia es quien le ayuda a atender la venta de los Dulces. Por lo que decidió hace 1 año, emprender un nuevo negocio, la venta de productos naturistas llamado Club Naturista, donde le prepara licuados a clientes que a diario la visitan o invita a los traunseuntes a probar su productos. Con el credito solicitado se ha propuesto incrementar sus ingresos, adquiriendo diferentes productos para la venta dentro de su club. Con estos ingresos adicionales, piensa adquirir su propio local, ya que actualmente se lo prestan, y de esa forma dar un mejor servicio, además de seguir construyendo el patrimonio de su hija.
texts.en:
Maria is a 41-year old woman from the state of Queretaro. She arrived to Monterrey with her husband 25 years ago and they acquired a piece of land in the highest part of a hill in the north west area of the city (called Lomas de la Uidad Modelo). This is where they started to build their home. Five years later, her husband passed away and she had to get ahead and support her 4-year old daughter. She was selling sweets and candies at Aztlan Ave., near a well-known mall called Valle de Topo Chico. 

Maria was able to support her daughter and today she actually helps her with the business. One year ago, she decided to start a new business selling natural products ("Club Naturista"), where she prepares shakes to clients daily and invites pedestrians to try her products. 

The requested loan will help her to increase her income, buying different products to sell inside her club. With this additional income, she plans to buy her own space (instead of borrowing it) and to provide a better service while also keeping to create a patrimony for her daughter.

loans.use: to invest in acquiring goods.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to repair a van for a transport business.

loans.name: Jecinta

texts.en:
Jecinta is 61 years old and is married, with four children who are all in school.

Jecinta used the previous loans well and was able to buy a dairy cow that helped increase her milk production. She has applied for her fourth loan from Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) to enable her to buy a donkey cart to transport water.

She hopes to expand her business in the near future and improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a donkey cart.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
La Sra. María Vive en Orquídeas (Guayaquil), ella tiene  23 años de edad. Ella empezó a realizar estas manualidades con fomix  por curiosidad y le gusto, sus conocidos, vecinos, amigos le hacian pedidos de estas manualidades y así  fue acogiendo clientela y empezó a ganar dinero.

Ella realiza las manualidades con fomix junto a sus amigas y los realizan en diferentes horarios.  Ella no ha tenido ninguna dificultad en su trabajo. Ella no está casada, si tiene 1 hijo que es menor de edad.

Ella usara el préstamo para comprar implementos para realizar sus manualidades y comprar fomix y cartulina. Ella desea para  el futuro poder comprarse una casa, ver crecer a su hijo, y seguir realizando su actividad.
texts.en:
Sra. María is 23 years old and lives in Orquídeas (Guayaquil). She began making handicrafts out of craft foam and enjoyed it. Her acquaintances, neighbors, and friends placed orders for these crafts. She welcomed her customers and began earning money.

María makes foam crafts with her friends, but they work on different schedules. She experiences no difficulties in her work. María is not married and has a child who is one-year-old.

María will use this loan to buy supplies for making her handicrafts, such as craft foam and cardboard. In the future, she wants to buy a house where her child can grow up. She also wants to continue her business.

loans.use: to buy craft foam and cardboard.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy certified seeds so that she can plant her crops.

loans.name: Yabom   T

texts.en:
Meet 28-year-old Yabom from Tombo, in rural western Sierra Leone. She is married and has two children, ages 7 and 5 years. Her children are currently attending school. In 2003, Yabom established her cookery business. She began her business to generate a source of living for her children. She works at the business 10 hours per day and 6 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is when all of the food she cooked for the day is not eaten by customers -- in that case, it will spoil.

Yabom requires a loan in order to buy rice, palm oil and cooking seasonings, to increase her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business further. In the future, Yabom plans to open a more formal restaurant. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy rice, palm oil and cooking seasonings, to increase her business

loans.name: Rosada Group

texts.es: Este grupo está formado por tres socias emprendedoras de éxitos una de ellas es Rosa tiene 43 años de edad, casada, con dos hijos, tiene dos años de dedicarse a vender tortillas en su domicilio, tiene también dos años de ser cliente de la institución, el crédito lo invertirá para la compra de materia prima como maíz por quintal, leña, cal, etc. Rosa Amelia tiene 31 años y su negocio es la venta de huevos y Lucrecia tiene 52 años de edad y vende artesanías.
texts.en:
This group is comprised of three enterprising and successful women.  One of them is Rosa, who is a 43-year-old married woman with two children.  For the past two years, she has been selling tortillas from her home.  She has also been a client of the bank for two years.  She will use the loan funds in order to buy materials such as corn in bulk, firewood, lime and other items.  

Rosa Amelia, another member, is 31 years old and has a business selling eggs.  Lucrecia is 52 and sells crafts.

loans.use: to buy materials such as corn in bulk, firewood, lime and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy goods to add to inventory of the shop.

loans.name: Anjum

texts.en:
Anjum is 37 years old and an independent woman. She has three children, and her husband died six years ago. She has been in business, selling clothing at her house, since her husband's death six years ago. This is the only source of income for her family. Due to large household expenses and Anjum being the sole supporter of her family, she is facing a lot of problems in life.

She has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner, BRAC Pakistan. She wants to expand her business by opening a garment shop in the market, because she is not getting enough customers in her house. She would also buy a greater variety of clothing, including shirts and dresses, to attract more customers. This loan could help her to increase her monthly income and savings, for the better future of her children. With the profit amount, she would pay the pending utility bills of her house.

She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for helping her.

loans.use: To open her clothing business at the public market, and to buy a greater variety of clothing to sell

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 30 years old and married, with one child, one year old. She runs a palm oil business in Tombo, in western, rural Sierra Leone.

To earn a living, she sells palm oil and gari at home. She's been in the business since 2008. Her husband is out of a job, so she has to run a business to have a permanent source of income. She says that the main challenges to her business are business location and finances to run her business. At present, she is struggling to survive.

She requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone Microfinance Company Limited to buy more local foodstuff, like gari and palm oil. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her change her status from a single room to renting a big, residential apartment. In the future, she would like to open a local food store and build a big house. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy more local foodstuff, like gari and palm oil to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 52 years old, from Nyahururu and is married, with five children who are all in school. 

Mary has a business growing green peas. She has applied for her second loan from Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) to enable her to buy more seedlings for planting. She is optimistic that her business will do better, after she receives the loan.

She hopes to improve her standard of living and to be able to diversify into another form of farming in the near future.

loans.use: to buy green peas seedlings.

loans.name: Jhoana Sarai

texts.es:
Jhoana, requiere de un nuevo préstamo para adquirir más inventario por las actividades de la temporada que se acerca. Este le permitirá comprar ropa femenina, blusas, calzonetas, entre otras.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a aumentar sus ingresos y los invirtió en los gastos del hogar. La inversión del crédito que kiva le proporciono le permitió mejorar sus ingresos y fortaleció el negocio; mantiene el mismo grupo familiar y las condiciones están muy bien.
texts.en:
Jhoana needs a new loan in order to get more inventory for the business activities in the coming season.  This will allow her to buy women’s clothes, blouses, and underwear, among others.

The previous loan helped her to increase her income, and she used that for the household expenses.  The investment of the Kiva loan she was given allowed her to improve her income and strengthen her business.  She provides for her family, and they are doing very well.

loans.use: to buy women’s clothes, blouses, and underwear, among others.

loans.name: Jose Andres

texts.es:
José, se dedica a la venta de mariscos. El está casado, tiene dos hijos de edades, 8 y 13 años, todos dependen de él, ya que no posee ayuda del extranjero. Este oficio lo inicio como una fuente principal para el sustento de su familia, lo realiza de 6:00 am a 7:00 pm. 
El préstamo que requiere lo invertirá en la compra de pescado, camarones, conchas, entre otros productos relacionados a ello y posteriormente venderlo. Esto le ayudara a mejorar su negocio, aumentar sus ventas y sus utilidades.
Su objetivo es mejorar el negocio y aumentar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Jose sells seafood.  He's married and has two children, ages 8 and 13, who depend on him since he doesn't have outside help.  He started working in this field as a primary means of supporting his family and works from 6:00 am to 7:00 pm.  He will use the money from this loan to buy fish, shrimp, shellfish, and other things to sell.  This will help him improve his business and increase his sales and utility.

His objective is to improve his business and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Nargis

texts.en:
Nargis is a 29-year-old, hardworking woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her husband, two sons, and one daughter. All of her children are currently studying in primary school. Her husband is a laborer, but his income is not enough to meet the household expenses.

Nargis is a very hardworking and responsible woman. By stitching clothes, she helps her husband meet the family's needs and her children's educational expenses. She has been operating her business very efficiently and honestly for the past four years, and her clients always appreciate her work.

Nargis has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner, BRAC Pakistan. With the loan amount, she will purchase a new sewing machine so that she can work more efficiently in the future, and her production could be increased. As she is living in a rented house with her family, she dreams of building her own house. She also desires to expand her business and provide quality education to her children. With the profit amount from this loan, she will pay her house rent. Nargis and her family are very much thankful to both BRAC Pakistan and Kiva, for their support.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine and to stitch more clothes

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 50-year-old Isatu, from Tombo, in the western, rural area of the country. She is widowed and has six children between the ages of 13 and 32 years. Two of her children are attending school. 

Isatu runs a local food business; she sells coconut, rice and gari. She has been running this business since 2001. She works at the business 10 hours per day and 7 days per week.  Isatu says that the main challenge to her business is the poor road network in her area of operation.

Isatu has requested a loan, which she will use to buy more coconut, rice and gari, to increase her business. The extra income from this loan will allow her to have a permanent business location and educate her children. In the future, she plans to open a shop. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more coconut, rice and gari, and to increase her business.

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en:
Cherry is a 36-year-old, married woman and mother of three young children, from Carlos P. Garcia, Bohol. Cherry manages a motorcycle transport business; her husband drives the motorcycle, transporting passengers. She is also engaged in seaweed farming.
 
Cherry is asking for a loan to buy seaweed seedlings and fuel for the motorcycle. With this loan, she will be able to improve her business, thus augmenting her profit and income.

loans.use: to buy seaweed seedlings and fuel for the motorcycle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy zippers, buttons, thread, among other sewing products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy larger quantities of rice, sugar, meat and dairy products.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es: Julio de 23 años de edad vive en San Jacinto y se dedica a la actividad comercial, desde que dejó de ser empleado de una empresa y su liquidación la invirtió en la compra de productos como carnes frías y gaseosas, para venderlos en un mercado doméstico, ubicado a su alrededor. Con esta actividad ha logrado obtener ingresos, para responder a sus gastos personales y poder estudiar Ingeniería de Sistemas, de manera semi- presencial. Su meta más adelante es tener una bodega adecuada, para convertirse en un distribuidor de productos fríos, comprando en grandes volúmenes y así mismo terminar su carrera profesional. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, segundo financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, porque su mercado requiere más productos cárnicos y refrescos  como gaseosas, agua y bebidas, con ello aumentaría sus ventas y poco a poco le permitirá ir escalando su crecimiento y principalmente el logro de sus metas.
texts.en:
Julio, 23 years old, lives in San Jacinto and has worked in sales since his employment at another business ended. He invested his severance pay into buying products such as frozen meat and soft drinks with plans to sell them in the local market. With this work, he has been able to earn income that has helped him manage personal expenses and study Systems Engineering in a hybrid program (both online and in person).

His primary goal is to have a suitable store to become a distributor of frozen goods by buying in large volumes. He also wants to finish his professional studies. He is currently applying for a Kiva loan, which is his second with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, because his market is in need of more meat products and drinks such as soda, water, and other beverages. With these items, he will increase his sales and this will slowly allow him to grow his business and achieve his goals.

loans.use: to buy meat products and drinks such as soda, water, and other beverages

loans.name: Qaisra

texts.en: Qaisra is a 30-year-old woman living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her family. Her family consists of her husband and 3 children. Qaisra has excellent embroidery skills. She provides embroidery services in her community, and all of her clients appreciate her work. Presently, she is in need of purchasing cloth, needles, lace, and a variety of stones and threads for her business. For that she has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan. She is currently living in a rented house, so she wishes to purchase her own house in the future. She is hopeful that the loan will be a helpful one for her family.

loans.use: To purchase embroidery items like colored threads, cloth, etc.

loans.name: Dufashanye Ii Group

texts.fr:
Rénilde fait partie du groupe Dufashanye  et est une des victimes de  l’incendie du marché central de Bujumbura. Elle est client  de Turame depuis  1 année. Elle  habite à  Bujumbura. Elle est mariée à  J. Baptiste. Ensemble ils ont 6 enfants  âgés de 5 à 15 ans, dont 5  étudient.

Elle faisait le commerce du  riz et du haricot  au marché central de Bujumbura. Elle  a perdu des marchandises d’une valeur de  600 000Fbu (384,61$) par l’incendie.

 Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle  obtient, elle va  reconstituer  son capital en achetant du riz et du haricot à revendre, pour continuer de gagner sa vie.
texts.en:
Rénilde, a member of the Dufashanye group, is one of the victims of the fire that devastated the central market of Bujumbura.  She has been a client of Turame for one year.  She lives in Bujumbura and is married to a man named J. Baptiste.  Rénilde and J. Baptiste have six children between the ages of 5 and 15.  Five of the couple's children go to school.

Rénilde used to sell rice and beans at the central market in Bujumbura.  She lost merchandise valued at 600,000Fbu ($384.61) in the fire.

With the loan that she is receiving from KIVA, she will rebuild her capital through the purchase of rice and beans that she will resell to continue to make a living.

loans.use: to increase her capital through the purchase of rice and beans that she will resell in order to continue to make a living.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac used the previous loan well and was able to buy seedlings and fertilizers that he used on his farm. He is married with one child.

Isaac is applying for his third loan from KADET LTD to enable him to buy more seedlings, fertilizers and insecticides for use in his farm. He is optimistic that his business will do better after the loan.

He hopes to expand his business in the near future.

loans.use: To buy seedlings, fertilizer, and insecticides

loans.name: Hasan

texts.ru: Хасан молодой и энергичный человек. Ему 20 лет. Он не женат и живет с родителями. Хасан более 2 года занимается услугой такси. Он преподносит услуги такси местным жителям и имеет своих постоянных клиентов. Хасан мечтал после окончания школы поступить в университет и получить высшее образование, но по семейным обстоятельствам ему пришлось работать и помогать отцу по домохозяйству. Хасан очень общительный человек и ему нравится общаться со многими людьми. Он планирует установить газ на свою машину. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 800 долларов США. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Hasan is a young and energetic 20-year-old man. He's single and lives with his parents. For the past two years, he has made a living as a taxi driver. He works locally and has regular customers. 

He had a dream of attending college after graduating high school, but due to a difficult financial situation he had to work and help his father. Hasan is a very outgoing person and loves to socialize. He's asking for a loan in order to convert his car to run on natural gas. He hopes for your assistance.

loans.use: To convert his taxi to run on natural gas.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Meet 29-year-old Isatu from Tombo, in the Western Area Rural District of Sierra Leone. She is married with 1 child, age 1. Her husband is a fisherman, but his income is not enough to support the home. She began her business because she did not go to school and her mother trained her in business.

In 2008, Isatu established her provisions business. She works at the business every day from morning to night. She described herself as a hardworking woman who desires to educate her child but she sometimes faces difficulties with expired goods.

Isatu requires a loan in order to buy more provisional items like milk, sugar and biscuits. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business to a shop level. In the future, Isatu plans to build a house. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more provision items like milk, sugar and biscuits.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 50-year old Fatmata from Tombo of the Western Rural Area District. She is married with three children between the ages of 9 and 27 years. Two of her children are attending school. 

Fatmata runs a little table business at home: she sells cigarettes, soap, milk, gari and sugar. She has been running this business for 4 years. She works at the business 8 hours a day, 7 days a week. Her major challenge is insufficient capital to run her business. 

Fatmata has requested a loan in order to buy more general stock like cigarettes, soap, milk, gari and sugar. The extra income from this loan will allow her to change their living conditions by having the means to eat daily. In the future, she plans to change her business from a small box to a shop. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more general stock like cigarettes, soap, milk, gari and sugar.

loans.name: Stephen's Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) is very pleased to present to you this group of teachers from the eastern city of Koidu, Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of 3,800,000 Sierra Leonean Leones in order to meet their immediate and most pressing financial needs. And at the end of each month, they can easily repay the loan, using their monthly salaries.

Sahr (who is pictured on the left) is the leader of this group. Born in Sawolla, in eastern Sierra Leone, Sahr is married to a farmer and the couple has 5 children – 3 in primary school, 2 in secondary school and 1 grown-up. Sahr has requested this loan in order to buy house building materials – cement, paint, etc. for the construction of a house.

loans.use: to buy house building materials – cement, paint, etc. - for the construction of a house.

loans.name: Marisa Yanira

texts.es:
Marisa, se dedica a la venta de ropa. Ella es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos de edades de 8 y 12 años; el negocio lo inicio como sustento y apoyo para la familia, ya que no posee ayuda del extranjero. 
El préstamo que necesita lo invertirá en la compra de prendas tales como: camisas,  chores, pantalones, entre otros. Esto le ayudara a mejorar sus inventarios de ropa y aumentar sus ventas.
Su objetivo es mejorar el negocio y darle una mayor estabilidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Marisa sells clothing.  She's a single mother and has two children, ages 8 and 12.  She started this business so that she could sustain and support the family, since she doesn't have any outside help.

She needs this loan in order to buy clothing such as shirts, shorts, pants, and other things.  This will help her to increase her clothing inventory and increase her sales.

Her objective is to improve her business and provide better stability to her family.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Solangi Group

texts.es: Socias emprendedoras que formaron un grupo de tres socias una de ellas es María que tiene 55 años de edad , soltera con un hijo,  tiene 20 años de dedicarse a comprar cosechas de frutas de temporadas, de ser clientes de la institución tiene dos años, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de frutas de temporadas como son 8 árboles de mangos por flotas en la semana santa, este producto es bien apetecido por nuestras sociedad y como manjar en la elaboración de un plato típico como es el almíbar. Lizet que es la otra socia tiene 45 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de ropa nueva y Cinthya tiene 24 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de legumbres.
texts.en: These are enterprising partners who formed a communal bank comprised of three members. One of them is 55-year-old María, who's single and has a son. She has been buying in-season fruit crops for 20 years, and she's been a client of the institution for two years. She'll use the loan to purchase in-season fruits such as eight trees' worth of mangoes during the Holy Week. This product is very appetising to our society and it's used as a delicacy for making traditional dishes such as fruit syrup. Lizet is another member. She's 45 years old and her business is selling new clothing. Cinthya is 24 years old and her business is selling vegetables.

loans.use: to purchase in-season fruits such as eight trees' worth of mangoes.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone. This is 38-year-old Kadiatu from Tombo, Western Area Rural District near Freetown. She is divorced, with three children between the ages of 3 and 10 years. Two of her children attend school. She started this business to take care of her family and to give her children a quality education.

Kadiatu runs a cookery business at Tombo Market; she has been running this business since 2009. She works at the business 7 days a week: she starts at 4:30 am and doesn't rest until the food is finished. Her sister usually helps her run her business. At present she is facing difficulties with price inflation of foodstuffs.

Kadiatu has requested a loan in order to buy a wider variety of foodstuffs like rice and cooking seasoning. The extra income from this loan will allow her to pay her installment and educate her children. In the future, she plans to expand her business to a restaurant. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy a wider variety of foodstuffs like rice and cooking seasoning.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy clothes for selling on profits

loans.name: Crispino

texts.en: Crispino is a 60-year-old married man and father of two grown-up children, from Ubay, Bohol. He has been involved in the rice farming business for more than 40 years now. This is the source of his income. Crispino is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. Through this loan, Crispino will be able to improve his business and make it a success. He dreams of expanding his rice field so that it will produce more good harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm.

loans.name: Brenda Azucena

texts.es:
Brenda, se dedica a la venta de ropa para damas. Ella está casada y tiene 24 años de edad, disfruta de dos hijos de edades de 3 y 6 años; viven en casa propia, esto lo hace para ayudar a su esposo y obtener los ingresos para mantener el hogar.  Este oficio lo realiza de lunes a sábado  de 9:00 am a 3:00 pm, lo aprendió por iniciativa propia, ya cuenta con 2 años de poseerlo.
El préstamo que necesita lo invertirá en la compra de ropa interior femenina y blusas. Esto lo permitirá incrementar  el inventario de mercadería y sus ingresos, mejorar la calidad de la ropa.    
Su objetivo es optimizar el negocio para aumentar sus ingresos y darle una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Brenda sells women's clothing.  She's married, is 24 years old and has two children, ages 3 and 6.  She is a homeowner and does this in order to help her husband earn income to sustain the household.  She works Monday through Saturday from 9:00 am to 3:00 pm.  She taught herself the business and has been doing this for two years.

She needs this loan to buy undergarments and blouses.  This will allow her to increase her inventory and income, and improve the quality of her merchandise.  Her objective is to optimize her business in order to increase her income and provide a better quality of life to her children.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Cris

texts.en: Cris has owned and operated a tricycle transport business for more than three years now. He is asking for a loan to pay for the repair and maintenance of the tricycle. With this, he will be able to maintain the good working condition of the vehicle. In the future, Cris hopes to make his business a success. He also plans to explore another venture to augment his earnings.

loans.use: to pay for the repair and maintenance of his tricycle.

loans.name: Jacques

texts.en:
Jacques is 43 years old and is married with five children, who are aged between 8 and 17 years old. He owns a business selling cows. Jacques has eight years experience and he works from 7 a.m. to 12 a.m. every day except in the weekend. He currently employs four people to help him. 

Jacques has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more cows to re-sell. Through this expansion, Jacques will be able to earn more profits, which he will use to re-invest in his business, to save money for his future and to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to purchase more cows to re-sell.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
La señora Marina de 55 años y es madre soltera tiene una hija bajo su responsabilidad, es  originaria de Veracruz  tiene ya mas de 30 años radicando en la ciudad de Nuevo Laredo. Es empleada del consulado de la ciudad en el aria administrativo desde hace 20 años. La señora Marina esta solicitando un crédito KIVA para la impermeabilización del techo de su casa ya que esta en muy malas condiciones y necesita realizar la mejora antes de que llegue la temporada de lluvias y se le moje todas sus muebles.
Desea mejorar el patrimonio de su hija y que esta en buenas condiciones y así podrán evitar enfermedades.
Con una parte del sueldo que recibe de su trabajo será para pagar el crédito y que es la fuente de ingreso que tiene para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Marina is 55 years old, is a single mother and has a daughter whom she cares for.  She is originally from Veracruz and has been living in Nuevo Laredo for more than 30 years.  She's been working as a city manager for 20 years.  Marina is asking for this Kiva loan in order to waterproof the roof of her house because it's in very bad shape and she needs to make these repairs before the rainy season so that her furniture does not get wet.  She wants to improve her daughter's room so that it's in good condition so and she will avoid getting sick.

She will use part of her salary to repay the loan.  This is her source of income with which to get ahead.

loans.use: to repair her roof.

loans.name: Maia

texts.en:
Maia is 33 years old. She lives in the capital city of Georgia, Tbilisi, with her 36-year-old husband, George. Maia requested a loan from local financial institutions several times to start-up the family business, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected every time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions.

Maia is an English language teacher. She gives private lessons and earns a small, monthly income. Her husband George is an artisan. He carries out private renovation orders and fixes floors.

Maia requested a loan from Credo to start a family business. Her loan request was approved through the new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-start-up credits with soft conditions for people from the country and rural areas that are poor and who do not have access to credit products, and who are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With the credit, Maia will purchase second-hand clothes at wholesale prices to resell for profit. She wants to start trading to earn additional income for the family. With the profits, she will develop the business and purchase more second-hand clothes. Maia hopes her trading will be successful and she will earn a good income for the family to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase second-hand clothes.

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en:
This is Mariatu from Tombo, Sierra Leone. She is in her early forties, and is married with four children between the ages of 11 years and 20 years.

Mariatu runs a wood business within her community. She started this business when her husband lost his job and he became a wood cutter.  She works at the business 10 hours per day, 7 days per week. She describes her major problems as transportation and poor road networks within her operating area. 

Mariatu has requested a loan in order to buy more wood to expand her business. The extra income from this loan will allow her to change her business to a provision store. In the future, she plans to build a big house. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy more wood to expand her business.

loans.name: Desiree

texts.en:
Desiree is a 30-year-old married woman from Carlos P. Garcia, Bohol. She has been operateing a motorcycle transport business for several years now with her husband. 

Desiree is asking for a loan to buy spare parts for their motorcycle, such as wheel tires, nuts and bolts and lubricating fluid. With this, they will be able to improve and maintain the working performance of the vehicle. 

In the future, Desiree hopes of improving their livelihood and she dreams of exploring another venture to increase their income.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for their motorcycle, such as wheel tires, nuts and bolts and lubricating fluid.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Isatu is 40 years old and is married to a fisherman. They have three children, aged between 10 and 18 years old. She runs a cookery business within her community in Tombo, which is in western rural Sierra Leone.

She started this business around 1990 so that her her family could have enough to eat each day. When her husband's boats arrive, she also helps him to sell fish on the wharf. She said she is usually faced with a loss when the food is not all sold.

She requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy palm oil, cooking oil, rice, and cooking seasoning. She says that the extra income generated from this loan will help her to pay her childrens' education. In the future, she would like to change her business to a general merchandise store. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy palm oil, cooking oil, rice, and cooking seasoning.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy embroidery material and equipment for her embroidery business.

loans.name: Diano

texts.en:
Diano is a fisherman from the town of Ubay, Bohol. He is has been in the fishing business for more than two years now. This is the source of his income.

Diano is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and buckets. With this, he will be able to improve his catch, which will give him more fish to sell in the market.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and buckets for his fishing business.

loans.name: Maria Del Pilar

texts.es:
Ella es  María del pilar es la menor de 2 hermanas. Estudio  toda su colegiatura en un muy buen colegio donde conoció grandes amistades y compañeros.
Actualmente tiene 19 años y esta estudiando contabilidad financiera  en la corporación donde ha obtenido muchos conocimientos los cuales nunca pensó que podría entender, ha  conocido muchas personas amables y los docentes son muy buenos y amables, le gustan los números por eso escogió esta carrera y espera más adelante poder graduarse de contaduría.
Le gusta hablar con amigas, practicar deportes como:
Fútbol, voleibol, correr y tenis. Le gusta el color azul, rojo y verde, le encanta pasar la mayoría de tiempo con sus padres y  hermanas, pasear, jugar, reír y hablar porque después se convierten en los recuerdos más bellos que puede pasar.
Le gusta estar comiendo paquetes, dulces, helados, le encanta comer mucha comida chatarra más que la comida de sal y odia las verduras porque ella considera que  no tienen buen sabor, prefiere comer pollo y pastas.
Cuando termine su carrera en contaduría, espera viajar a muchos países para ejercer lo aprendido en estos lugares y aprender cada día más de cada país y dejar también una huella, a los 30 años desea tener una casa en donde pueda vivir con su familia que estará conformada por un esposo y dos hijos, un niño y una niña. Darles la mejor de las enseñanzas y que aprendan a valorar todo lo que tienen y con lo cuentan porque para salir adelante, lo importante es nunca dejar el pasado y enseñarles el respeto y amor por la familia. Espera ser muy muy pero muy feliz en todo lo que me queda de vida.
texts.en:
This is María del Pilar, the youngest of two sisters. Throughout her entire schooling, she attended a very good school where she met great friends and classmates.
She's currently 19 years old and studying financial accounting. She studies in an institution where she has obtained a great deal of knowledge which she never thought she could grasp. She has also met several friendly people, and the teachers are very good and friendly. She likes numbers, so that's why she chose this career. She hopes to someday get a degree in accounting.
She enjoys talking to friends and practicing sports such as soccer, volleyball, running and tennis. She likes the colors blue, red and green. She greatly enjoys spending most of her time with her parents and her sister, going for a stroll, playing games, laughing and talking. Later on, these become the most beautiful memories she could have.
She likes to eat chips, candy and ice cream. She enjoys eating a lot of junk food rather than prepared meals. Also, she hates vegetables because she thinks they don't taste good, and she'd rather have chicken and pasta.
Once she finishes studying accounting, she hopes to travel to a lot of countries in order to put what she learned to practice in these locations. She also hopes to learn more about each country every day, and make her mark. At age 30 she hopes to own a house where she can live with her family which will be comprised of a husband and two children, a boy and a girl. She'll provide them with the best possible education and teach them how to appreciate everything they have and own, because in order to get ahead it's important to never forget the past. She'll teach them to respect and love their family. She hopes to be "very, very, so very happy in my entire remaining life".

loans.use: to complete her education program in financial accounting.

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en:
Mariatu is 40 years old and single with four children, aged between 10 years and 20 years, two of whom are currently in school. She runs little box business in Tombo, in rural western Sierra Leone. 

Mariatu has been in this business since 2005, selling milk, biscuits, and sugar. She also receives income from her elder daughter (who got married at an early age) because she doesn’t have anyone else to help her take care of the home. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to run the business.

She requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy food commodities like milk, biscuits and sugar. Mariatu says that the extra income from this loan will help her take care of the home and pay school fees for her younger children. In the future, she would like to open a big shop and send her children to university. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy food commodities like milk, biscuits and sugar.

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
La señora Graciela de 61 años, originaria de la ciudad de Tamaulipas viuda con un hijo bajo su responsabilidad el cual esta estudiando una carrera profesional. Tiene 5 años dedicándose a la costura elabora vestidos de novias, quinceañeras, vestidos para eventos sociales, uniformes escolares y de empresas. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo para la compra de matrería prima que es telas, hilos y botones. Ya que tiene unos pedidos de uniformes que entregar pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para la compra de materia ya que no quiere descapitalizar el ingreso del negocio y así podrá entregar el pedido de los uniformes a tiempo.
Con las ganancias que obtiene se sus trabajos como costurera es para pagar el crédito, con la pensión que recibe por viudez es para los gastos familiares y escolares de su hijo.
Desea mejorar su calidad de vida y que su negocio cresta como empresa para que pronto pueda ayudar otras mujeres dándoles empleo y que puedan aprender un oficio.
texts.en:
Graciela is 61 years old and was born in the city of Tamaulipas. She is a widow supporting a son who is studying for a professional career. For the last 5 years she has dedicated herself to her work as a dressmaker, creating dresses for brides and for the celebrations of 15-year-olds, plus dresses for social events, and uniforms for schools and companies.

Graciela is soliciting a loan to purchase primary materials, including cloth, thread, and buttons. She currently has orders for uniforms to complete but she lacks the money needed to buy materials. She doesn't want to decapitalize the business's income, and she wishes to deliver the uniforms on time. 

With the earnings she will obtain from her work as a dressmaker Graciela will repay the loan. Her family expenses and her son's educational costs will be paid from her widow's pension.

Graciela wishes to improve her quality of life and to expand her business as an enterprise that will soon be able to help other women, providing them with employment while helping them learn a job skill.

loans.use: to buy primary materials for her clothes making business.

loans.name: Mgeni

texts.en:
Mgeni is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She operates a soft drink selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a challenge of seasonality and high cost of transporting raw materials. 

With the Kshs 15,000 she wants to purchase sacks of coconut, mangoes, and passion fruit. She decided to join Kiva's partner Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts, mangoes, and passion fruit.

loans.name: Abdul's Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are teachers of a primary school located in Koidu, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. This group of teachers has come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org to apply for a loan of 7,000,000.00 Sierra Leonean Leones for the entire team. With the help of this loan, they can meet their immediate and most pressing financial needs. And at the end of each month, they can easily repay the loan, using their monthly salaries. It is their school’s bursar who is directly responsible for doing the deductions and making the repayments on their behalf.

Abdul (who is pictured in the right) is the featured leader of this group. The 39-year-old is a native of Koaquima, in eastern Sierra Leone. He is married to a house wife and the couple have three children – two are in primary school and one is in secondary school. Abdul has been a school teacher for fifteen years now. 

Abdul has requested a loan in order to pay school fees for his children and plans to use the rest of the loan to buy house building materials, such as iron corrugated sheets, nails, cement, etc. for the construction of a dwelling house.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children, and to buy house building materials such as iron corrugated sheets, nails, cement, etc. for the construction of a dwelling house.

loans.name: Fidelina

texts.es:
Doña Fidelina es una mujer luchadora con 57 años de edad feliz mente casada por más de 30 años que de su matrimonio tiene 4 hijos de los cuales 2 de ellos son mayores y 2 son menores los cuales estudian en diferentes grados de educación primaria y dependen de ella. Bajo su techo vive su nuera la cual no tiene hijos aun y ayuda con los oficios domésticos y otras actividades que a diario se realizan en el hogar. Doña Fidelina tiene un grado de educación de primaria no completado el cual pudo cursar hasta el 2 grado y no pudo continuar por falta de apoyo económico ya que sus padres son de bajos recursos. Fueron ellos los que le enseñaron la agricultura desde muy joven ella se dedica al cultivo de plátanos actividad que ha sido en su familia único medio de ingreso desde hace muchos años y que en la actualidad sigue siéndolo. Las tierras que ella trabaja son propias gracias al esfuerzo de años puesto por ella y su esposo. Su producto es comercializado en la zona donde ella habita en pulpería, aldeas cercanas a la comunidad y otros ya que sus cultivos son de calidad y de buen tamaño mismos que están ubicados a 3 kilómetros de su casa de habitación al cual se trasladan en vestía y se involucran su esposo y sus 2 hijos para su mantenimiento y cuido.

Actualmente solicita ayuda para la compra de abono y otros insumos que mantienen sano y seguro su producto de cualquier plaga o enfermedad que deteriore su cultivo.  

Su meta es tener una amplia plantación de plátanos que sea la mejor de la zona para que de esa forma pueda obtener ingresos y poder empezar un nuevo proyecto como ser el cultivo de café ya que la zona es apta por su clima, su tierra sana y fértil. Sus sueños son de poder graduar a sus 2 hijos menores a nivel universitario y que ellos continúen con el proyecto para que sea más próspero y sea pasado de generación en generación.
texts.en:
Fidelina is a hardworking, 57-year-old woman. She's been happily married for over 30 years, and from her marriage she has four children, two of whom are adults and two are underage. The underage children attend different grades in elementary school and depend on her. Her daughter-in-law lives under her roof; she doesn't have any children yet and she helps with domestic chores and other daily household activities. Fidelina has an incomplete elementary school level education. She studied up to the second grade and couldn't go on due to a lack of financial support, since her parents have a low income. They were the ones who taught her to work in agriculture from a very young age. She grows plantains, a business that has been the only source of income for her family for several years and still is to this day. She owns the land where she works, thanks to the years of efforts from herself and her husband. Her produce is sold in grocery stores in the area where she lives, in villages near that community and other locations, since her crops are high quality and have good size. Her crops are located three kilometers from her home, and they ride animals to get there. Her husband and two of her children are involved in maintaining and nurturing the crops.

She's currently requesting support to purchase compost and other supplies in order to keep her produce healthy and safe from any pests or diseases that may damage the crop.

Her goal is to own a large plantain farm that is the best one in the area. That way she'll be able to turn a profit and start a new project such as a coffee crop. The area is suitable for that because of the weather and the healthy, fertile soil. Her dream is to be able to have her two younger children graduate from college and keep the business going so that it will grow more prosperous and be handed down from generation to generation.

loans.use: to purchase compost and other supplies for her plantain trees.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Kuña Guapa está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas están empezando a trabajar y a aprender en compañerismo. Ellas son mujeres jefas de familia que quieren salir adelante.
 La Sra. Zunilda, es una de las miembros, ella también es la presidenta, comenta que es despensera, y que tiene en venta artículos en general, además de eso productos de primera necesidad. Tiene un negocio bien surtido y que gracias a su esfuerzo está creciendo.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de carne, verduras, frutas, enlatados, leche y demás, ya que estos son los productos que más vende y quiere tener bien surtido su negocio.
texts.en: The Kuña Group is in its first loan cycle. This collection of women all are working hard and are learning to work together. These women are heads of their households and want to make headway. The group's president, Zunilda, is a storekeeper and sells general supplies as well as products of primary need. She has a well-stocked business that is growing thanks to her hard work. She is requesting the loan to be able to invest in the purchase of meat, vegetables, fruits, canned goods, milk and other items, since these are the products she sells the most and she wants to keep her store well supplied.

loans.use: to purchase meat, vegetables, fruits, canned goods, milk and other items.
